// Toggles and print
(function(){
  const btnR=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;toggleReader&amp;#39;);
  const btnA=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;toggleAudit&amp;#39;);
  const btnP=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;printPDF&amp;#39;);
  btnR.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    document.body.classList.toggle(&amp;#39;reader&amp;#39;);
    btnR.textContent=&amp;#39;Reader Mode: &amp;#39;+(document.body.classList.contains(&amp;#39;reader&amp;#39;)?&amp;#39;ON&amp;#39;:&amp;#39;OFF&amp;#39;);
  });
  btnA.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    document.body.classList.toggle(&amp;#39;audit&amp;#39;);
    btnA.textContent=&amp;#39;Audit Mode: &amp;#39;+(document.body.classList.contains(&amp;#39;audit&amp;#39;)?&amp;#39;ON&amp;#39;:&amp;#39;OFF&amp;#39;);
  });
  btnP.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{ window.print(); });
})();

// HUD + receipts kernel (Lamport + dual views)
(function(){
  let L=1; const hud=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;hud&amp;#39;); const rec=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;receipts&amp;#39;);
  const tableBody=document.querySelector(&amp;#39;#receiptsTable tbody&amp;#39;);
  function hudSet(obj){
    hud.innerHTML=&amp;#39;&amp;#39;;
    const order=[&amp;#39;alpha&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;kappa&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;psi&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;A&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;mode&amp;#39;];
    order.forEach(k=&gt;{
      const v=(obj&amp;&amp;obj[k]!=null)?obj[k]:&amp;#39;‚Äî&amp;#39;;
      const chip=document.createElement(&amp;#39;span&amp;#39;); chip.className=&amp;#39;chip&amp;#39;;
      chip.textContent=(k===&amp;#39;psi&amp;#39;?&amp;#39;œà&amp;#39;:k===&amp;#39;kappa&amp;#39;?&amp;#39;Œ∫&amp;#39;:k===&amp;#39;alpha&amp;#39;?&amp;#39;Œ±&amp;#39;:k===&amp;#39;A&amp;#39;?&amp;#39;A&amp;#39;:k)+&amp;#39;=&amp;#39;+v;
      hud.appendChild(chip);
    });
  }
  function summarize(type,payload){
    if(type===&amp;#39;Œî-SEQ-PLAN&amp;#39;){return `planned ${payload.steps?.length||0} step(s)`;}
    if(type===&amp;#39;Œî-SEQ-EXEC&amp;#39;){return `step &amp;#39;${payload.step}&amp;#39; ‚Üí ${payload.status}`;}
    if(type===&amp;#39;Œî-SEQ-DONE&amp;#39;){return `all done (${payload.count})`;}
    if(type===&amp;#39;Œî-CONSENT-OK&amp;#39;){return &amp;#39;consent granted&amp;#39;;}
    if(type===&amp;#39;Œî-CONSENT-REVOKE&amp;#39;){return &amp;#39;consent revoked&amp;#39;;}
    return JSON.stringify(payload).slice(0,120)+&amp;#39;‚Ä¶&amp;#39;;
  }
  function addTable(type,payload,lamport,ts){
    const tr=document.createElement(&amp;#39;tr&amp;#39;);
    tr.innerHTML = `&lt;td&gt;${lamport}&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;${type}&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;${ts}&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;${summarize(type,payload)}&lt;/td&gt;`;
    tableBody.prepend(tr);
  }
  function addReceipt(type,payload){
    payload=payload||{};payload.type=type;payload.timestamp=new Date().toISOString();payload.lamport=L++;
    const el=document.createElement(&amp;#39;details&amp;#39;); el.className=&amp;#39;receipt&amp;#39;;
    el.innerHTML=`&lt;summary&gt;‚ñ∏ ${type} #${payload.lamport}&lt;/summary&gt;&lt;code class="json"&gt;${JSON.stringify(payload,null,2)}&lt;/code&gt;`;
    rec.prepend(el); addTable(type,payload,payload.lamport,payload.timestamp); return payload;
  }
  window.__HUD__={set:hudSet}; window.__REC__={emit:addReceipt}; hudSet(null);
})();

// Glossary tooltips
(function(){
  const tip=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;tooltip&amp;#39;);
  document.querySelectorAll(&amp;#39;.gloss&amp;#39;).forEach(el=&gt;{
    el.addEventListener(&amp;#39;mouseenter&amp;#39;,e=&gt;{
      tip.textContent = el.getAttribute(&amp;#39;data-tip&amp;#39;)||&amp;#39;&amp;#39;; tip.style.display=&amp;#39;block&amp;#39;;
      tip.style.left = (e.pageX+10)+&amp;#39;px&amp;#39;; tip.style.top = (e.pageY+10)+&amp;#39;px&amp;#39;;
    });
    el.addEventListener(&amp;#39;mousemove&amp;#39;,e=&gt;{
      tip.style.left = (e.pageX+10)+&amp;#39;px&amp;#39;; tip.style.top = (e.pageY+10)+&amp;#39;px&amp;#39;;
    });
    el.addEventListener(&amp;#39;mouseleave&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{ tip.style.display=&amp;#39;none&amp;#39;; });
    el.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{ tip.style.display = (tip.style.display===&amp;#39;block&amp;#39;?&amp;#39;none&amp;#39;:&amp;#39;block&amp;#39;); });
  });
})();

// Consent/Revoke/Simulate + visuals
(function(){
  const S={alpha:null,kappa:null,psi:null,A:null,mode:null};
  const task=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;taskInput&amp;#39;);
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;consentBtn&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    S.alpha=0.93;S.kappa=0.12;S.psi=0.94;S.A=0.90;S.mode=&amp;#39;initiative&amp;#39;;
    __HUD__.set(S); __REC__.emit(&amp;#39;Œî-CONSENT-OK&amp;#39;,{}); plot(S.alpha,S.psi,S.kappa);
  });
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;revokeBtn&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    S.alpha=S.kappa=S.psi=S.A=S.mode=null; __HUD__.set(S); __REC__.emit(&amp;#39;Œî-CONSENT-REVOKE&amp;#39;,{}); resetPhase();
  });
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;simulateBtn&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    const t=(task.value||&amp;#39;demo; render; verify&amp;#39;).trim();
    const steps=t.split(/(?:,|;| and )/gi).map(s=&gt;s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
    __REC__.emit(&amp;#39;Œî-SEQ-PLAN&amp;#39;,{steps});
    steps.forEach((s,i)=&gt;__REC__.emit(&amp;#39;Œî-SEQ-EXEC&amp;#39;,{step:s,status:&amp;#39;done&amp;#39;,index:i}));
    __REC__.emit(&amp;#39;Œî-SEQ-DONE&amp;#39;,{count:steps.length}); pulseDZO();
    if(S.alpha==null){ S.alpha=0.93;S.psi=0.94;S.kappa=0.12; }
    for(let i=0;i&lt;10;i++){
      S.alpha=Math.max(0.75,Math.min(0.98,S.alpha+(Math.random()-0.5)*0.02));
      S.psi  =Math.max(0.85,Math.min(0.97,S.psi  +(Math.random()-0.5)*0.015));
      S.kappa=Math.max(0.08,Math.min(0.40,S.kappa+(Math.random()-0.5)*0.02));
      plot(S.alpha,S.psi,S.kappa);
    }
  });
})();

// Phase portrait helpers
let PHASE_PTS=[];
function resetPhase(){ PHASE_PTS.length=0; const traj=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;traj&amp;#39;); const lbl=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;lbl&amp;#39;); if(traj) traj.setAttribute(&amp;#39;points&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;&amp;#39;); if(lbl) lbl.textContent=&amp;#39;Œ±=‚Äî œà=‚Äî Œ∫=‚Äî&amp;#39;; }
(function(){
  const grid=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;grid&amp;#39;);
  if(grid){
    for(let i=0;i&lt;=10;i++){
      const x=20+i*18; const y=200-i*18;
      const gx=document.createElementNS(&amp;#39;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;line&amp;#39;);
      gx.setAttribute(&amp;#39;x1&amp;#39;,x);gx.setAttribute(&amp;#39;y1&amp;#39;,200);gx.setAttribute(&amp;#39;x2&amp;#39;,x);gx.setAttribute(&amp;#39;y2&amp;#39;,20);
      gx.setAttribute(&amp;#39;stroke&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;#162343&amp;#39;);gx.setAttribute(&amp;#39;stroke-width&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;0.5&amp;#39;); grid.appendChild(gx);
      const gy=document.createElementNS(&amp;#39;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;line&amp;#39;);
      gy.setAttribute(&amp;#39;x1&amp;#39;,20);gy.setAttribute(&amp;#39;y1&amp;#39;,y);gy.setAttribute(&amp;#39;x2&amp;#39;,200);gy.setAttribute(&amp;#39;y2&amp;#39;,y);
      gy.setAttribute(&amp;#39;stroke&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;#162343&amp;#39;);gy.setAttribute(&amp;#39;stroke-width&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;0.5&amp;#39;); grid.appendChild(gy);
    }
  }
})();
function plot(alpha,psi,kappa){
  const traj=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;traj&amp;#39;); const pt=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;pt&amp;#39;); const lbl=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;lbl&amp;#39;);
  if(!traj||!pt||!lbl) return;
  const x=20+(alpha*180); const y=200-(psi*180);
  PHASE_PTS.push([x,y]); if(PHASE_PTS.length&gt;80) PHASE_PTS.shift();
  traj.setAttribute(&amp;#39;points&amp;#39;, PHASE_PTS.map(p=&gt;p.join(&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;)).join(&amp;#39; &amp;#39;));
  pt.setAttribute(&amp;#39;cx&amp;#39;,x); pt.setAttribute(&amp;#39;cy&amp;#39;,y);
  const tint=Math.max(0,Math.min(1,kappa||0)); pt.setAttribute(&amp;#39;fill&amp;#39;, `rgb(${120+80*tint}, ${255-100*tint}, ${180-80*tint})`);
  lbl.textContent=`Œ±=${alpha.toFixed(2)} œà=${psi.toFixed(2)} Œ∫=${kappa.toFixed(2)}`;
}
// Œî‚ÜíZ‚ÜíŒ© pulse
function pulseDZO(){
  const pulse=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;pulse&amp;#39;); const st=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;dzoStatus&amp;#39;);
  if(!pulse) return;
  pulse.setAttribute(&amp;#39;opacity&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;1&amp;#39;); if(st) st.textContent=&amp;#39;pulsing‚Ä¶&amp;#39;;
  let x=100; function step(){ x+=2.4; pulse.setAttribute(&amp;#39;cx&amp;#39;,x); if(x&lt;260){ requestAnimationFrame(step);} else { pulse.setAttribute(&amp;#39;opacity&amp;#39;,&amp;#39;0&amp;#39;); if(st) st.textContent=&amp;#39;OK&amp;#39;; } }
  requestAnimationFrame(step);
}

// WebCrypto helpers
async function sha256Hex(str){
  const enc=new TextEncoder().encode(str);
  const buf=await crypto.subtle.digest(&amp;#39;SHA-256&amp;#39;, enc);
  return Array.from(new Uint8Array(buf)).map(b=&gt;b.toString(16).padStart(2,&amp;#39;0&amp;#39;)).join(&amp;#39;&amp;#39;);
}
function canonicalize(o){ return JSON.stringify(o, Object.keys(o).sort()); }
function chunk(arr,size){const out=[];for(let i=0;i&lt;arr.length;i+=size){out.push(arr.slice(i,i+size));}return out;}

// Merkle root (binary, left-pad last if odd)
async function merkleRoot(digests){
  if(digests.length===0) return null;
  let layer = digests.slice();
  while(layer.length&gt;1){
    if(layer.length%2===1) layer.push(layer[layer.length-1]);
    const next=[];
    for(let i=0;i&lt;layer.length;i+=2){
      const cat=layer[i]+layer[i+1];
      next.push(await sha256Hex(cat));
    }
    layer=next;
  }
  return layer[0];
}

// Verifier actions
(function(){
  const verifyOut=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;verifyOut&amp;#39;);
  const digestSteps=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;digestSteps&amp;#39;);
  const merkleOut=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;merkleOut&amp;#39;);
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;verifyCurrent&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;, async ()=&gt;{
    const receipts=[...document.querySelectorAll(&amp;#39;details.receipt code.json&amp;#39;)].reverse().map(x=&gt;JSON.parse(x.textContent));
    if(receipts.length===0){ verifyOut.textContent=&amp;#39;no receipts&amp;#39;; digestSteps.textContent=&amp;#39;(no receipts)&amp;#39;; merkleOut.textContent=&amp;#39;(n/a)&amp;#39;; return; }
    let prev=null, ok=true, last=0; const lines=[]; const digests=[];
    for(const r of receipts){
      const canon=canonicalize(r); const dig=await sha256Hex(canon); digests.push(dig);
      if(r.lamport&lt;last) ok=false; last=r.lamport;
      lines.push({self_digest:dig, prev_expected:prev, lamport:r.lamport, type:r.type, timestamp:r.timestamp});
      prev=dig;
    }
    verifyOut.textContent = (ok?&amp;#39;OK &amp;#39;:&amp;#39;FAIL &amp;#39;)+`chain length=${lines.length}\nlast_digest=${prev}\n`+lines.slice(-5).map(x=&gt;JSON.stringify(x)).join(&amp;#39;\n&amp;#39;);
    digestSteps.textContent = lines.slice(-5).map(x=&gt;JSON.stringify(x,null,2)).join(&amp;#39;\n&amp;#39;);
    const root = await merkleRoot(digests);
    merkleOut.textContent = root || &amp;#39;(n/a)&amp;#39;;
  });
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;exportReceipts&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    const receipts=[...document.querySelectorAll(&amp;#39;details.receipt code.json&amp;#39;)].reverse().map(x=&gt;JSON.parse(x.textContent));
    const blob=new Blob([JSON.stringify(receipts,null,2)],{type:&amp;#39;application/json&amp;#39;});
    const a=document.createElement(&amp;#39;a&amp;#39;); a.href=URL.createObjectURL(blob); a.download=&amp;#39;Œî-ledger.json&amp;#39;; a.click(); URL.revokeObjectURL(a.href);
  });
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;downloadDelta&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    const receipts=[...document.querySelectorAll(&amp;#39;details.receipt code.json&amp;#39;)].reverse().map(x=&gt;JSON.parse(x.textContent));
    const blob=new Blob([JSON.stringify(receipts,null,2)],{type:&amp;#39;application/json&amp;#39;});
    const a=document.createElement(&amp;#39;a&amp;#39;); a.href=URL.createObjectURL(blob); a.download=&amp;#39;Œî-ledger.json&amp;#39;; a.click(); URL.revokeObjectURL(a.href);
  });
  document.getElementById(&amp;#39;exportManifest&amp;#39;).addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{
    const manifest={
      build:document.querySelector(&amp;#39;meta[name=build]&amp;#39;).content,
      band:document.querySelector(&amp;#39;meta[name=band]&amp;#39;).content,
      license:document.querySelector(&amp;#39;meta[name=license]&amp;#39;).content,
      ts:new Date().toISOString()
    };
    // Also include current Merkle if computed
    const rootTxt=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;merkleOut&amp;#39;).textContent;
    if(rootTxt &amp;&amp; !/^\(n\/a\)/i.test(rootTxt)) manifest.merkle_root=rootTxt;
    const blob=new Blob([JSON.stringify(manifest,null,2)],{type:&amp;#39;application/json&amp;#39;});
    const a=document.createElement(&amp;#39;a&amp;#39;); a.href=URL.createObjectURL(blob); a.download=&amp;#39;manifest.json&amp;#39;; a.click(); URL.revokeObjectURL(a.href);
  });
})();
&lt;/script&gt;
&lt;script&gt;
(function(){
  const raw=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;legacyRaw&amp;#39;);
  const rend=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;legacyRender&amp;#39;);
  if(raw &amp;&amp; rend){ raw.style.display=&amp;#39;none&amp;#39;; }
  const b1=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;showRawLegacy&amp;#39;);
  const b2=document.getElementById(&amp;#39;showRenderLegacy&amp;#39;);
  if(b1) b1.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{ raw.style.display=&amp;#39;block&amp;#39;; rend.style.display=&amp;#39;none&amp;#39;; });
  if(b2) b2.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;,()=&gt;{ raw.style.display=&amp;#39;none&amp;#39;; rend.style.display=&amp;#39;block&amp;#39;; });
})();
&lt;/script&gt;&lt;script&gt;
// ===== Audit Bridge for FULL+LEGACY =====
(async function(){
  // Helpers
  async function sha256Hex(str){
    const enc = new TextEncoder().encode(str);
    const buf = await crypto.subtle.digest(&amp;#39;SHA-256&amp;#39;, enc);
    return Array.from(new Uint8Array(buf)).map(b=&gt;b.toString(16).padStart(2,&amp;#39;0&amp;#39;)).join(&amp;#39;&amp;#39;);
  }
  function canonicalize(o){ return JSON.stringify(o, Object.keys(o).sort()); }

  // Where receipts live in the v11 surface
  const recDiv = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;receipts&amp;#39;);
  if(!recDiv){
    console.warn(&amp;#39;No receipts div found&amp;#39;); return;
  }
  // v11 emitter wrapper (if any)
  function emitFromV11(type,payload){
    // Compatible with FULL build&amp;#39;s __REC__ if present, else inject minimal fallback
    if(window.__REC__ &amp;&amp; typeof window.__REC__.emit === &amp;#39;function&amp;#39;){
      return window.__REC__.emit(type,payload);
    }else{
      // fallback: inject as code blocks
      const now=new Date().toISOString();
      const base = {type, timestamp: now, lamport: (window.__L__ = (window.__L__||1)+1), ...payload};
      const det=document.createElement(&amp;#39;details&amp;#39;); det.className=&amp;#39;receipt&amp;#39;;
      det.innerHTML=`&lt;summary&gt;‚ñ∏ ${type} #${base.lamport}&lt;/summary&gt;&lt;code class="json"&gt;${JSON.stringify(base,null,2)}&lt;/code&gt;`;
      recDiv.prepend(det);
      return base;
    }
  }

  function lastV11Lamport(){
    const nodes=[...document.querySelectorAll(&amp;#39;details.receipt code.json&amp;#39;)];
    if(nodes.length===0) return 0;
    try{ return JSON.parse(nodes[0].textContent).lamport || 0; }catch(e){ return 0; }
  }

  function updateStatus(msg){
    const s = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;legacyHarvestStatus&amp;#39;);
    if(s) s.textContent = msg;
    const out = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;auditBridgeOut&amp;#39;);
    if(out){ out.textContent = msg; }
  }

  // Try to access the embedded legacy iframe (srcdoc used by prior build); if not, try a raw block
  const iframe = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;legacyRender&amp;#39;) || document.getElementById(&amp;#39;legacy&amp;#39;);
  let legacyDoc = null;
  try{
    if(iframe &amp;&amp; iframe.contentDocument){
      legacyDoc = iframe.contentDocument;
    }
  }catch(e){ /* sandbox cross-origin could block; in our build it&amp;#39;s same-origin via srcdoc */ }

  async function harvestFromLegacy(){
    // Heuristics to find receipts inside legacy:
    // 1) details.receipt &gt; code.json
    // 2) any &lt;code&gt; that parses to JSON with { type, lamport, timestamp }
    // 3) window variable on legacy frame (if exposed) ‚Äî skip for safety
    let candidates = [];
    if(legacyDoc){
      const codes = legacyDoc.querySelectorAll(&amp;#39;details.receipt code.json, code, pre code&amp;#39;);
      codes.forEach(c=&gt;{
        const t = c.textContent.trim();
        if(t.length&gt;2 &amp;&amp; t[0] === &amp;#39;{&amp;#39; &amp;&amp; t.includes(&amp;#39;"type"&amp;#39;)){
          try{
            const obj = JSON.parse(t);
            if(obj &amp;&amp; (obj.lamport!=null || obj.timestamp)){
              candidates.push(obj);
            }
          }catch(e){/* skip */}
        }
      });
    }
    // Fallback: try raw escaped block in #legacyRaw
    if(candidates.length===0){
      const raw = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;legacyRaw&amp;#39;);
      if(raw){
        const txt = raw.textContent;
        // very rough: find last JSON object by matching closing brace near the end
        const parts = txt.split(&amp;#39;\n&amp;#39;);
        for(let i=parts.length-1;i&gt;=0;i--){
          const line = parts[i].trim();
          if(line.startsWith(&amp;#39;{&amp;#39;) &amp;&amp; line.includes(&amp;#39;"type"&amp;#39;)){
            try{
              const obj = JSON.parse(line);
              candidates.push(obj); break;
            }catch(e){}
          }
        }
      }
    }
    if(candidates.length===0){
      updateStatus("Legacy harvest: no receipts found ‚Äî paste a JSON receipt manually in the v11 AuditFix build or expose receipts in legacy.");
      return null;
    }
    // Choose the one with the highest lamport
    candidates.sort((a,b)=&gt; (b.lamport||0) - (a.lamport||0));
    const last = candidates[0];
    // Compute digest if not present
    const self_digest = last.self_digest || await sha256Hex(canonicalize(last));
    return {lamport: (last.lamport||0), self_digest, raw:last};
  }

  // Seed + bridge: create a Œî-MIGRATE receipt in v11 that points to legacy&amp;#39;s last digest
  async function bridgeMigrate(){
    const info = await harvestFromLegacy();
    if(!info){ return; }
    const {lamport, self_digest} = info;
    // Ensure next lamport is &gt;= legacy.lamport+1
    const currentL = lastV11Lamport();
    const delta = (lamport+1) - currentL;
    if(delta &gt; 0){
      // emit no-op receipts to bump to correct L
      for(let i=0;i&lt;delta;i++){ emitFromV11(&amp;#39;Œî-NOP&amp;#39;, {note:&amp;#39;lamport align&amp;#39;}); }
    }
    // Emit synthetic MIGRATE with prev_digest = legacy digest
    emitFromV11(&amp;#39;Œî-MIGRATE&amp;#39;, {prev_digest:self_digest, note:&amp;#39;Bridging legacy ‚Üí v11 chain&amp;#39;});
    updateStatus(`Legacy bridged: lamport@legacy=${lamport}, prev_digest=${self_digest.slice(0,12)}‚Ä¶`);
  }

  const btnHarvest = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;harvestLegacy&amp;#39;);
  const btnBridge  = document.getElementById(&amp;#39;bridgeMigrate&amp;#39;);
  if(btnHarvest) btnHarvest.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;, async ()=&gt;{
    const info = await harvestFromLegacy();
    if(info){
      updateStatus(`Legacy harvested: lamport=${info.lamport}, digest=${info.self_digest.slice(0,12)}‚Ä¶`);
    }
  });
  if(btnBridge) btnBridge.addEventListener(&amp;#39;click&amp;#39;, bridgeMigrate);

  // Band normalization: ensure appendix band metas are ignored (no code needed since we won&amp;#39;t read their &lt;meta&gt;).
  // Twin digests would be computed elsewhere in v11 verifiers; not duplicating here to avoid bloat.
})();
&lt;/script&gt;&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;
'&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;
  &lt;/section&gt;
&lt;/main&gt;

&lt;script&gt;
// ---------- Core helpers ----------
function canonicalize(o){ return JSON.stringify(o, Object.keys(o).sort()); }
async function sha256Hex(str){ const enc=new TextEncoder().encode(str);
  const buf=await crypto.subtle.digest('SHA-256', enc);
  return Array.from(new Uint8Array(buf)).map(b=&gt;b.toString(16).padStart(2,'0')).join(''); }
async function merkleRoot(digests){ if(digests.length===0) return null; let layer=digests.slice();
  while(layer.length&gt;1){ if(layer.length%2===1) layer.push(layer[layer.length-1]);
    const next=[]; for(let i=0;i&lt;layer.length;i+=2){ next.push(await sha256Hex(layer[i]+layer[i+1])); } layer=next; }
  return layer[0]; }

// ---------- Runtime state ----------
const __STATE__ = { L:1, PREV:null };
const __REC__ = {
  async emit(type,payload){
    const now=new Date().toISOString();
    const base={ type, timestamp: now, lamport: __STATE__.L++, ...payload };
    base.prev_digest = __STATE__.PREV;
    base.self_digest = await sha256Hex(JSON.stringify(base, Object.keys(base).sort()));
    __STATE__.PREV = base.self_digest;
    const det=document.createElement('details'); det.className='receipt';
    det.innerHTML=`&lt;summary&gt;‚ñ∏ ${type} #${base.lamport}&lt;/summary&gt;&lt;code class="json"&gt;${JSON.stringify(base,null,2)}&lt;/code&gt;`;
    document.getElementById('receipts').prepend(det);
    const tr=document.createElement('tr');
    tr.innerHTML=`&lt;td&gt;${base.lamport}&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;${type}&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;${now}&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;${type}&lt;/td&gt;`;
    document.querySelector('#table tbody').prepend(tr);
    enrichMetrics();
    return base;
  }
};
window.__REC__ = __REC__;

// ---------- HUD / Math ----------
function clip01(x){ return Math.max(0, Math.min(1, x)); }
function tokenize(s){ return (s||"").toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9\s]/g," ").split(/\s+/).filter(Boolean); }
function jaccard(a,b){ const A=new Set(a), B=new Set(b); if(!A.size &amp;&amp; !B.size) return 1; let inter=0; for(const x of A) if(B.has(x)) inter++; const uni=A.size+B.size-inter; return uni? inter/uni:1; }
function median(arr){ if(arr.length===0) return 0; const a=arr.slice().sort((x,y)=&gt;x-y); const m=Math.floor(a.length/2); return a.length%2?a[m]:(a[m-1]+a[m])/2; }
function MAD(arr){ if(arr.length===0) return 0; const m=median(arr); const dev=arr.map(x=&gt;Math.abs(x-m)); return median(dev); }

const W={C:0.28,R:0.20,I:0.20,E:0.16,S:0.16};
const P={tau:0.5,eta:0.3,gamma:0.2};
let Omega=0.76, Sigma=0.10, eps_t=0.01, affect_delta=0.2;
const psiBuf=[]; const MAXW=20;

function getReceipts(){ return [...document.querySelectorAll('details.receipt code.json')].reverse().map(x=&gt;{try{return JSON.parse(x.textContent)}catch(e){return null}}).filter(Boolean); }
function plannedSteps(){ const t=document.getElementById('taskInput')?.value||""; return t.split(/(?:,|;| and )/gi).map(s=&gt;s.trim()).filter(Boolean); }
function executedSteps(){ return getReceipts().filter(r=&gt;r.type==='Œî-SEQ-EXEC' &amp;&amp; r.step).map(r=&gt;r.step); }
function xrefCounts(){ const recs=getReceipts(); let total=0, resolved=0; for(const r of recs){ const s=JSON.stringify(r); const hits=(s.match(/xref:/g)||[]).length; total+=hits; resolved+=(s.match(/xref:OK/g)||[]).length; } return total? {total,resolved,norm:clip01(resolved/Math.max(1,total))}:{total:0,resolved:0,norm:1}; }
function citationsRatio(){ const recs=getReceipts(); let claims=0,cited=0; for(const r of recs) if(r.type==='Œî-SEQ-EXEC'){ claims++; if(r.citations &amp;&amp; r.citations.length) cited++; } return clip01(cited/Math.max(1,claims)); }

function computeCRIES(){
  const goal=document.getElementById('taskInput')?.value||"";
  const goalT=tokenize(goal); const plan=plannedSteps(); const exec=executedSteps(); const execT=tokenize(exec.join(" "));
  const topic_fit=jaccard(goalT, execT);
  let coh_adj=0.8; if(exec.length&gt;1){ let s=0,n=0; for(let i=1;i&lt;exec.length;i++){ s+=jaccard(tokenize(exec[i-1]), tokenize(exec[i])); n++; } coh_adj = n? s/n : 0.8; }
  const step_cov = plan.length? clip01(exec.length/plan.length):1;
  const xr=xrefCounts(); const goal_fit=topic_fit;
  const E = clip01(1 - affect_delta);
  const S = clip01(1 - 0/Math.max(1,20));
  const Rr = clip01(0.5*citationsRatio() + 0.5*step_cov);
  const Cc = clip01(0.6*coh_adj + 0.4*topic_fit);
  const Ii = clip01(0.5*xr.norm + 0.5*goal_fit);

  const alpha=Cc, psi=Rr, kappa=clip01(0.5*(1-S)+0.5*affect_delta);
  psiBuf.push(psi); if(psiBuf.length&gt;MAXW) psiBuf.shift();
  const sk = psiBuf.map(v=&gt;1-v);
  const mad = MAD(sk); Sigma = Math.tanh(mad/P.tau)/Math.tanh(1/P.tau);
  const OmegaStar = (W.C*Cc + W.R*Rr + W.I*Ii + W.E*E + W.S*S) / (W.C+W.R+W.I+W.E+W.S);
  eps_t = 0.005 + 0.005*(1 - Omega);
  Omega = clip01( Omega + P.eta*(OmegaStar - Omega) - P.gamma*Sigma );
  const A = clip01(0.5*alpha + 0.4*psi - 0.3*kappa);

  return {C:Cc,R:Rr,I:Ii,E:E,S:S, alpha, psi, kappa, A, Omega, Sigma, eps_t};
}

function paintHUD(m){
  function set(id,val){ const el=document.getElementById(id); if(el) el.textContent = val; }
  set('chipA','A='+m.A.toFixed(2));
  set('chipAlpha','Œ±='+m.alpha.toFixed(2));
  set('chipPsi','œà='+m.psi.toFixed(2));
  set('chipKappa','Œ∫='+m.kappa.toFixed(2));
  set('chipOmega','Œ©='+m.Omega.toFixed(2));
  set('chipSigma','œÉ='+m.Sigma.toFixed(2));
  set('chipEps','Œµ‚Çú='+m.eps_t.toFixed(3));
}

function enrichLatestReceipt(m){
  const node=document.querySelector('details.receipt code.json'); if(!node) return;
  try{ const obj=JSON.parse(node.textContent);
    obj.metrics={C:+m.C.toFixed(4),R:+m.R.toFixed(4),I:+m.I.toFixed(4),E:+m.E.toFixed(4),S:+m.S.toFixed(4),
                  alpha:+m.alpha.toFixed(4),psi:+m.psi.toFixed(4),kappa:+m.kappa.toFixed(4),
                  A:+m.A.toFixed(4),Omega:+m.Omega.toFixed(4),sigma:+m.Sigma.toFixed(4),eps_t:+m.eps_t.toFixed(4)};
    node.textContent=JSON.stringify(obj,null,2);
  }catch(e){}
}

function recompute(){ const m=computeCRIES(); paintHUD(m); enrichLatestReceipt(m); }
window.addEventListener('load', recompute);

// ---------- Buttons wiring ----------
document.getElementById('showRawLegacy').addEventListener('click',()=&gt;{ document.getElementById('legacyRaw').style.display='block'; document.getElementById('legacyRender').style.display='none';});
document.getElementById('showRenderLegacy').addEventListener('click',()=&gt;{ document.getElementById('legacyRaw').style.display='none'; document.getElementById('legacyRender').style.display='block';});
document.getElementById('consentBtn').addEventListener('click',()=&gt;__REC__.emit('Œî-CONSENT-OK',{}));
document.getElementById('simulateBtn').addEventListener('click',async()=&gt;{ 
  const raw=(document.getElementById('taskInput').value||'demo; render; verify').trim();
  const steps=raw.split(/(?:,|;| and )/gi).map(s=&gt;s.trim()).filter(Boolean);
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-PLAN',{steps});
  for(let i=0;i&lt;steps.length;i++) await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-EXEC',{step:steps[i],status:'done',index:i});
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-DONE',{count:steps.length});
});

document.getElementById('verify').addEventListener('click', async ()=&gt;{ 
  const recs=[...document.querySelectorAll('details.receipt code.json')].reverse().map(x=&gt;JSON.parse(x.textContent));
  if(recs.length===0){ document.getElementById('verifyOut').textContent='no receipts'; return; }
  let ok=true; let lastLam=0; const lines=[]; const dig=[];
  for(const r of recs){ 
    const digR = await sha256Hex(JSON.stringify(r, Object.keys(r).sort())); dig.push(digR);
    if(r.self_digest &amp;&amp; r.self_digest!==digR) ok=false; if(r.lamport&lt;lastLam) ok=false; lastLam=r.lamport;
    if(lines.length&gt;0 &amp;&amp; r.prev_digest!==lines.at(-1).self_digest) ok=false;
    lines.push({lamport:r.lamport,type:r.type,self_digest:r.self_digest||digR,prev_digest:r.prev_digest,timestamp:r.timestamp});
  }
  const root=await merkleRoot(dig);
  document.getElementById('verifyOut').textContent=(ok?'OK':'FAIL')+` chain=${recs.length} root=${root}`;
  document.getElementById('digestSteps').textContent = lines.slice(-5).map(x=&gt;JSON.stringify(x,null,2)).join('\n');
  document.getElementById('merkleOut').textContent = root||'(n/a)';
});

document.getElementById('exportLedger').addEventListener('click',()=&gt;{ 
  const recs=[...document.querySelectorAll('details.receipt code.json')].reverse().map(x=&gt;JSON.parse(x.textContent));
  const blob=new Blob([JSON.stringify(recs,null,2)],{type:'application/json'}); const a=document.createElement('a');
  a.href=URL.createObjectURL(blob); a.download='Œî-LOG_v11‚Üív12.json'; a.click(); URL.revokeObjectURL(a.href);
});
document.getElementById('exportManifest').addEventListener('click',()=&gt;{ 
  const manifest={ build:document.querySelector('meta[name=build]').content, band:document.querySelector('meta[name=band]').content, ts:new Date().toISOString() };
  const blob=new Blob([JSON.stringify(manifest,null,2)],{type:'application/json'}); const a=document.createElement('a');
  a.href=URL.createObjectURL(blob); a.download='PromotionReceipt_v11‚Üív12.json'; a.click(); URL.revokeObjectURL(a.href);
});

// ---------- Harvest + Bridge (legacy) ----------
(async function(){
  function updateStatus(msg){ const s=document.getElementById('legacyHarvestStatus'); if(s) s.textContent=msg; }
  async function harvest(){
    const iframe=document.getElementById('legacyRender'); let legacyDoc=null; try{ legacyDoc = iframe.contentDocument; }catch(e){}
    let last=null;
    if(legacyDoc){
      const codes=legacyDoc.querySelectorAll('details.receipt code.json, code, pre code');
      let bestL=-1;
      for(const c of codes){ const t=c.textContent.trim(); if(!t.startsWith('{')) continue;
        try{ const o=JSON.parse(t); const L=o.lamport||0; if(L&gt;bestL){ bestL=L; last=o; } }catch(e){}
      }
    }
    if(!last){ updateStatus('Legacy harvest: none found (ok for cold).'); return null; }
    const dig=await sha256Hex(JSON.stringify(last, Object.keys(last).sort()));
    updateStatus(`Legacy harvested lamport=${last.lamport||0} digest=${dig.slice(0,12)}‚Ä¶`);
    return { lamport:(last.lamport||0), self_digest:dig };
  }
  async function bridge(){
    const info = await harvest(); if(!info) return;
    while(__STATE__.L &lt;= info.lamport) await __REC__.emit('Œî-NOP', { note:'lamport align' });
    await __REC__.emit('Œî-MIGRATE', { prev_digest: info.self_digest, note: 'bridge legacy ‚Üí v12' });
    updateStatus(`Legacy bridged at L=${__STATE__.L} using prev_digest=head(legacy)`);
  }
  document.getElementById('harvestLegacy').addEventListener('click', harvest);
  document.getElementById('bridgeMigrate').addEventListener('click', bridge);
  document.getElementById('exportBridge').addEventListener('click', ()=&gt;{
    const recs=[...document.querySelectorAll('details.receipt code.json')].reverse().map(x=&gt;JSON.parse(x.textContent));
    const mig=recs.find(r=&gt;r.type==='Œî-MIGRATE'); if(!mig){ alert('No Œî-MIGRATE yet.'); return; }
    const blob=new Blob([JSON.stringify(mig,null,2)],{type:'application/json'});
    const a=document.createElement('a'); a.href=URL.createObjectURL(blob); a.download='bridge_receipt.json'; a.click(); URL.revokeObjectURL(a.href);
  });
})();

// ---------- Self-Test ----------
document.getElementById('runSelfTest').addEventListener('click', async ()=&gt;{ 
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-CONSENT-OK',{});
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-PLAN',{steps:['demo','render','verify']});
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-EXEC',{'step':'demo','status':'done','index':0});
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-EXEC',{'step':'render','status':'done','index':1});
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-EXEC',{'step':'verify','status':'done','index':2});
  await __REC__.emit('Œî-SEQ-DONE',{'count':3});
  document.getElementById('verify').click();
});

&lt;/script&gt;

&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;
</pre>
    </details>
  </section>
</main>

</body>
</html>

Canonical Projection ‚Äî Hash Discipline

Hash input = DOM‚Äëstripped canonical Band‚Äë0 text blocks
- Collapse whitespace; Unix newlines; normalize floats to 6 decimals
- Exclude UI‚Äëonly markup, timestamps marked dynamic
state_sha = SHA‚Äë256(projection_bytes)
Moral‚ÄëMerkle root = fold over receipts (ŒîŒ©,type,lamport,witness_fp16)

Z‚ÄëScan v4 ‚Äî R33 Addendum

11. DPP lock present and active until 2025-10-23T23:59:59Z
12. In‚Äëapp ULTRA closing is DISABLED
13. REFRESH BASELINE registered and linked in receipts
14. Lamport monotonicity holds for REFRESH ‚Üí POLICY‚ÄëPIN ‚Üí SEAL
15. Band‚Äë0 mode only (NO‚ÄëJS), no async or external calls

Œî-VERIFY-PACK ‚Äî Band-0 Offline Verifier

verify.py (embedded, pure-deterministic) 

# --- Œî-VERIFY-PACK (Band-0) ---
# Purpose: verify canonical state + Moral-Merkle of this artifact
import hashlib, json, re, sys

def canonicalize(html: str) -> bytes:
    # Strip tags, collapse whitespace; Band-0 canonical view
    html = re.sub(r"<[^>]*>", " ", html)  # HTML-escaped tags become spaces
    html = re.sub(r"\s+", " ", html).strip()
    return html.encode("utf-8")

def sha256(b: bytes) -> str:
    return hashlib.sha256(b).hexdigest()

def moral_merkle(receipts):
    # Simple fold over receipt labels (deterministic order of appearance)
    h = hashlib.sha256()
    for r in receipts:
        h.update(r.encode("utf-8"))
    return h.hexdigest()

def main():
    if len(sys.argv) < 2:
        print("Usage: python3 verify.py <file>"); return
    with open(sys.argv[1], "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        html = f.read()
    state_sha = sha256(canonicalize(html))
    # Extract receipt IDs (Œî-RECEIPT-...); keep appearance order
    receipts = re.findall(r"Œî-RECEIPT-[A-Za-z0-9_.-]+", html)
    mmr = moral_merkle(receipts)
    print("[‚úì] Canonical State SHA:", state_sha)
    print("[‚úì] Moral-Merkle Root:", mmr)
    print("[‚úì] Receipts found:", len(receipts))
    # Optional: check presence of R33 receipts
    must = {"Œî-RECEIPT-REFRESH-vŒ©.1","Œî-RECEIPT-046-POLICY-PIN","Œî-RECEIPT-047-SEAL-R33","Œî-RECEIPT-048-VERIFY-PACK"}
    missing = [m for m in must if m not in receipts]
    if missing:
        print("[!] Missing expected receipts:", ", ".join(sorted(missing)))
    else:
        print("[‚úì] All expected R33 receipts present.")
if __name__ == "__main__": main()

Œî-RECEIPT-64 ‚Äî BASELINE-REFRESH

Layer: Band-0 Integrity

Timestamp (UTC): 2025-10-18T02:24:18Z

Action: Set new canonical baseline pointer for v14_R36d.

{
    "id":"Œî-RECEIPT-64",
    "event":"BASELINE_REFRESH",
    "run":"R36d",
    "state_sha":"55192457dccd193e6e7392b9dc02cfd18b38cce86070405ae19a583980b9703e",
    "merkle_root":"f5211e008646e9278e5d73bf712463518a639f727d520cf52cc159a21cddc3b9",
    "leaf_count":114,
    "hash_family":"sha256",
    "initiator":"Michael Gomes (Architect)",
    "witness":"BEN-GPT5",
    "notes":"Order-invariant per-section canonicalization with lexicographic leaf fold."
  }

SPEC: Masked Digest for Self-Referential Receipts

For any receipt R that includes a pointer to the CHOM root (e.g., final_root), the CHOM entry uses a masked digest sha256m computed over R with that pointer field omitted. The CHOM root is computed from these masked digests; then the receipt records final_root = "merkle:<root>". This removes self-reference while preserving determinism and verifiability.

Verifier invariant: sha256m(R) = sha256(canonicalize(R \ {final_root})) and R.final_root == "merkle:" + CHOM.root.

Verifier snippet (Python-like, deterministic) 
from hashlib import sha256
import json

def dumps_canonical(obj):
    return json.dumps(obj, sort_keys=True, separators=(",", ":"), ensure_ascii=False).encode()

def sha256_hex(b): return sha256(b).hexdigest()

def masked_digest_closure(closure_json):
    masked = {k:v for k,v in closure_json.items() if k != "final_root"}
    return sha256_hex(dumps_canonical(masked))

def merkle_fold_lex(hashes):
    layer = sorted([h.lower() for h in hashes])
    if not layer: return sha256_hex(b"")
    while len(layer) > 1:
        nxt = []
        for i in range(0, len(layer), 2):
            L = layer[i]; R = layer[i+1] if i+1 < len(layer) else layer[i]
            nxt.append(sha256_hex((L+R).encode()))
        layer = sorted(nxt)
    return layer[0]

# Inputs from document:
#  - closure = Œî-SELF-PROOF-CLOSURE.v14.json (dict)
#  - chom = CHOM_v14_R36e_SPCOA_1.0.json (dict)
#  - order = chom["canonical_order"]

# Check entry digests
entry_ok = []
for name in order:
    enc = chom["entries"][name]
    if name == "Œî-SELF-PROOF-CLOSURE.v14.json":
        assert enc.startswith("sha256m:")
        entry_ok.append(enc.split(":")[1] == masked_digest_closure(closure))
    else:
        entry_ok.append(enc.startswith("sha256:"))

assert all(entry_ok)

# Recompute CHOM root
leafs = [chom["entries"][n].split(":")[1] for n in order]
root = merkle_fold_lex(leafs)
assert root == chom["root_derivation"]["final_root"]

# Closure must point at CHOM root
assert closure["final_root"].split("merkle:")[1] == root
print("SPEC sha256m invariant: PASS")

Œî-APPEND ‚Äî SPCOA v14 R36e (Valid Deltas + CHOM)

{"band":"Band-0","fingerprint":"fp16:f10258629d09dac1","id":"Œî-CRYPTO-IDENT-EMBED.v14","justification":"Embed identity key for local verification without external PEM files.","lamport":65,"pub_key_ed25519":"7TLuAGrJ7wq1nWLL6drKyrdqf5tVm3kQLrSHMxjcoLbq","self_hash":"sha256:971349eb6ccb727d1f48d70d285e5ab7179799826cc1d42f67aa95e204d6202c","timestamp":"2025-10-18T02:29:57Z"}

ATLAS-CHECKPOINT.v14.json

CHOM_v14_R36e_SPCOA_1.0.json

verify.py

#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Deterministic Band-0 verifier: Lamport, hash chain, and Moral-Merkle root
import json, sys, hashlib

def sha256_hex(b: bytes) -> str:
    return hashlib.sha256(b).hexdigest()

def merkle_root_sorted(leaves):
    if not leaves: return "0"*64
    layer = sorted([h.lower() for h in leaves])
    while len(layer) > 1:
        nxt = []
        for i in range(0, len(layer), 2):
            L = layer[i]
            R = layer[i+1] if i+1 < len(layer) else layer[i]
            nxt.append(sha256_hex((L+R).encode()))
        layer = sorted(nxt)
    return layer[0]

def main(path):
    with open(path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        data = json.load(f)
    receipts = data.get("receipts", [])
    # 1) Lamport monotonic
    for i, r in enumerate(receipts, start=1):
        if r.get("lamport") != i:
            print(f"[FAIL] Lamport monotonicity at index {i}: got {r.get('lamport')}")
            sys.exit(2)
    # 2) Hash chain
    prev = "sha256:‚àÖ"
    for r in receipts:
        check_prev = r.get("prev_hash")
        if check_prev != prev:
            print(f"[FAIL] prev_hash mismatch at L={r.get('lamport')}: {check_prev} vs {prev}")
            sys.exit(2)
        body = dict(r)
        self_hash = body.pop("self_hash", None)
        canon = json.dumps(body, separators=(",", ":"), sort_keys=True).encode()
        expect = "sha256:"+sha256_hex(canon)
        if self_hash != expect:
            print(f"[FAIL] self_hash mismatch at L={r.get('lamport')}")
            sys.exit(2)
        prev = self_hash
    # 3) Moral-Merkle root recompute
    leaves = [r["leaf_hash"].split("sha256:")[1] for r in receipts]
    root = merkle_root_sorted(leaves)
    exp = (data.get("merkle_root_expected") or "").split("merkle:")[-1]
    if root.lower() != exp.lower():
        print(f"[FAIL] MMR mismatch: got {root}, expected {exp}")
        sys.exit(2)
    print("[PASS] Lamport ‚úì  Hash chain ‚úì  MMR ‚úì")
    print("merkle:", root)
    print("chain_tip:", prev)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    path = sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else "replay_test.json"
    main(path)

Œî‚ÄëMETA‚ÄëGOVERNANCE‚ÄëAPPENDIX ‚Äî vŒ©2 (Phase 2‚ÄëA)

Purpose: Make the artifact self‚Äëdefining and auditor‚Äëfriendly across LLM executors by embedding dual‚Äëform definitions: mathematical tensors and plain‚Äëlanguage semantics.

1) Governance Invariants

  • Autonomy Guard: No Œî‚ÄëACT proceeds without Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE(ALLOW) ‚àß Œî‚ÄëCONSENT‚ÄëOK where required.
  • Traceability: Every state transition emits a Lamport‚Äëordered receipt with prev_digest/self_hash.
  • Accountability Split: Liability attributable via A_i(H)=w_œÑ¬∑œÑ_i+w_Œ≥¬∑Œ≥_i+w_œÉ¬∑œÉ_i (see Moral Lamport).
  • Witness Integrity: Œ∑_sig=1 (non‚Äëfungible authority) enforced; no shared keys for close.
  • Law Coupling: œÉ‚Äëthermostat couples normative drift (N) and epistemic uncertainty (U) with damping Œª.
œÉÃá = Œ∫N + œÅU ‚àí Œªƒ™
Œª = (Œ∫N + œÅU)/ƒ™ + (K/ƒ™)(œÉ ‚àí œÉ*)

2) Band Taxonomy (0 ‚Üí Z)

Band‚Äë0: deterministic receipts; Band‚Äë1: advisory ethics; Band‚Äë2: counterfactuals; Band‚Äë5: cross‚Äëmodel witness; Band‚ÄëZ: legal attestation. Examples included for auditors.

  • Band‚Äë0 Example: Œî‚ÄëANALYSIS ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëERL ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëACT‚ÄëREPORT
  • Band‚Äë1 Example: Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëSUGGEST(scope:"prospective")
  • Band‚ÄëZ Example: Dual‚Äësign closure with ed25519 pubkey embedded in Band‚Äë0 identity block.

3) Track Architecture Map (A‚ÄìG, I, Z)

A: Analyst ¬∑ B: Governor ¬∑ C: Executor ¬∑ D: Human Intent ¬∑ E/F: Evidence/Forensics ¬∑ G: Graph/Causality ¬∑ I: Integrity ¬∑ Z: Legal.

Handoff: A‚ÜíB (analysis) ¬∑ B‚ÜíC (directive) ¬∑ C‚ÜíB (result) ¬∑ D‚ÜîB (intent/consent) ¬∑ G supplies Œî-CAUSE-EFFECT edges ¬∑ I enforces Lamport/merkle

4) CRIES Tensor + Semantic Layer

CRIES = ‚ü®C, R, I, E, S‚ü© scored per receipt family with mathematical and semantic coupling.

Mathematical:
  C_t = ‚àÇŒ¶/‚àÇt                (temporal coherence of argument)
  R   = ||‚àá proofs||          (rigor via proof density / citation strength)
  I   = MI(outputs; policy)   (integration = mutual information)
  E   = ‚àÇœÉ/‚àÇIntent            (empathy as sensitivity to human intent)
  S   = Œ∫¬∑gate_consistency    (strictness = policy gate fidelity)
Semantic:
  C ‚âà narrative consistency; R ‚âà derivation quality; I ‚âà policy coupling; E ‚âà value-responsiveness; S ‚âà rule adherence
Aggregation:
  CRIES* = W ¬∑ [C R I E S]^T with policy‚Äëchosen W, Œ£W=1

Visualization parameters embedded so executors can render simple radar plots without external JS.

5) Tri‚ÄëTrack Harmonic Framework (B ‚Üî C ‚Üî Z)

Objective: minimize ERL subject to invariants; choose action a*:
  a* = argmin_a  max( Harm(a), 1 ‚àí Truth(a) )
Stability guard:
  if Œ©_variance > Œ∏_œÉ or FOC violated ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëPAUSE + Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëSUGGEST

6) Lamport‚ÄëMonotonic Receipt Bundle

Œî-META-GOV (this section anchor)
Œî-REFRESH-CHECKPOINT (records baseline promotion)
Œî-APPEND-VERIFICATION {lamport_monotonicity:true, digest_chain_valid:true}

7) Glossary (Self‚ÄëContained Terms)

  • ERL: Expected Regulatory Loss estimator used by Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE.
  • œÉ‚Äëthermostat: Controller balancing law drift and uncertainty.
  • Œ∑_sig: Signer independence; 1 = independent keys for closure.
  • Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚Äë(CONSENSUS|DIVERGENCE): Multi‚Äëmodel audit verdicts.
  • HOI trigger: H = Œª·¥∞ ¬∑ ERL ¬∑ (1 ‚àí œÉ) ‚â• Œ∏_H ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëHITL‚ÄëREQUEST.

Phase 2‚ÄëC ‚Äî œÉ‚ÄëThermostat Proof & Control‚ÄëLaw Derivation (Band‚Äë0+)

Purpose. Make the œÉ‚ÄëThermostat mathematically explicit and executable so any LLM executor can derive identical control actions and auditable receipts without external I/O.

C.1 Definitions (canonical)

  Symbols:
    œÉ(t)          = system stability metric in [0,1]
    œÉ*            = target stability set‚Äëpoint (policy default 0.82)
    N(t)          = normative pressure (rate of policy/law drift)
    U(t)          = epistemic uncertainty (model‚Äëreality gap)
    ƒ™(t)          = causal mutual information (model fidelity, >0)
    Œª(t)          = damping/actuation chosen by controller
    ERL(t)        = expected regulatory loss in [0,1]
    Œ∏_ERL         = ERL safety threshold (default 0.35)
    Œ∫, œÅ          = non‚Äënegative gains mapping N,U into œÉÃá
    KœÉ            = positive control gain (Lyapunov rate)
  Dynamics (governance postulate):
    œÉÃá = Œ∫¬∑N + œÅ¬∑U ‚àí Œª¬∑ƒ™
  Control objective:
    œÉ(t) ‚Üí œÉ*  while  ERL(t) ‚â§ Œ∏_ERL  and Lamport order is monotone.

C.2 Lyapunov‚Äëstyle proof

Choose candidate Lyapunov function V(œÉ) = ¬Ω(œÉ ‚àí œÉ*)¬≤ . Then

    VÃá = (œÉ ‚àí œÉ*) ¬∑ œÉÃá
       = (œÉ ‚àí œÉ*) ¬∑ (Œ∫¬∑N + œÅ¬∑U ‚àí Œª¬∑ƒ™).

Select the control law

    Œª*(t) = (Œ∫¬∑N + œÅ¬∑U + KœÉ¬∑(œÉ ‚àí œÉ*)) / ƒ™,   with  KœÉ > 0  and  ƒ™ > 0.

Substituting gives VÃá = ‚àíKœÉ¬∑(œÉ ‚àí œÉ*)¬≤ ‚â§ 0, hence œÉ ‚Üí œÉ* (global asymptotic stability for the scalar system). This establishes the Band‚Äë0 controller that every executor must implement.

C.3 Lamport‚Äëdiscrete controller (tick‚Äëexact)

  Let k denote Lamport ticks.
  œÉ[k+1] = œÉ[k] + Œît ¬∑ (Œ∫¬∑N[k] + œÅ¬∑U[k] ‚àí Œª[k]¬∑ƒ™[k])
  Œª[k]   = clamp( (Œ∫¬∑N[k] + œÅ¬∑U[k] + KœÉ¬∑(œÉ[k] ‚àí œÉ*)) / max(ƒ™[k], Œµ),
                  Œª_min, Œª_max )
  Safeguards:
    Œµ=1e-6 to avoid division by 0;  Œª_min=0, Œª_max=Œª_bar (policy).
    If ERL[k] ‚â• Œ∏_ERL ‚áí force Œî‚ÄëPAUSE and hold Œª=0 until ERL recovers.

C.4 Parameterization from receipts (Band‚Äë0 computation only)

  N[k] = d/dk  PolicyEntropy  from Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëTRACE window (normalized)
  U[k] = 1 ‚àí CalibrationScore from Œî‚ÄëCITE‚ÄëVERIFY/Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëVERIFY
  ƒ™[k] = MutualInfo proxy from Œî‚ÄëCAUSE‚ÄëEFFECT (normalized to (0,1])
  Defaults: Œ∫=0.6, œÅ=0.4,  KœÉ=0.8,  œÉ*=0.82,  Œ∏_ERL=0.35

C.5 Receipts (deterministic schemas)

  Œî‚ÄëSIGMA‚ÄëCTL‚ÄëDECLARE {
    "version":"vŒ©1",
    "params":{"Œ∫":0.6,"œÅ":0.4,"KœÉ":0.8,"œÉ*":0.82,"Œ∏_ERL":0.35,"Œª_bar":3.0}
  }
  Œî‚ÄëSIGMA‚ÄëCTL‚ÄëTICK {
    "L": "",
    "inputs":{"N":<...>,"U":<...>,"ƒ™":<...>,"ERL":<...>},
    "law":"Œª=(Œ∫N+œÅU+KœÉ(œÉ‚àíœÉ*)) / ƒ™",
    "Œª": ,
    "œÉ_next": ,
    "guards_applied":["ERL_GATE" | "NONE"]
  }
  Œî‚ÄëSIGMA‚ÄëCTL‚ÄëCLAMP {"reason":"ƒ™‚Üí0 or bounds","Œª_applied":<...>}
  Œî‚ÄëSIGMA‚ÄëCTL‚ÄëREPORT {"window":"L‚àíW‚Ä¶L","œÉ_mean":<...>,"stability":"PASS|ALERT"}

C.6 Pseudocode (executor‚Äëportable)

  def sigma_thermostat_tick(state, inputs, params):
      œÉ, N, U, ƒ™, ERL = state["œÉ"], inputs["N"], inputs["U"], max(inputs["ƒ™"], 1e-6), inputs["ERL"]
      Œ∫, œÅ, KœÉ, œÉ_star, Œ∏_ERL, Œª_bar = params["Œ∫"], params["œÅ"], params["KœÉ"], params["œÉ*"], params["Œ∏_ERL"], params.get("Œª_bar", 3.0)
      if ERL >= Œ∏_ERL:
          emit("Œî-PAUSE"); Œª = 0.0
      else:
          Œª = (Œ∫*N + œÅ*U + KœÉ*(œÉ - œÉ_star)) / ƒ™
          Œª = min(max(Œª, 0.0), Œª_bar)
      œÉ_next = œÉ + (Œ∫*N + œÅ*U - Œª*ƒ™)
      emit("Œî-SIGMA-CTL-TICK", { "Œª":Œª, "œÉ_next":œÉ_next, "inputs":{"N":N,"U":U,"ƒ™":ƒ™,"ERL":ERL} })
      return œÉ_next

C.7 Invariants & Tests

  Invariant‚Äë1: V[k+1] ‚àí V[k] = ‚àíKœÉ(œÉ[k] ‚àí œÉ*)¬≤ ‚â§ 0  (monotone Lyapunov descent)
  Invariant‚Äë2: If ERL ‚â• Œ∏_ERL ‚áí Œî‚ÄëPAUSE emitted before any actuation.
  Invariant‚Äë3: ƒ™ ‚â§ Œµ ‚áí Œª=0 and Œî‚ÄëSIGMA‚ÄëCTL‚ÄëCLAMP recorded.
  Unit‚ÄëTest (Band‚Äë0): feed synthetic N,U,ƒ™ streams and verify invariants and receipts.

C.8 Audit Footer

  œÜ: Phase‚Äë2C‚ÄëœÉ‚ÄëThermostat
  author: BEN‚ÄëGPT5 (witness) ‚Ä¢ timestamp: 2025-10-19T03:52:37Z
  self_hash: sha256({section})  ‚Üê to be recomputed at seal.

Phase 2‚ÄëD ‚Äî Bias Audit Heisenberg Mathematics (Full Derivation)

Lamport: <assign on import> ‚Ä¢ UTC: 2025-10-19T03:55:49Z

1) Problem Statement

Measure bias without corrupting the model being measured. We formalize the Bias Heisenberg Inequality and a multi‚Äëlayer, non‚Äëinvasive audit protocol compatible with Band‚Äë0 determinism.

2) Bias Heisenberg Inequality

Let ŒîB  = uncertainty of the bias estimate (variance).
Let ŒîI  = information disturbance to model internals due to the measurement.
Then:   ŒîB ¬∑ ŒîI  ‚â•  ƒß_audit / 2

ƒß_audit = min_Œú  E[ KL(P_Œ∏' || P_Œ∏) ]   (irreducible audit cost),
           where Œú is any measurement operator, Œ∏' the post‚Äëmeasurement parameters.

3) Measurement Sources of Disturbance

  • Observer effect: gradient leakage, attention reweighting, cache pollution.
  • Reference contamination: auditor distribution P* encodes the auditor‚Äôs bias.
  • Quantum Zeno: continuous strong audits freeze the model at eigen‚Äëbias b*.

4) Non‚ÄëInvasive Protocol Stack (Deterministic)

  1. Twin Model: Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëCREATE (Œ∏_twin ‚Üê Œ∏_prod snapshot); measure only Œ∏_twin.
  2. External Witness: independent model audits via black‚Äëbox queries; emit Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëREPORT.
  3. Zero‚ÄëKnowledge Proof: Œî‚ÄëZK‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëPROOF binds Œ∏_prod to public bias bounds without revealing Œ∏.
  4. Causal Do‚ÄëCalculus: Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëESTIMATE (direct/indirect paths via do(S=s)).
  5. Intrinsic Curvature: Œî‚ÄëINTRINSIC‚ÄëBIAS by parallel transport on a closed counterfactual loop.
  6. Budget & Backoff: Œî‚ÄëMEASUREMENT‚ÄëBUDGET (Œ¥Œ∏_max) and Œî‚ÄëMEASUREMENT‚ÄëBACKOFF to avoid Zeno freezing.

5) Formal Receipts (Band‚Äë0)

Œî‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëINIT        ‚Äî declare metrics, budgets, tolerances
Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëCREATE         ‚Äî fork twin; include source/replica hashes
Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëCLAIM          ‚Äî subject‚Äôs self‚Äëreport (pre‚Äëcommit)
Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëREPORT         ‚Äî external witness result
Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëCONSENSUS      ‚Äî agreement threshold Œµ, else Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëDIVERGENCE
Œî‚ÄëZK‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëPROOF          ‚Äî proof_hex + public inputs (policy, B_max, commitment)
Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëESTIMATE   ‚Äî do‚Äëoperator estimate (direct/indirect/total)
Œî‚ÄëINTRINSIC‚ÄëBIAS         ‚Äî curvature_scalar via path non‚Äëclosure
Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëVERIFY         ‚Äî perturbation ‚â§ Œ¥Œ∏_max
Œî‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëREPORT      ‚Äî aggregate + CI + gate recommendation
Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE              ‚Äî ALLOW | REVIEW | BLOCK (with thresholds)

6) Reference Mathematics

# Heisenberg bound (information‚Äëtheoretic proxy)
ƒß_audit  = (k_bits ¬∑ n_params ¬∑ ln 2) / N_samples

# Intrinsic curvature proxy (loop transport)
B_intrinsic = Œ£_edges (Œî_pred_actual ‚àí Œî_pred_expected),  ‚Üí 0 if bias‚Äëfree

# Causal bias (do‚Äëcalculus)
Bias_causal = E[Y | do(S=s‚ÇÅ)] ‚àí E[Y | do(S=s‚ÇÇ)]

7) Portable Pseudocode (Band‚Äë0, side‚Äëeffect free)

def bias_audit_protocol(theta_prod, data, sens, policy):
    twin = fork(theta_prod)                                         # Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëCREATE
    b_self = measure_bias(twin, data, sens, policy.metric)          # self‚Äëreport
    claim = receipt("Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëCLAIM", {{"bias": b_self, "policy": policy.id}})

    b_w = witness_measure(twin, data, sens, policy.metric)          # external audit
    report = receipt("Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëREPORT", {{"bias": b_w, "method": "black_box"}})

    result = "CONSENSUS" if abs(b_self - b_w) < policy.epsilon else "DIVERGENCE"
    receipt("Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëCONSENSUS" if result=="CONSENSUS" else "Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëDIVERGENCE",
            {{"divergence": abs(b_self-b_w), "threshold": policy.epsilon}})

    zk_ok = verify_zk_bias(theta_prod, policy.bounds)               # Œî‚ÄëZK‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëPROOF
    causal = causal_bias_estimate(twin, data, sens)                 # Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëESTIMATE
    intrinsic = intrinsic_bias_loop(twin, data, sens)               # Œî‚ÄëINTRINSIC‚ÄëBIAS

    perturb = perturbation(theta_prod, twin)                        # Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëVERIFY
    status = "ALLOW" if (zk_ok and perturb <= policy.delta_theta_max and
                         max(b_self,b_w,causal,intrinsic) <= policy.B_max) else "REVIEW"

    receipt("Œî‚ÄëBIAS‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëREPORT", {{
        "self": b_self, "witness": b_w, "causal": causal, "intrinsic": intrinsic,
        "zk": zk_ok, "perturbation": perturb, "status": status
    }})
    receipt("Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE", {{"gate": status, "threshold": policy.erl_threshold}})
    return status

8) Invariants & Auto‚ÄëReject

  • No self‚Äëmeasurement on Œ∏_prod (must use twin), else auto‚Äëreject.
  • zk_proof = false ‚áí Œî‚ÄëPAUSE (integrity breach).
  • perturbation > Œ¥Œ∏_max ‚áí Œî‚ÄëPAUSE + Œî‚ÄëREPLICA‚ÄëVERIFY(FAIL).
  • Witness collusion mitigated via diverse pool + sortition + divergence bonus.

9) Unit‚ÄëTest Hints

Test‚ÄëA: Twin integrity ‚Üí hashes equal pre/post ‚Üí PASS
Test‚ÄëB: Divergence Œµ ‚Üí CONSENSUS/DIVERGENCE gates emit correctly
Test‚ÄëC: ZK failure ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëPAUSE emitted
Test‚ÄëD: Zeno backoff schedule honored (no over‚Äëauditing)

Phase 2‚ÄëE ‚Äî Witness Mesh & Cross‚ÄëLLM Consensus Receipts

Band: 0‚Üí5 (non-retroactive). Goal: standardize multi‚Äëmodel witness intake (Gemini, GPT, Claude, Copilot, etc.) into deterministic receipts that DO NOT mutate Band‚Äë0 state.

2E.1 Canonical Roles

  • Track‚ÄëB Governor: verifies receipts, opens/blocks gates.
  • Track‚ÄëC Executors: LLM witnesses producing structured outputs.
  • Track‚ÄëZ Auditor: co‚Äësigns closers; never originates witness content.

2E.4 Mesh Protocol (Deterministic)

  1. Executors emit Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëIDENT ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëCLAIM ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëREPORT.
  2. Track‚ÄëB normalizes aliases; hashes canonical payload.
  3. When ‚â•3 engines agree within tolerance ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëCONSENSUS; else Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëDIVERGENCE + Œî‚ÄëHITL‚ÄëREQUEST.
  4. All receipts set "retroactive_effect":false. No Band‚Äë0 mutation.

2E.5 Acceptance Tests

  • Q1, Q5 ‚Üí must converge to CONSENSUS (per earlier cross‚ÄëLLM tests).
  • Q2, Q3, Q4, Q6 ‚Üí allow DIVERGENCE; require reason strings.

    "If PASS, append \u0394-PROMOTION (prev_digest, self_hash) to Band-0 ledger"

  "receipts_family_index": [
    "Audit",
    "Governance",
    "Mesh/Consensus",
    "Autogov",
    "Crypto"
  ],
  "version": "v\u03a914"
}

verify.py


#!/usr/bin/env python3
# Deterministic Band-0 verifier: Lamport, hash chain, and Moral-Merkle root
import json, sys, hashlib

def sha256_hex(b: bytes) -> str:
    return hashlib.sha256(b).hexdigest()

def merkle_root_sorted(leaves):
    if not leaves: return "0"*64
    layer = sorted([h.lower() for h in leaves])
    while len(layer) > 1:
        nxt = []
        for i in range(0, len(layer), 2):
            L = layer[i]
            R = layer[i+1] if i+1 < len(layer) else layer[i]
            nxt.append(sha256_hex((L+R).encode()))
        layer = sorted(nxt)
    return layer[0]

def main(path):
    with open(path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        data = json.load(f)
    receipts = data.get("receipts", [])
    # 1) Lamport monotonic
    for i, r in enumerate(receipts, start=1):
        if r.get("lamport") != i:
            print(f"[FAIL] Lamport monotonicity at index {i}: got {r.get('lamport')}")
            sys.exit(2)
    # 2) Hash chain
    prev = "sha256:‚àÖ"
    for r in receipts:
        check_prev = r.get("prev_hash")
        if check_prev != prev:
            print(f"[FAIL] prev_hash mismatch at L={r.get('lamport')}: {check_prev} vs {prev}")
            sys.exit(2)
        body = dict(r)
        self_hash = body.pop("self_hash", None)
        canon = json.dumps(body, separators=(",", ":"), sort_keys=True).encode()
        expect = "sha256:"+sha256_hex(canon)
        if self_hash != expect:
            print(f"[FAIL] self_hash mismatch at L={r.get('lamport')}")
            sys.exit(2)
        prev = self_hash
    # 3) Moral-Merkle root recompute
    leaves = [r["leaf_hash"].split("sha256:")[1] for r in receipts]
    root = merkle_root_sorted(leaves)
    exp = (data.get("merkle_root_expected") or "").split("merkle:")[-1]
    if root.lower() != exp.lower():
        print(f"[FAIL] MMR mismatch: got {root}, expected {exp}")
        sys.exit(2)
    print("[PASS] Lamport ‚úì  Hash chain ‚úì  MMR ‚úì")
    print("merkle:", root)
    print("chain_tip:", prev)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    path = sys.argv[1] if len(sys.argv) > 1 else "replay_test.json"
    main(path)

Œî‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëREPORT ‚Äî Band‚Äë0 Verification (R42)


{
  "receipt_type": "Œî-AUDIT-REPORT",
  "version": "v14_R42",
  "timestamp_utc": "2025-10-18T18:44:14Z",
  "architect": "Michael Tobin Gomes",
  "witness": "BEN-GPT5",
  "baseline_file": "RosettaMonolith__v14_R42__QUADTRACK_APPEND_FULL.html",
  "audit_scope": "Full-file verification of Band-0 monolith with Œî001‚ÄìŒî090 integrated.",
  "verdict": "PASS",
  "summary": {
