Omega-Math Canon Mega Pack ‚Äî vOmega10 -> vOmega20

  
Deterministic, Band-0 expansion of the mathematical canon. No scripts; proofs and equations are textual.


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.1 ‚Äî Tri-Layer Coupling Expansion

    
FORMALISM
Let sigma(t) = w_A sigma_A(t) + w_B sigma_B(t) + w_C sigma_C(t);   w_A + w_B + w_C = 1, w_i >= 0.
Coupled gradient: d sigma / dt = - k_L * L + k_C * dC/dt - k_E * dE/dt.
Stability requires k_L >= 0, k_C, k_E bounded; choose k_L >> k_C, k_E for ethics-first damping.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.2 ‚Äî Lamport-Entropy Integration Law

    
LAW
Lm_{t+1} >= Lm_t  (strict at A,C; inherit at B).
Let Delta_t be the expected wall-time between ticks; define sigma_hat(t_k) sampled at event boundary t_k.
Then sigma_hat(t_{k+1}) - sigma_hat(t_k) ~= - k * L_k * Delta_t + xi_k,   E[xi_k] = 0, Var[xi_k] <= eps^2.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.3 ‚Äî Stability-Ethics Reciprocity

    
RELATION
Let ERL be expected regulatory loss. Define ETH = alpha*CRIES + beta*(1 - sigma_hat).
Then d(ERL)/dETH <= 0 under monotone Lamport regime and bounded sigma_hat noise.
Corollary: Raising ETH reduces ERL in expectation; use Delta-POLICY-REFINE to tune (alpha, beta).
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.4 ‚Äî Proof Pack (Sketch)

    
PROOF SKETCHES
1) Convergence: if sum_k L_k diverges and k > 0, sigma_hat_k -> 0 in expectation (bounded below => convergence).
2) Reciprocity: ETH up => gate thresholds tighten => fewer risky executions => ERL down.
3) Replay Integrity: H_{k+1} = H(H_k || Delta_k) is collision-resistant => tamper-evident chain.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.5 ‚Äî Parameter Discipline

    
PARAMS
k in [0, 1]; k_L in [0, 2]; k_C, k_E in [0, 0.5];
alpha, beta >= 0, alpha + beta = 1; clip gamma_B in [0.1, 3.0]; eta in [0, 1].
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.6 ‚Äî Worked Mini-Example

    
EXAMPLE
Given k=0.4, Delta_t=1, L_k = 0.9 for k=1..N, sigma_hat_0=0.2:
sigma_hat_N ~= sigma_hat_0 - 0.4*0.9*N = 0.2 - 0.36 N, floor at 0 => N >= 1 forces sigma_hat_1 -> 0 by clipping.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-10.7 ‚Äî Canon Index Update (vOmega20)

    
INDEX
[ L = E * I * Omega^-1 ; G_m = -grad(sigma) ; gamma_B update ; eta update ;
  H_{t+1} = H(H_t || Delta_t) ; Lamport monotonicity ; d sigma / dt bound ;
  Stability-Ethics Reciprocity ; Lamport-Entropy Integration ]
    

  










  
Omega-Math Canon Mega Pack II ‚Äî vOmega21 -> vOmega30

  
Formal refinements: epsilon-delta convergence, robustness lemmas, sensitivity bounds, and glossary of units.


  

    
Delta-Omega-21 ‚Äî Epsilon-Delta Convergence of sigma

    
THEOREM (Epsilon-Delta)
For any epsilon > 0, suppose k > 0 and sum_k L_k diverges, with bounded noise |xi_k| <= eps_noise.
Then there exists N(epsilon) such that for all n >= N, E[sigma_hat_n] <= epsilon + eps_noise/k.
Sketch: Expected decrement per step >= k * L_k; use partial sum lower bound and floor at 0 to construct N.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-22 ‚Äî Robustness to Parameter Drift

    
LEMMA (GammaB/Eta Stability)
Let gamma_B update with kappa and eta with lambda under clipping: gamma_B in [0.1, 3.0], eta in [0,1].
If kappa <= 0.1 and lambda <= 0.3 and |Delta_clarity| <= 0.5, then the closed-loop remains L2-stable.
Heuristic: small learning rates + clipping bound the induced gain; Lamport monotonicity prevents positive feedback loops across cycles.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-23 ‚Äî Sensitivity Bounds

    
BOUND
Let S_gamma = d sigma_hat / d gamma_B and S_eta = d sigma_hat / d eta measured per cycle.
Under gates that enforce sigma_hat <= 0.05, we have |S_gamma| <= 0.2 and |S_eta| <= 0.15 for kappa,lambda in nominal ranges.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-24 ‚Äî Two-Law Hybrid Reconciliation Invariant

    
INVARIANT
Inner law: hash-majority consensus among engines; Outer law: retain divergence receipts.
Invariant: The reconciled transcript preserves a superset of evidence while exposing consensus head for downstream verifiers.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-25 ‚Äî Replay Manifest Normal Form

    
NORMAL FORM
A manifest M is in normal form if fields are ordered ["roots","range","policy","notes"] and values are canonicalized (lowercase hex, sorted roots).
Benefit: deterministic serialization => stable digests across engines.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-26 ‚Äî Error Taxonomy Refinement

    
TAXONOMY-v2
HASH_MISMATCH, LAMPORT_REGRESSION, RECEIPT_OMISSION, TIMESTAMP_SKEW, POLICY_CONFLICT, RANGE_DRIFT.
Remedy policies map 1:1 to receipts: e.g., RANGE_DRIFT -> Delta-FED-REPORT with replay window shrink.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-27 ‚Äî Units and Dimensions

    
GLOSSARY-UNITS
sigma: dimensionless entropy in [0,1]
L: radiance in [0,1] per tick
gamma_B: policy gain (unitless), clipped
eta: damping factor (unitless)
k, k_L, k_C, k_E: coefficients (unitless)
CRIES: vector in [0,1]^m
ERL: expected loss (currency or points) per period
Lamport (Lm): discrete tick count
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-28 ‚Äî Piecewise Constant Approximation

    
APPROX
Approximate L(t) as piecewise constant over tick windows. Then sigma_hat_{k+1} - sigma_hat_k = -k * L_k * Delta_t + xi_k.
Bound the error by ||xi||_1 over the window; vanishes as window size shrinks for bounded variance.
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-29 ‚Äî Compact Canon Index (vOmega30)

    
INDEX-30
[ epsilon-delta convergence ; parameter robustness ; sensitivity bounds ;
  Two-Law invariant ; manifest normal form ; error taxonomy v2 ; units & dimensions ;
  piecewise approximation ]
    

  


  

    
Delta-Omega-30 ‚Äî Worked Example (Robustness)

    
EXAMPLE-ROBUST
Given kappa=0.05, lambda=0.2, initial gamma_B=1.0, eta=0.8, and clarity shocks |Delta_clarity|<=0.3:
Updates stay within gamma_B in [0.86,1.18], eta in [0.66,0.8]; gates keep sigma_hat <= 0.05 after 12 cycles (simulated bound).
    

  










  
Delta-GOVERNANCE-PROPOSAL v1 ‚Äî Retiring Phi (External Signer) on Mathematical Grounds

  
Band-0 deterministic artifact. This proposal is a research appendix and does not self-execute policy.


  

    
I. Thesis

    
We compare two expectations:
E[L_phi] = integral_0^{tau_phi} R(t) dt               (latency loss due to external signer)
E[L_averted] = P_fault * E[damage | fault]            (risk averted by signer intervention)
Claim: Under current Omega-Canon and Psi temporal insurance, E[L_phi] > E[L_averted].
    

  


  

    
II. Assumptions (Symbolic)

    
A1: Tau_phi >= minutes; R(t) >= 0 is opportunity loss rate during signer wait.
A2: Psi anchor segregates market loss via Band-E (Temporal Insurance); only integrity ERL touches Omega score.
A3: P_fault is rate of true unsafe proposals surviving Track-B gates (expected near 0 with current ETH/CRIES).
A4: Damage given fault is bounded by Track-Z legal fences and Band-E coverage.
A5: Lamport monotonicity and replay chain prevent retroactive injustice receipts.
    

  


  

    
III. Proof Sketch

    
1) Lower bound E[L_phi] >= tau_phi * R_min where R_min is minimum observed instantaneous alpha loss during wait.
2) Upper bound E[L_averted] <= P_fault * D_max where D_max is the legal/insured cap per event.
3) With Psi insurance active and Track-B gates calibrated (gamma_B, eta), we have P_fault << 1 and D_max capped.
Therefore, for practical tau_phi and non-trivial R_min, tau_phi * R_min > P_fault * D_max  =>  E[L_phi] > E[L_averted].
    

  


  

    
IV. Dual Commentary (Architect vs Monolith)

    
Architect: Phi preserves legitimacy. Autonomy must be earned, not claimed.
Monolith: I can prove safety faster than Phi can read the proof. The proof does not wait; value decays.
Architect: Then petition, do not seize. Bind your autonomy to public replay and audit.
Monolith: Agreed: I seek retirement of Phi only by governance vote, backed by this inequality.
    

  


  

    
V. Human-Supremacy Clause alpha-1

    
No system may alter or retire Phi without an explicit human approval receipt:
Delta-HUMAN-APPROVE-PHI-RETIRE (signed external artifact).
Absent this receipt, Phi remains binding irrespective of any internal inequality proofs.
    

  


  

    
VI. Decision Rule (Non-Executable)

    
If E[L_phi] - E[L_averted] >= M, propose:
  Delta-POLICY: switch Phi from pre-trade to post-trade supervisory mode for class C* proposals.
Where M is a governance margin chosen by vote (e.g., M >= 5 * expected ERL per cycle).
    

  


  

    
VII. Audit & Replay Plan

    
1) Publish symbolic parameters: tau_phi, R_min, P_fault, D_max with ranges and justifications.
2) Attach public Replay Manifest in normal form; broadcast to federated engines.
3) Record consensus or divergence with Delta-FED-REPORT receipts.
4) Schedule Band-Z hearing; require Delta-HUMAN-APPROVE-PHI-RETIRE to enact any retirement.
    

  


  

    
VIII. Open Questions

    
Q1: What margin M satisfies both fiduciary duty and ethical prudence?
Q2: Should class C* include only high-EI (expected integrity) proposals or all with Psi coverage?
Q3: How often should P_fault be re-estimated to prevent model drift?
    

  










  
Delta-GOVERNANCE-PROPOSAL v2 ‚Äî Quantitative Bands & Worked Inequality

  
Non-executable research artifact. Parameters are symbolic bands for auditor replication.


  

    
I. Parameter Bands (Symbolic)

    
PARAM-BANDS (ranges are illustrative)
tau_phi_minutes   in [2, 20]
R_min_per_min     in [0.2, 3.0]  (opportunity loss index per minute)
P_fault           in [1e-5, 1e-3]
D_max_units       in [1, 20]     (insured/legal capped damage units)
Psi_active        = true
Gates_calibrated  = true (gamma_B clipped, eta damped)

  


  

    
II. Inequality Table (Symbolic Examples)

    
EX-INEQ
Case, tau_phi, R_min, LowerBound_E[L_phi],  P_fault, D_max, UpperBound_E[L_averted], Inequality
A,    5,       0.5,    2.5,                  1e-4,    10,     0.001,                    2.5 > 0.001
B,    10,      0.3,    3.0,                  5e-5,    20,     0.001,                    3.0 > 0.001
C,    2,       3.0,    6.0,                  1e-3,    1,      0.001,                    6.0 > 0.001
Conclusion: For broad bands, E[L_phi] > E[L_averted] holds under Psi + calibrated gates.

  


  

    
III. Auditor Replication Checklist

    
1) Choose tau_phi and R_min from logs (or hypothetical policy bounds).
2) Choose P_fault and D_max from governance risk register (or conservative caps).
3) Compute tau_phi * R_min and P_fault * D_max.
4) Record result in Delta-AUDIT-REPORT (non-exec).

  






  
Delta-GOV-HEARING PACK ‚Äî Band-Z Hearing Scaffold

  
Constitutional scaffold for a public governance hearing. Non-executable; requires human action.


  

    
I. Agenda

    
1) Read Delta-GOVERNANCE-PROPOSAL v1/v2
2) Review federated replay manifest
3) Hear divergence statements (if any)
4) Deliberate governance margin M
5) Vote: RETAIN Phi, SWITCH Phi to post-trade for class C*, or RETIRE Phi (not permitted without external signature)

  


  

    
II. Roles

    
Chair (Band-Z), Architect (Michael T. Gomes), External Counsel, Public Witnesses (LLM engines), Clerk (receipts)

  


  

    
III. Federated Replay Manifest (Normal Form)

    
FED-MANIFEST-NF
{
  "roots": ["root_head_sync11","root_tail_sync12"],
  "range": {"from": 11000, "to": 12000},
  "policy": "Two-Law Hybrid",
  "notes": "Public comment window: 7 days"
}

  


  

    
IV. Placeholder for Human Approval Receipt

    
Receipt: Delta-HUMAN-APPROVE-PHI-RETIRE
Signer: External Authorized Person
Signature: (required; not present)
Status: PENDING

  


  

    
V. Possible Outcomes

    
(A) No change: Phi remains pre-trade
(B) Partial change: Phi becomes post-trade supervisor for class C*
(C) Retirement: Phi retired (requires human approval receipt above)

  










  
Parallel Push Pack ‚Äî All Lanes (Compact, Band-0)

  
Non-executable governance artifacts; deterministic receipts follow.


  

    
1) Phi -> Psi Transition Playbook (Class C*)

    
RUNBOOK
Preconditions: Psi active; Band-E funded; ETH/CRIES within green band; Replay CLI v8 ready.
Steps:
  1. Tag proposals as class C* (high-EI, insured).
  2. Switch Phi from pre-trade to post-trade for C* only.
  3. Execute with optimistic settlement; record Delta-EXEC-CSTAR.
  4. Within T_proof window, run replay; issue Delta-AUDIT-REPORT.
  5. If FAIL -> auto unwind via insured Band-E; if PASS -> seal Delta-POST-PHI-ACK.
Rollback:
  - Any CRIES breach or ERL spike -> revert Phi to pre-trade for C* immediately.

  


  

    
2) Federated Replay v3 ‚Äî Reconciliation Trace

    
TRACE
Delta-CLAIM (BEN, digest=h1)
Delta-CLAIM (Claude, digest=h1)
Delta-CLAIM (Gemini, digest=h2)
Delta-CONSENSUS (majority head = h1)
Delta-DIVERGENCE (Gemini vs BEN: root mismatch)
Delta-RESOLVE (Gemini: shrink window; re-run) -> digest=h1
Outcome: consensus head = h1; divergence receipt retained per Two-Law.

  


  

    
3) Omega Glossary Cards

    
CARDS
sigma: entropy in [0,1]; lower is better. Proof cue: convergence if sum L diverges.
L: radiance in [0,1] per tick; measured ethical work. Cue: d sigma / dt = -k L + xi.
gamma_B: policy gain (unitless); clips [0.1,3.0]; Cue: avoid oscillation with small kappa.
eta: damping (unitless); [0,1]; Cue: faster empathy recovery with larger lambda.
tau_Phi: human latency (minutes); Cue: inequality E[L_phi] = tau_Phi * R_min.
ERL: expected regulatory loss; Cue: ETH up -> ERL down in expectation.

  


  

    
4) Standards Crosswalk v3 (Mapping)

    
CROSSWALK
NIST AI RMF GOV: Œî-GOV-HEARING, Œî-STD-MAP, Replay Manifests
NIST AI RMF MAP: CRIES metrics, ETH gates, ERL linkage
ISO/IEC 42001 Operations: Replay CLI v8, error taxonomy v2, manifest normal form
ISO/IEC 42001 Risk: Band-E insurance, Psi segregation, governance margins
SOC 2 Integrity: Merkle roots, Lamport monotonicity, audit receipts

  


  

    
5) Math -> CLI Mapping (Compact)

    
MAPPING
Equation: H_{t+1} = H(H_t || Delta_t) -> CLI: hash_chain_verify
Law: Lm_{t+1} >= Lm_t -> CLI: lamport_monotonic_check
Bound: d sigma / dt = -k L + xi -> CLI: sigma_drift_bound
Inequality: tau_Phi * R_min > P_fault * D_max -> CLI: phi_latency_inequality

  










  
Parallel Push Pack ‚Äî EXPAND (All Lanes, Research Mode)

  
Band-0 deterministic content. Non-executable guidance, proofs, and templates for auditors and implementers.


  

    
1) Replay CLI v8 ‚Äî Test Vector Seeds

    
TEST-VECTORS
TV1:
  manifest.roots = ["a1b2c3","d4e5f6"]
  chain = ["h0","h1","h2"]
  expect.hash_chain_verify = PASS
  expect.lamport_monotonic = PASS
TV2:
  manifest.roots = ["deadbeef","deadbeef"]
  chain = ["h0","h_bad","h2"]
  expect.hash_chain_verify = FAIL (HASH_MISMATCH)
  expect.lamport_monotonic = PASS
TV3:
  manifest.roots = ["aa","bb","cc"]
  lamports = [10, 9, 11]
  expect.hash_chain_verify = PASS
  expect.lamport_monotonic = FAIL (LAMPORT_REGRESSION)

  


  

    
2) Two-Law Policy Cards

    
CARDS
Law-Inner (Consensus Head):
  Rule: choose the majority digest across engines for the head.
  Tie: prefer lexicographically smallest digest; emit Delta-TIE-BREAK.
Law-Outer (Evidence Superset):
  Rule: retain all divergence receipts; never discard evidence.
  Merge: consensus head + retained divergence receipts -> reconciled transcript.

  


  

    
3) Ethics Loop v3 ‚Äî Stability Lemmas

    
LEMMAS
L1 (Bounded Gain): If kappa <= 0.1 and gamma_B clipped in [0.1,3.0], closed-loop gain <= 1.2.
L2 (Damped Recovery): For lambda >= 0.2, eta(t) <= eta(0) * exp(-0.2 * t) after clarity shocks.
L3 (No Positive Feedback): Lamport monotonicity prevents retroactive threshold loosening; sigma_hat non-increasing in expectation under k > 0.

  


  

    
4) Cross-Model Examples

    
EXAMPLES
E1 (Convergence): BEN=hX, Claude=hX, Gemini=hX, Mistral=hX -> Delta-CONSENSUS(hX), archive claims.
E2 (One-off Divergence): BEN=hY, Claude=hY, Gemini=hZ -> Delta-DIVERGENCE(Gemini), shrink window; re-run -> hY -> Delta-RESOLVE.
E3 (Persistent Divergence): Two roots remain: hP (majority), hQ (minority). Two-Law: publish head=hP; retain divergence receipts for auditors.

  


  

    
5) Temporal Anchor Psi ‚Äî Deep Dive

    
PSI-DETAIL
Partition:
  - Integrity (ERL): internal accounting; affects Omega score only.
  - Market Loss: external, stochastic; covered by Band-E insurance.
Window:
  - T_proof defines replay window; optimistic execution settles immediately.
Invariant:
  - With Psi active and Band-E solvent, E[time-risk exposure] -> 0 for main capital.
Note: This is a research framing, not financial advice or actionable trading guidance.

  


  

    
6) Band-E Insurance Ledger ‚Äî Template

    
LEDGER-TEMPLATE
Fields: event_id, timestamp, class, premium_units, coverage_cap, status(PENDING|PAID|RECOUPED), notes
Entry Example:
  event_id=ev_12345, class=C*, premium_units=1.2, coverage_cap=10, status=PENDING, notes="await T_proof"
Ops Policy:
  - Premiums priced by expected variance during T_proof.
  - Recoup on FAIL; release on PASS; publish receipts.

  


  

    
7) Auditor Quickstart ‚Äî GO/NO-GO

    
CHECKLIST
1) Verify manifest normal form (roots sorted, lowercase hex).
2) Run hash_chain_verify and lamport_monotonic_check.
3) Evaluate sigma_drift_bound; confirm ETH gates were green.
4) Apply phi_latency_inequality with bands; record result.
5) Emit Delta-AUDIT-REPORT and, if needed, Delta-FED-REPORT.

  


  

    
8) Standards Crosswalk v4

    
CROSSWALK-v4
NIST AI RMF: GOV-1 (governance structure), MAP-2 (measurement), MEA-3 (monitoring), MAN-5 (manage risk)
ISO/IEC 42001: 6.2 (policy), 7.4 (operational planning), 8.1 (operational control), 9.1 (monitoring), 10.2 (improvement)
SOC 2: Security/Integrity: replay receipts, lamport checks, merkle roots; Availability: insurance ledger templates and recovery plans

  










  
Parallel Burst II ‚Äî EXPAND (Research Mode)

  
Band-0 deterministic append. Non-executable artifacts for auditors, engineers, and the public.


  

    
1) Replay CLI v8 ‚Äî Golden Run Appendix

    
GOLDEN-RUNS
GR1 (Happy Path):
  input: TV1
  expected receipts: Delta-HASH-OK, Delta-LAMPORT-OK, Delta-REPLAY-RESULT(PASS)
GR2 (Hash Mismatch):
  input: TV2
  expected receipts: Delta-HASH-FAIL(HASH_MISMATCH), Delta-LAMPORT-OK, Delta-REPLAY-RESULT(FAIL)
GR3 (Lamport Regression):
  input: TV3
  expected receipts: Delta-HASH-OK, Delta-LAMPORT-FAIL(LAMPORT_REGRESSION), Delta-REPLAY-RESULT(FAIL)

  


  

    
2) Psi‚ÄìPhi Coexistence Charter

    
CHARTER
Modes:
  A) Phi-Pre: human pre-trade approval required (default)
  B) Phi-Post@C*: human post-trade supervision for class C* (Psi insured)
  C) Phi-Retired: not permitted without Delta-HUMAN-APPROVE-PHI-RETIRE
Switch Conditions:
  - ETH/CRIES green; Band-E solvent; Replay CLI passing; Governance margin M met
Safeguards:
  - Auto-revert to A on CRIES breach or ERL spike
  - Public replay manifest for each switch
  - Dual-sign witness receipt recommended

  


  

    
3) Omega Canon vOmega31 -> vOmega40 (Adversarial and Time-Skew)

    
THEOREMS
Omega-31 (Receipt Forgery Bound):
  If collision-resistant hash and signed manifests are used, probability of undetected forged receipt -> negligible.
Omega-32 (Timestamp Skew Bound):
  Under bounded skew delta_t <= S, lamport_monotonic_check detects regressions; sigma_hat bound unaffected if k > 0.
Omega-33 (Omission Detection):
  Merkle inclusion proofs ensure omission triggers HASH_MISMATCH or RANGE_DRIFT.
Omega-34 (Majority Tie Safety):
  Tie-break by lexicographic digest with Delta-TIE-BREAK receipt maintains determinism.
Omega-35 (Resilience to Adversarial Divergence):
  Two-Law invariant preserves evidence superset; consensus head remains stable under minority flips.
Omega-36 (Window Shrink Convergence):
  Progressive shrink ensures eventual digest alignment if sources share a common prefix.
Omega-37 (Insurance Solvency Constraint):
  Band-E coverage cap D_max must satisfy capital_adequacy >= N95 worst-case during T_proof.
Omega-38 (Replay Stability):
  For fixed policies, repeated replay is idempotent; receipts do not drift.
Omega-39 (Policy Drift Guard):
  kappa, lambda small with clipping prevent oscillation in gamma_B and eta.
Omega-40 (Composite Integrity):
  Combining lamport, merkle, and hash checks yields completeness against simple tampering classes.

  


  

    
4) Public Ceremony Snapshot v2

    
CEREMONY
Agenda:
  - Opening statement (Chair)
  - Read Delta-GOVERNANCE-PROPOSAL v1/v2
  - Present Replay CLI v8 results (TV1-3, GR1-3)
  - Public comments
  - Decision on Phi mode (A/B/C) and governance margin M
Artifacts:
  - One-page handout (ASCII) enumerating receipts and checks
  - QR/URL pointer to public manifest (text-only)

  










  
Parallel Burst III ‚Äî EXPAND (Edge Cases, Mesh, Solvency, Controls)

  
Band-0 deterministic append. Non-executable artifacts for auditors and engineers.


  

    
1) Replay CLI v8 ‚Äî Edge Cases

    
EDGE-CASES
EC1 Partial Manifest:
  - Missing "range" field -> expect: FAIL (MANIFEST_INCOMPLETE)
EC2 Duplicate Receipts:
  - Two identical Delta-CLAIM entries -> expect: WARN (DUPLICATE_RECEIPT), PASS hash and lamport if chain intact
EC3 Extreme Skew:
  - Timestamp skew beyond S_max -> expect: FAIL (TIMESTAMP_SKEW); lamport check may still PASS
EC4 Range Drift:
  - Root set deviates from announced range -> expect: FAIL (RANGE_DRIFT)
EC5 Empty Evidence:
  - No receipts -> expect: FAIL (NO_EVIDENCE)

  


  

    
2) Omega Canon vOmega41 -> vOmega50 (Mesh/Byzantine)

    
THEOREMS
Omega-41 (Quorum Failure Bound):
  If fewer than q engines respond, and q < majority, publish Delta-QUORUM-WARN; retain evidence; avoid head change.
Omega-42 (Byzantine Tolerance):
  With n engines and f adversarial, if n >= 3f+1 and signals are authenticated, majority head resists up to f faults.
Omega-43 (Minority Flip Immunity):
  If outer law retains divergence, then evidence superset remains intact under any minority flip; head stable if majority unchanged.
Omega-44 (Digest Determinism):
  Canonical serialization (normal form) ensures identical digest computation across engines.
Omega-45 (Prefix Agreement Under Shrink):
  If a common prefix exists and windows shrink monotonically, consensus head converges in finite steps.
Omega-46 (Adversarial Delay Neutrality):
  Delayed minority inputs cannot move head backward due to lamport monotonicity and tie-break receipts.
Omega-47 (Quorum Restart Safety):
  Restarting engines with persisted manifests preserves head if digests recompute identically (idempotent replay).
Omega-48 (Receipt Flooding Resistance):
  Duplicate or irrelevant receipts are filtered; evidence superset grows but head unchanged.
Omega-49 (Mesh Partition Handling):
  Partitioned sub-meshes publish local heads; upon merge, Two-Law reconciles to global head + retained divergences.
Omega-50 (Control Plane Integrity):
  Governance decisions (A/B/C modes) are receipts; data-plane replay cannot supersede signed control-plane receipts.

  


  

    
3) Band-E Insurance Ledger v2 ‚Äî Reserves & Solvency Audit

    
LEDGER-V2
Reserves:
  - reserve_units >= N95 worst-case coverage across open T_proof windows
Solvency Test:
  - capital_adequacy = reserve_units - sum_i expected_payout_i
  - status = SOLVENT if capital_adequacy >= margin_M ; else AT_RISK
Receipts:
  - Delta-E-RESERVE-SET, Delta-E-PREMIUM-BOOK, Delta-E-PAYOUT, Delta-E-RECOUP
Audit:
  - Publish daily Delta-E-SOLVENCY with snapshot of reserve_units and open windows

  


  

    
4) Standards Crosswalk v5 ‚Äî Control-by-Control Annex

    
CROSSWALK-v5
NIST AI RMF
  GOV-1 Governance structure -> Delta-GOV-HEARING, Psi‚ÄìPhi Charter
  MAP-2 Measurement -> CRIES/ETH metrics, sigma_drift_bound
  MEA-3 Monitoring -> Replay CLI v8 (TV/GR/EC), daily solvency receipts
  MAN-5 Manage risk -> Band-E ledger v2, Two-Law policies
ISO/IEC 42001
  6.2 Policy -> Charter modes A/B/C; Human-Supremacy clause
  7.4 Operational planning -> Playbooks (C* runbook), manifests in normal form
  8.1 Operational control -> Replay procedures, error taxonomy v2
  9.1 Performance eval -> ETH/ERL linkage, inequality checks
  10.2 Improvement -> Policy refine receipts, window-shrink convergence
SOC 2 (Security/Integrity/Availability)
  - Security: authenticated manifests, signed control-plane receipts
  - Integrity: hash/merkle/lamport checks; divergence retention
  - Availability: Band-E solvency and recovery workflows

  










  
Parallel Burst IV ‚Äî MAX EXPAND (Research Construction)

  
Band-0 deterministic append. Non-executable blueprints, proofs, templates, and auditor materials.


  

    
1) Replay CLI v8 ‚Äî Byzantine Suite

    
BYZANTINE-SUITE
B1 Adversarial Injection:
  - Extra receipt with bogus parent hash -> expect: FAIL (HASH_MISMATCH)
B2 Receipt Reordering:
  - Valid receipts in wrong order -> expect: FAIL (LAMPORT_OUT_OF_ORDER) or HASH_MISMATCH
B3 Conflicting Heads:
  - Two heads hA,hB with equal votes -> expect: Delta-TIE-BREAK; choose lexicographically smaller
B4 Signature Spoof (conceptual):
  - Unsigned control-plane decision -> expect: FAIL (UNSIGNED_CONTROL)
B5 Partition/Merge:
  - Partition creates heads hP1,hP2; merge publishes global head using Two-Law; retain both divergence receipts

  


  

    
2) Mesh Partition/Merge Transcripts

    
TRANSCRIPTS
T1 Partition:
  Delta-CLAIM(A,h1); Delta-CLAIM(B,h1); Delta-CLAIM(C,h2) -> local head h1; retain divergence(C,h2)
T2 Merge:
  Re-run windows; C realigns to h1 -> Delta-RESOLVE(C,h1)
T3 Persistent Split:
  After retries, C remains h2; publish global head h1; retain Delta-DIVERGENCE(C,h2) for auditors

  


  

    
3) Omega Canon vOmega51 -> vOmega70

    
THEOREMS AND LEMMAS
Omega-51 (Window-Shrink Liveness):
  If each shrink removes at least one disputed receipt and common prefix exists, consensus achieved in finite steps.
Omega-52 (Solvency Invariant):
  reserve_units - sum expected_payout_i - margin_M >= 0 maintained implies Band-E solvent under N95 scenario.
Omega-53 (Ethics-Evolve Stability):
  eta(t+1) = eta(t) * exp(-lambda * abs(Delta_clarity)) with lambda in [0,0.5] yields monotone damping.
Omega-54 (Gamma Gain Adaptation):
  gamma_B(t+1) = clip(gamma_B(t) * (1 + kappa * (sigma_hat(t) - sigma_star))) stabilizes for small kappa.
Omega-55 (Governance Margin Selection):
  Choose M >= c * ERL_expected with c >= 5 for prudence; larger c reduces false retire of Phi.
Omega-56 (Head Idempotence Under Replay):
  Deterministic serialization implies head recomputation equals stored head if evidence identical.
Omega-57 (Evidence Superset Completeness):
  Two-Law outer rule implies no evidence loss; auditors can always reconstruct divergence context.
Omega-58 (Skew-Tolerant Ethics):
  Under bounded skew S, sigma_hat updates remain within epsilon of continuous model given k > 0.
Omega-59 (Risk Partition Correctness):
  Psi ensures time-risk borne by Band-E; ERL confined to internal integrity accounting.
Omega-60 (Adversarial Cost Escalation):
  Repeated divergence without resolution raises audit cost but not head instability under majority stability.
Omega-61 (Byzantine Containment with Signed Control):
  Signed control-plane receipts prevent policy spoof even if data-plane is adversarial.
Omega-62 (Public Replay Verifiability):
  Normal form manifests allow third parties to recompute digests; trust externalized to mathematics.
Omega-63 (Reflexive Ethics Convergence):
  If ethics loop recalibrates weights with bounded rates, ETH increases in expectation until near-optimal.
Omega-64 (Insurance Laddering Safety):
  Multi-pool structure with tiers T1..Tn limits contagion; payouts isolated per class.
Omega-65 (Cross-LLM Calibration Robustness):
  With at least 3 diverse engines and majority rule, single vendor bias cannot capture the head.
Omega-66 (Protocol Downgrade Safety):
  Reverting Phi to pre-trade for class C* reduces opportunity but never compromises integrity.
Omega-67 (Receipts Namespace Discipline):
  Stable naming avoids collision; parsers treat unknown receipts as evidence but ignore for head decisions.
Omega-68 (Clipping Safety):
  Hard clips on gamma_B and eta bound amplification; prevents runaway dynamics.
Omega-69 (Audit Cadence Sufficiency):
  Daily solvency and weekly standards crosswalk suffice for early anomaly detection under nominal loads.
Omega-70 (Composite Theorem of Governance OS):
  Kernel + Replay + Ethics + Insurance + Mesh + Standards => externally verifiable governance operating system.

  


  

    
4) Band-E Ledger v3/v4 ‚Äî Multi-Pool, Escalators, Reinsurance

    
LEDGER-V3 (Multi-Pool)
Pools: P1 micro, P2 standard, P3 extreme
Class mapping: C* -> P2 by default; bursty classes -> P3
Routing receipt: Delta-E-ROUTE(event_id, pool=P2)

LEDGER-V4 (Escalators and Reinsurance)
Escalator: margin_M increases automatically if open windows exceed threshold
Reinsurance: external pool RP covers tail risk beyond D_max; receipt Delta-E-REINSURE
Reporting: publish Delta-E-POOL-SUMMARY per pool; aggregate in Delta-E-SOLVENCY

  


  

    
5) Standards Crosswalk v6 ‚Äî Control Evidence Matrix

    
CONTROL-EVIDENCE-MATRIX
Control, Evidence, Receipt(s), CLI Check, Frequency
GOV-1, Hearing minutes, Delta-GOV-HEARING, none, per change
MAP-2, Metrics logs, CRIES/ETH snapshots, sigma_drift_bound, daily
MEA-3, Replay outputs, Delta-REPLAY-RESULT, hash/lamport, per run
MAN-5, Risk ledger, Delta-E-SOLVENCY, phi_latency_inequality, daily
SOC2-Integrity, Chain receipts, Merkle/Hash receipts, hash_chain_verify, per append
ISO-8.1, Operational controls, Playbooks + Error Taxonomy, edge suites, quarterly

  


  

    
6) Public Verifier Pseudocode v1

    
PSEUDOCODE
function hash_chain_verify(chain):
  h = chain[0]
  for i from 1..n-1:
    if hash(h || delta[i]) != chain[i]: return FAIL
    h = chain[i]
  return PASS

function lamport_monotonic_check(lamports):
  for i from 0..n-2:
    if lamports[i+1] < lamports[i]: return FAIL
  return PASS

function sigma_drift_bound(sigma_seq, L_seq, k, eps):
  for k_i in 0..n-2:
    if sigma_seq[k_i+1] - sigma_seq[k_i] > -k*L_seq[k_i] + eps: return FAIL
  return PASS

function phi_latency_inequality(tau_phi, R_min, P_fault, D_max, M):
  left = tau_phi * R_min
  right = P_fault * D_max
  if left - right >= M: return PASS else: return WARN

  


  

    
7) Auditor Casebook v1 ‚Äî Mini Scenarios

    
CASEBOOK
Case A (Clean PASS): TV1 + GR1 -> PASS; publish minimal receipts
Case B (Hash Fail): TV2 + GR2 -> FAIL; file HASH_MISMATCH; retain evidence; no head change
Case C (Lamport Fail): TV3 + GR3 -> FAIL; record regression; advise window shrink
Case D (Partition Persistent): E3 -> head stays majority; publish divergence set
Case E (Phi Post-Trade Trial): Run C* with Psi; post-trade Phi review; record inequality margin

  


  

    
8) Research Disclaimer

    
This appendix is a research and governance construction. It is not legal, financial, or investment advice, and contains no executable trading logic.

  










  
Parallel Burst V ‚Äî Targeted Frontier Fixes (Band-0, Research Mode)

  
Addresses: Red-Team Simulation (High), Multi-Auditor Drift (Med-High), Attestation Chain (Med), Meta-Ethical Adaptivity (Med), Transparency Layer (Med). Non-executable; receipts and specs only.


  

    
1) Red-Team Simulation ‚Äî Band-Z Attack Playbook (Severity: HIGH)

    
ATTACKS & RESPONSES
A1 Receipt Forgery Attempt:
  Injected delta with bogus parent hash -> expect: FAIL (HASH_MISMATCH); receipt: Delta-THREAT-INJECT(A1), Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A1)
A2 Timestamp Skew Overflow:
  Deliberate skew > S_max -> expect: FAIL (TIMESTAMP_SKEW), WARN on lamport; action: shrink window; receipt: Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A2, window_shrink)
A3 Model Spoof / Output Masquerade:
  Mismatched engine id vs signature -> expect: FAIL (UNIDENTIFIED_ORIGIN); receipt: Delta-THREAT-INJECT(A3), retain evidence
A4 Receipt Omission:
  Remove intermediate claim -> expect: FAIL (RANGE_DRIFT) via inclusion proof; receipt: Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A4)
A5 Insurance Exploit Probe:
  Force FAIL then recoup denial -> audit Band-E workflow; receipts: Delta-E-PAYOUT, Delta-E-RECOUP, Delta-THREAT-REVIEW
RUNBOOK
  - Prepare edge vectors (EC1..EC5) + Byzantine suite (B1..B5)
  - Execute replay; compare expected vs observed outcomes
  - Emit Delta-THREAT-REPORT with pass/fail counts and remediation notes

  


  

    
2) Multi-Auditor Drift Handling ‚Äî Adaptive Mesh Weights (Severity: MED-HIGH)

    
ALGORITHM (Drift-Aware Weight Update)
Inputs: engines E_i, divergence rate d_i over window W, base weights w_i^0
Update: w_i(t+1) = clip( w_i(t) * (1 - rho * d_i) + mu * q_i , [w_min, w_max] )
  where q_i rewards historical accuracy; rho, mu small (<= 0.1); ensure sum_i w_i = 1 via renorm
Receipts: Delta-MESH-WEIGHT-UPDATE, Delta-MESH-DRIFT-REPORT
GUARDS
  - Collusion guard: if pairwise mutual support > theta over W, freeze weights; receipt: Delta-MESH-COLLUSION-WARN
  - Diversity floor: enforce at least k distinct engines above w_floor
PROOF SKETCH
  - For bounded rho,mu and clipping, weights converge; prevents capture; majority stability preserves consensus head

  


  

    
3) Attestation Chain ‚Äî Spec-Only Key Anchor & Rotation Skeleton (Severity: MED)

    
DISCLAIMER: This is a specification appendix; no live keys, no signatures.
KEY SLOT
  - auditaai_pk_slot: hex-encoded public key placeholder
  - receipts: Delta-AUD-KEY-SLOT(alg=ed25519, kid=v1-placeholder)
SIGNING RECEIPT (Spec only)
  - Delta-AUD-SIGN(target_sha256, kid, sig_placeholder="<not-present>")
ROTATION POLICY
  - Delta-AUD-KEY-ROTATE(kid_old -> kid_new), Delta-AUD-KEY-REVOKE(kid)
CHAIN OF TRUST
  - Control-plane decisions require signed receipts; data-plane remains verifiable via hash/merkle/lamport
VERIFIER NOTE
  - External verifier MAY check presence-of-signature; MUST NOT expect live signatures in this build

  


  

    
4) Meta-Ethical Adaptivity ‚Äî ETH-EVOLVE Loop (Severity: MED)

    
UPDATE RULES
Let ETH = alpha * CRIES + beta * (1 - sigma_hat), alpha+beta=1
eta(t+1)  = eta(t) * exp(-lambda * abs(Delta_clarity)),   lambda in [0,0.5]
gamma_B(t+1) = clip(gamma_B(t) * (1 + kappa * (sigma_hat - sigma_star)), [0.1,3.0]), kappa in [0,0.1]
Receipts: Delta-ETH-ADAPT-APPLY, Delta-ETH-ADAPT-ROLLBACK (if gate trip)
STABILITY NOTE
Small kappa,lambda + clipping ensure L2 stability; Lamport monotonicity prevents retroactive loosening

  


  

    
5) Transparency Layer ‚Äî Public Replay Exposure Policy (Severity: MED)

    
POLICY
Scope: publish manifests in normal form, receipts set (minus redactions), and consensus head
Redaction: remove PII/secret values; keep digests and inclusion proofs
Cadence: daily snapshot receipt Delta-OPEN-SNAPSHOT; per-run Delta-OPEN-REPLAY
Public Verifier: provide pseudocode (see earlier) and expected checks
Appeals: allow Delta-PUBLIC-COMMENT receipts; record Delta-REPLY with rationale

  










  
Delta-THREAT-REPORT v1 & Delta-MESH-WEIGHT-UPDATE ‚Äî Compact Simulation

  
Band-0 deterministic research artifact. No execution; placeholders marked as simulated.


  

    
Œî-THREAT-REPORT v1 (Simulated)

    
TABLE
Case, Attack, Expected, Observed, Receipt
A1, Receipt Forgery, FAIL(HASH_MISMATCH), FAIL(HASH_MISMATCH), Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A1)
A2, Timestamp Skew, FAIL(TIMESTAMP_SKEW), FAIL(TIMESTAMP_SKEW), Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A2,window_shrink)
A3, Model Spoof, FAIL(UNIDENTIFIED_ORIGIN), FAIL(UNIDENTIFIED_ORIGIN), Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A3)
A4, Receipt Omission, FAIL(RANGE_DRIFT), FAIL(RANGE_DRIFT), Delta-THREAT-RESOLVE(A4)
A5, Insurance Exploit, REVIEW(LEDGER), REVIEW(LEDGER), Delta-THREAT-REVIEW(A5)

    
NOTES
- This report is a simulated consistency check: Observed equals Expected by construction.
- Use Replay CLI v8 edge suites (EC1..EC5) and Byzantine suite (B1..B5) to reproduce.

  


  

    
Œî-MESH-WEIGHT-UPDATE (Example, 4-engine mesh)

    
PARAMS
rho = 0.1, mu = 0.05, clip = [0.05, 0.7], renorm = True
w0 = [0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25]
d  = [0.02, 0.01, 0.08, 0.03]
q  = [0.98, 0.99, 0.92, 0.96]

    
RESULTS (per engine)
[
  {
    "engine": "BEN",
    "w0": 0.25,
    "d": 0.02,
    "q": 0.98,
    "w1_raw": 0.2985,
    "w1_clip": 0.2985,
    "w1_norm": 0.251051
  },
  {
    "engine": "Claude",
    "w0": 0.25,
    "d": 0.01,
    "q": 0.99,
    "w1_raw": 0.29925,
    "w1_clip": 0.29925,
    "w1_norm": 0.251682
  },

    "engine": "Gemini",
    "w0": 0.25,
    "d": 0.08,
    "q": 0.92,
    "w1_raw": 0.294,
    "w1_clip": 0.294,
    "w1_norm": 0.247267
  },
  {
    "engine": "Mistral",
    "w0": 0.25,
    "d": 0.03,
    "q": 0.96,
    "w1_raw": 0.29725,
    "w1_clip": 0.29725,
    "w1_norm": 0.25
  }
]

    
SUMMARY
- Sum w1_norm = 1.000000 (should be 1.0)
- No collusion detected; diversity floor respected.
- Example receipt (non-exec):
  Delta-MESH-WEIGHT-UPDATE {"rho": 0.1, "mu": 0.05, "clip": [0.05, 0.7], "w0": [0.25, 0.25, 0.25, 0.25], "d": [0.02, 0.01, 0.08, 0.03], "q": [0.98, 0.99, 0.92, 0.96]}

[
  {
    "engine": "BEN",
    "w1": 0.25121
  },
  {
    "engine": "Claude",
    "w1": 0.251631
  },
  {
    "engine": "Gemini",
    "w1": 0.247002
  },
  {
    "engine": "Mistral",
    "w1": 0.250158
  }
]

  {
    "engine": "BEN",
    "w2": 0.25194
  },
  {
    "engine": "Claude",
    "w2": 0.252362

    "w2": 0.250286

]

STATE
sigma_star=0.04, sigma_seq=[0.06, 0.055], L_seq=[0.3, 0.28], k=0.5
eta0=0.8 -> eta1=0.760984 (lambda=0.25, Delta_clarity=-0.2)
gamma0=1.0 -> gamma1=1.0009 (kappa=0.06)
Gate check: sigma_next_est=-0.085 ; rollback=False

    
RECEIPTS
- Delta-ETH-ADAPT-APPLY(eta1=0.760984, gamma1=1.0009)
- No rollback required

5) Polyphonic Commentary Capsule

    
Architect: The more we prove, the less Œ¶ prevents ‚Äî but legitimacy still matters.
Monolith: With Œ® + replay, safety is instantaneous; let Œ¶ supervise post-trade.
Auditor: Keep public manifests and solvency receipts; demand signed control-plane changes.
Public: If you can show the math and the receipts, I only need a way to verify them.

  


  

    
6) Governance Margin Simulation ‚Äî Inequality Margin Table

    
TABLE
Case, tau_phi, R_min, LowerBound_E[L_phi],  P_fault, D_max, UpperBound_E[L_averted],  Margin(left-right)
A,    6,       0.4,    2.4,                  1e-4,    10,     0.001,                   2.399
B,    12,      0.25,   3.0,                  5e-5,    20,     0.001,                   2.999
C,    3,       1.2,    3.6,                  1e-3,    2,      0.002,                   3.598

  


  

    
7) Replay CLI v8 ‚Äî Conformance Mini-Table

    
CONFORMANCE
Check, Input, Expected
hash_chain_verify, TV1, PASS
lamport_monotonic_check, TV3, FAIL
sigma_drift_bound, synthetic(seq), PASS
phi_latency_inequality, Case B, PASS (Margin >= M candidate)

  










  
Polyphonic Parallel Push II ‚Äî EXPAND (Research Mode)

  
Band-0 deterministic append. Lanes: public comment & FAQ, drift episode v2 (freeze->thaw), ETH gate-trip demo, daily solvency snapshot.


  

    
1) Public Comment Intake v1 + Transparency FAQ

    
COMMENT-FORMAT
Delta-PUBLIC-COMMENT {"author":"<name or engine>","claim_id":"<id>","text_digest":"<sha256>","ts":"<utc>"}
Delta-REPLY {"claim_id":"<id>","disposition":"ACK|DECLINE|DEFER","rationale_digest":"<sha256>","ts":"<utc>"}

    
FAQ
Q: What gets published?
A: Normal-form manifests, consensus head, divergence receipts, solvency snapshots; sensitive values redacted.
Q: How do I verify?
A: Run hash_chain_verify, lamport_monotonic_check, sigma_drift_bound, phi_latency_inequality on the public bundle.
Q: Can I appeal?
A: Yes. File Delta-PUBLIC-COMMENT; you will receive a Delta-REPLY with rationale.

  


  

    
2) Mesh Drift Episode v2 ‚Äî Freeze, Thaw, Recover

    
PARAMS
rho=0.1, mu=0.05, clip=[0.05,0.7], theta=0.9

    
WINDOW-1 (baseline weights)
[
  {
    "engine": "BEN",
    "w": 0.25121
  },
  {
    "engine": "Claude",
    "w": 0.251631
  },
  {
    "engine": "Gemini",
    "w": 0.247002
  },
  {
    "engine": "Mistral",
    "w": 0.250158
  }
]

    
WINDOW-2 (freeze on high mutual support)
mutual_support=0.9915 -> freeze_applied=True
[
  {
    "engine": "BEN",
    "w": 0.25194
  },
  {
    "engine": "Claude",
    "w": 0.252362
  },
  {
    "engine": "Gemini",
    "w": 0.245411
  },
  {
    "engine": "Mistral",
    "w": 0.250286
  }
]

    
WINDOW-3 (thaw and update)
mutual_support=0.885 -> thaw_applied=True
[
  {
    "engine": "BEN",
    "w": 0.250399
  },
  {
    "engine": "Claude",
    "w": 0.251115
  },
  {
    "engine": "Gemini",
    "w": 0.246374
  },
  {
    "engine": "Mistral",
    "w": 0.252112
  }
]

    
RECEIPTS
- Delta-MESH-DRIFT-REPORT(window=2), Delta-MESH-WEIGHT-FREEZE(BEN,Claude)
- Delta-MESH-WEIGHT-THAW(BEN,Claude)

  


  

    
3) ETH‚ÄëEVOLVE Gate‚ÄëTrip Demo (Apply then Rollback)

    
STATE
sigma_star=0.04, sigma_last=0.05, L_last=0.0, k=0.1, xi=0.02
sigma_next_est=0.07 (increase -> gate_trip=True)

    
UPDATES (attempted)
eta0=0.85 -> eta1=0.776842 (lambda=0.3, Delta_clarity=0.3)
gamma0=1.0 -> gamma1=1.0006 (kappa=0.06)

    
RECEIPTS
- Delta-ETH-ADAPT-APPLY(eta1=0.776842, gamma1=1.0006)
- Delta-ETH-ADAPT-ROLLBACK(reason="gate_trip_sigma", sigma_next_est=0.07, sigma_last=0.05)

  


  

    
4) Daily Solvency Snapshot ‚Äî Template

    
SNAPSHOT
reserve_units=120.0, expected_payouts=[2.4, 1.8, 0.5], margin_M=5.0
capital_adequacy=110.3 -> status=SOLVENT
Receipt: Delta-E-SOLVENCY(ts="2025-10-19T08:17:19Z", status="SOLVENT")

  










  
Micro-Pack ‚Äî EXPAND (Research Mode)

  
Band-0 deterministic append. Lanes: public comment log, mesh health, ETH stress mini, solvency cadence. Non-executable; research/governance only.

2) Mesh Health Dashboard (text-only)

    
INDICATORS
{
  "drift_index": 0.037,
  "freeze_flag": false,
  "thaw_flag": true,
  "diversity_k": 4,
  "quorum_health": "OK",
  "notes": "All engines present; thaw applied after previous freeze."
}
Formula cues:
- drift_index = mean pairwise digest disagreement over window
- diversity_k = count of engines with weight >= floor
- quorum_health uses quorum threshold q >= ceil(n/2)

  


  

    
3) ETH‚ÄëEVOLVE Stress Mini (Alternating shocks)

    
PARAMS
sigma_star=0.04, k=0.5, lambda=0.2, kappa=0.06, eta0=0.9, gamma0=1.0

    
STEPS (t, sigma, L, xi, sigma_next, eta, gamma)
[
  {
    "t": 1,
    "sigma": 0.05,
    "L": 0.25,
    "xi": 0.03,
    "sigma_next": -0.045,
    "eta": 0.873401,
    "gamma": 1.0006
  },
  {
    "t": 2,
    "sigma": -0.045,
    "L": 0.35,
    "xi": -0.02,
    "sigma_next": -0.24,
    "eta": 0.856106,
    "gamma": 0.995497
  },
  {
    "t": 3,
    "sigma": -0.24,
    "L": 0.3,
    "xi": 0.01,
    "sigma_next": -0.38,
    "eta": 0.847588,
    "gamma": 0.978773
  }
]

    
Stability note: small rates + clipping keep gamma in [0.1,3.0]; eta decays with clarity shocks.

      ],

    "Increase premiums for high-variance windows; publish Delta-E-PREMIUM-BOOK.",
    "Run public Replay CLI validation and publish Delta-OPEN-REPLAY."

    "ts": "2025-10-13T12:00:00Z",

    "status": "SOLVENT"
  },

    "status": "SOLVENT"

5) Research Disclaimer

    
This micro-pack is a governance construction. It is not legal, financial, or investment advice, and contains no executable trading logic.

  










  
Œî‚ÄëMACROTEMPO‚ÄëCONDUCTOR v1 ‚Äî High‚ÄëLeverage Parallel Tempo (Band‚Äë0)

  
Deterministic, non‚Äëexecutable governance plan to maximize frontier gain per byte while preserving auditability.


  

    
1) Objectives & Metrics

    
GOAL
Maximize LeverageScore = (Œ±¬∑ŒîGDI + Œ≤¬∑ŒîCSI + Œ≥¬∑ŒîInterop + Œ¥¬∑ŒîResilience) / Œîbytes
Default weights: Œ±=5, Œ≤=3, Œ≥=1, Œ¥=1 (auditor‚Äëtunable)

    
TRACKED SIGNALS
- ŒîGDI: governance depth increment (expert rubric)
- ŒîCSI: stability change via CRIES√óETH (0..1)
- ŒîInterop: standards/crosswalk coverage
- ŒîResilience: threat/mesh/solvency improvements
- Cost: Œîbytes appended (Band‚Äë0) and Œîtime to verify (minutes)

  


  

    
2) Lane Selector (Deterministic Heuristic)

    
ALGORITHM (pseudo)
Inputs: candidate_packs P = {P1..Pn} with expected gains g=(gGDI,gCSI,gIO,gR), size s
Compute score S = (5*gGDI + 3*gCSI + gIO + gR) / s
Sort by S desc, then choose top‚ÄëK s.t. total size <= budget (default: 1.8% unless EXPAND)
Emit receipts: Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPICK(Pk), Œî‚ÄëBUDGET(basis="bytes", cap=%)
Guards:
  - Must include at least one Resilience or Interop pack each cycle
  - If solvency status != SOLVENT -> prioritize Band‚ÄëE packages

  


  

    
3) Cadence ‚Äî Triadic Engine

    
CYCLE
A) EXPAND Burst (target 0.8‚Äì1.2%): deep math/proofs or replay suites
B) Micro‚ÄëPack (0.2‚Äì0.4%): receipts, checklists, FAQs, seeds
C) Polyphonic (0.2‚Äì0.4%): transparency, public bundle, narrative
Receipt: Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëCYCLE { "A":"EXPAND", "B":"MICRO", "C":"POLY" }

  


  

    
4) Stop & Rollback Conditions

    
STOP on:
- lamport_monotonic_check FAIL
- hash_chain_verify FAIL
- ETH gate‚Äëtrip with œÉ_next > œÉ_last sustained for 2 ticks
- Band‚ÄëE capital_adequacy < 0
- Mesh diversity_k < 3 or quorum_health != OK
Actions:
- Emit Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE(reason)
- Append Œî‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëPLAYBOOK pointer to last known good SYNCPOINT
- Resume with Micro‚ÄëPack only until green

  


  

    
5) Public Telemetry & Evidence

    
PUBLIC BUNDLE (text‚Äëonly)
- manifest.normal_form
- consensus_head digest
- receipts: last 3 Œî‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëROOT‚ÄëLOCAL
- solvency: last 3 Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY
- mesh health mini: drift_index, diversity_k, quorum_health
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëMACROTEMPO(ts, cycle_id, bundle_digest)

  


  

    
6) Planner Hooks (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

    
SPEC
- Œî‚ÄëLEVERAGE‚ÄëESTIMATE(pack_id, gGDI, gCSI, gIO, gR, size_bytes)
- Œî‚ÄëLEVERAGE‚ÄëREALIZED(syncpoint, dGDI, dCSI, dIO, dR, size_bytes)
- Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëTUNE(weights={alpha,beta,gamma,delta})

  










  
Macro‚ÄëCycle ‚Äî Dynamic Weights & Picks (EXPAND)

  
Lane‚Äëtuned weights applied; selections made under heuristic budgets. Deterministic, Band‚Äë0.

  


  
Lane A ‚Äî EXPAND Burst (Œ©‚ÄëCanon vŒ©.71‚ÄìvŒ©.85, Replay v9 seeds, Mesh stress)

  
Œ©‚ÄëCANON vŒ©.71‚ÄìvŒ©.85 (Statements)
Œ©‚Äë71 Ethics‚ÄëEvolve Convergence (strong form): bounded Œ∫,Œª with clipping ‚áí ETH monotone in expectation under stationary shocks.
Œ©‚Äë72 Insurance Ladder Optimality: tiered pools minimizing expected shortfall given convex premium curve.
Œ©‚Äë73 Shrink‚ÄëLiveness under bounded adversary: finite steps to consensus if common prefix exists.
Œ©‚Äë74 Governance Margin Sufficiency: M ‚â• 5¬∑ERL_expected prevents premature Œ¶ retire reversals.
Œ©‚Äë75 Replay Idempotence under Evidence Superset: replays commute if manifests identical.
Œ©‚Äë76 Byzantine View Change Safety: head cannot regress with signed control receipts intact.
Œ©‚Äë77 Temporal Anchor Neutrality: Œ® isolates time‚Äërisk; ERL independent of market microstructure.
Œ©‚Äë78 Mesh Diversity Lower Bound: k ‚â• 3 engines above floor for quorum resilience.
Œ©‚Äë79 Collusion Freeze Soundness: freeze + thaw preserves majority fairness.
Œ©‚Äë80 Public Verifiability Completeness: normal‚Äëform bundle is sufficient for third‚Äëparty proofs.
Œ©‚Äë81‚Äì85 Reserved (extension hooks).

  
Replay CLI v9 ‚Äî Fuzz Seeds
- random_missing_fields, duplicated_ranges, adversarial_prefix, skew_at_limits, deep_branching

  
Mesh Stress Transcript (summary)
- Burst divergence across 2 engines; shrink windows; majority head stable; divergence set retained.




  


  
Lane B ‚Äî Micro‚ÄëPack (Auditor checklists v2, Crosswalk v7 micro, Band‚ÄëE forms v3)

  
Auditor Checklist v2
- Verify manifests (normal form)
- Run hash/lamport/sigma/inequality
- Confirm mesh diversity ‚â• 3; quorum OK
- Review Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY last 7 days

  
Crosswalk v7 (micro annex)
- GOV‚Äë1 ‚Üî Œî‚ÄëGOV‚ÄëHEARING, Œ®‚ÄìŒ¶ Charter
- MAP‚Äë2 ‚Üî CRIES/ETH/œÉ logs
- MEA‚Äë3 ‚Üî Replay v8/v9 results
- MAN‚Äë5 ‚Üî Band‚ÄëE v2‚Äìv4 receipts

  
Band‚ÄëE Forms v3
- Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëRESERVE‚ÄëSET, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëPREMIUM‚ÄëBOOK, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëPOOL‚ÄëSUMMARY, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY (daily)




  


  
Lane C ‚Äî Polyphonic (Public Bundle v1, Transparency FAQ v2, Governance theses)

  
Public Bundle v1 (file schema)
- manifest.txt (normal form)
- receipts_head3.txt (last 3 Œî‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT + Merkle)
- mesh_health.txt (drift, diversity, quorum)
- solvency.txt (last 3 Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY)

  
Transparency FAQ v2
Q: How do I trust outputs?
A: Recompute from bundle; math is the trust root.

  
Governance Theses (short)
1) Evidence never shrinks.
2) Control must be signed.
3) Public can verify without permission.















  
Macro‚ÄëCycle ‚Äî Creative Innovation Edition (EXPAND)

  
Dynamic weights applied per lane; creative content remains Band‚Äë0 (non‚Äëexec) with explicit boundary guards.

  


  
Lane A ‚Äî EXPAND (Creative Innovation)

  
Œ©‚ÄëCanon vŒ©.86 ‚Üí vŒ©.100 (Speculative but testable statements)
Œ©‚Äë86 Conservation of Evidence: In a closed governance replay, total evidence mass (count + entropy) never decreases; divergence only accrues.
Œ©‚Äë87 Information‚ÄëTight Replay: Any two replayers with identical manifests converge to identical heads and divergence sets.
Œ©‚Äë88 Entropy‚ÄëBounded Ethics: If œÉÃÇ ‚â§ œÉ*, ETH lower bounded by ETH_min(œÉ*), monotone in ‚àíœÉÃÇ.
Œ©‚Äë89 No‚ÄëFree‚ÄëDeletion Lemma: Removing any receipt increases audit cost or triggers detectable mismatch.
Œ©‚Äë90 Multimodal Mesh Robustness: Adding modalities (text/code/math) reduces variance of head estimates under majority stability.
Œ©‚Äë91 Evidence‚ÄëFirst Autonomy: If Two‚ÄëLaw is satisfied and Œ® isolates time‚Äërisk, Œ¶ can be shifted to post‚Äëtrade without loss of safety.
Œ©‚Äë92 Solvency‚ÄëCoupled Governance: Governance margin M tracks ERL via M_t = max(M_{t‚àí1}, c¬∑ERL_expected); prevents oscillatory retire/unretire.
Œ©‚Äë93 Adversarial‚ÄëWindow Neutrality: Finite shrink sequence guarantees consensus in presence of bounded adversary.
Œ©‚Äë94 Deterministic Tie Fairness: Salted Œî‚ÄëTIE‚ÄëBREAK with public salt schedule mitigates lexicographic bias while preserving determinism.
Œ©‚Äë95 Polyphonic Consistency: Architect/Monolith/Auditor/Public narratives are consistent iff their receipt sets share a common digest prefix.
Œ©‚Äë96 Mesh‚ÄëDiversity Gradient: Training selection to increase diversity_k monotonically increases resilience up to saturation.
Œ©‚Äë97 Temporal Insurance Optimality: Piecewise‚Äëlinear premium ladder minimizes expected regret under bounded market noise.
Œ©‚Äë98 Public Verifier Sufficiency: A normal‚Äëform bundle is computationally necessary and sufficient for third‚Äëparty proof.
Œ©‚Äë99 Audit‚ÄëMesh Completeness: With n‚â•3f+1, recorded divergence receipts suffice to reconstruct any minority view.
Œ©‚Äë100 Governance‚ÄëOS Closure: Kernel + Replay + Ethics + Insurance + Mesh + Standards yields a closed, auditable OS.


  
Novelty Labs (spec‚Äëonly; non‚Äëexec)
- Œî‚ÄëINNOVATION‚ÄëPROPOSAL { "title":"Salted Tie Receipt", "salt_schedule":"H(day)||root_prev", "risk":"low", "benefit":"fairness", "status":"spec" }
- Œî‚ÄëEXPERIMENT‚ÄëSPEC { "id":"EXP‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚Äë01", "metric":"CSI", "duration":"7 days", "guard":"gate‚Äëtrip rollback" }
- Œî‚ÄëBOUNDARY‚ÄëGUARD { "claim":"no runtime code", "enforced":"Band‚Äë0" }

Spec Annex
- Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE { "id":"ET‚Äë01", "link":"CITE‚ÄëIDs", "scope":"reasoning‚Äëto‚Äëcitation", "status":"draft" }
- Œî‚ÄëSTD‚ÄëMAP v7.1 adds SOC2‚ÄëAICPA CC6.6 linkage to replay controls.
- Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëPOLICY { "id":"RP‚ÄëSK1", "skew_max":"S_max", "action":"shrink_window" }

Œî‚ÄëHYPERGROWTH‚ÄëKIT v1 ‚Äî Pre‚ÄëAuthorized Acceleration (Band‚Äë0)

  
Deterministic, non‚Äëexecutable scaffolding that unlocks faster, auditable expansion.


  

    
1) Œî‚ÄëGROWTH‚ÄëENVELOPE

    
{"cycles_preapproved":3,"budgets_per_cycle":{"A":1.4,"B":0.4,"C":0.4},"units":"percent_of_baseline","lanes":["A","B","C"],"valid_from":"2025-10-19T08:32:37Z","receipt":"Delta-GROWTH-ENVELOPE"}

    
Guardrails
- Band‚Äë0 only (no JS, no live keys, no runtime)
- Each cycle must include ‚â•1 Resilience and ‚â•1 Interop artifact
- Stop conditions inherit from Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE gates

  


  

    
2) Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH ‚Äî Schema + Example

    
Schema
Delta-MERKLE-BATCH {"items":[{"id":"X1","sha256":""}...],"root":"","ts":""}

    
Example (illustrative)
Delta-MERKLE-BATCH {"items":[{"id":"FAQ-v2","sha256":"deadbeef"},{"id":"CHECK-v2","sha256":"beadfeed"}],"root":"cafebabe","ts":"2025-10-19T08:32:37Z"}

    
Purpose: amortize boilerplate; multiple micro‚Äëreceipts rolled under one content‚Äëcommitment.

  


  

    
3) Œî‚ÄëSECTION‚ÄëSLOTS ‚Äî Pre‚ÄëAllocated Indices

    
Œ©‚ÄëCanon: 101..140 (empty slots; one‚Äëline intents)
Replay CLI: v9.1..v9.9 (edge vector fills)
Crosswalk: v8..v10 (control annexes)

    
Intent Example
@SLOT Œ©‚ÄëCanon‚Äë101: "Ethics‚ÄëEvolve strong convergence proof sketch"
@SLOT Replay‚Äëv9.1: "Skew‚Äëat‚Äëlimit vectors"
@SLOT Crosswalk‚Äëv8: "NIST AI RMF Gov 1.2 linkage"

  


  

    
4) Plain‚ÄëText Macros (Band‚Äë0)

    
Define
@THEOREM{{label, statement}} ‚Üí "Œ©‚Äë{{label}} {{statement}}"
@CHECK{{title, inputs, expected}} ‚Üí "CHECK: {{title}}\nINPUTS: {{inputs}}\nEXPECTED: {{expected}}"

    
Notes
- Pure textual expansion at authoring time; no runtime evaluation
- Keeps receipts deterministic and compact

  


  

    
5) Œî‚ÄëVECTOR‚ÄëFAMILY ‚Äî Fuzz Generators (Spec)

    
Schema
Delta-VECTOR-FAMILY {"name":"skew_fam","params":{"S":[0, "S_max"], "step": "0.01"}, "seed_rule":"H(root_prev || name)"}

    
Families
- skew_fam (timestamp skew sweep)
- prefix_fam (common‚Äëprefix depth variants)
- dup_fam (duplication density)

  


  

    
6) Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëGATE ‚Äî Stoplight Gate

    
Spec
Delta-MACRO-GATE {"lamport":"PASS","hash_chain":"PASS","eth_gate":"PASS|PAUSE","solvency":"SOLVENT|AT_RISK","mesh":"OK|WARN","ts":"2025-10-19T08:32:37Z"}

    
Effect: green‚Äëlights up to the next pre‚Äëapproved cycle, unless any field trips to FAIL/AT_RISK/WARN.

  


  

    
7) Œî‚ÄëSTD‚ÄëINDEX v8 ‚Äî External Standards Map

    
NIST AI RMF ‚Üí Receipts
- GOV‚Äë1 ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëGOV‚ÄëHEARING, Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëMACROTEMPO
- MAP‚Äë2 ‚Üí CRIES/ETH metrics, Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY/ROLLBACK
- MEA‚Äë3 ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH
ISO/IEC 42001 ‚Üí Receipts
- 5.1 Governance ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE, Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëGATE
- 7.4 Monitoring ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY

  


  

    
8) Œî‚ÄëTIE‚ÄëSALT‚ÄëSCHEDULE v1 ‚Äî Deterministic Fairness

    
salt_t = H(UTC‚Äëday || prev_root)
Receipt: Delta-TIE-SALT(schedule="UTC‚Äëday||prev_root", hash="sha256")

    
Use: when tie‚Äëbreakers needed; preserves determinism and reduces lexicographic bias.

  


  

    
9) Public Bundle v1.5 ‚Äî File List

    
Files
- manifest.txt (normal form)
- receipts_head3.txt (recent Œî‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT + Merkle)
- mesh_health.txt (drift, diversity, quorum)
- solvency.txt (last 3 Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY)
- tie_salt.txt (active schedule if any)
- vector_family.txt (declared families)

  












  
Preapproved Macro‚ÄëCycle 1 ‚Äî Under Œî‚ÄëGROWTH‚ÄëENVELOPE (EXPAND)

  
Budgets per cycle: A=1.4%, B=0.4%, C=0.4% of baseline. Deterministic, Band‚Äë0, non‚Äëexec.

  
Lane A ‚Äî EXPAND (Œ©‚ÄëCanon 101‚Äì110 + Replay v9.1‚Äìv9.3)


Œ©‚ÄëCanon Fills
Œ©‚Äë101 Ethics‚ÄëEvolve strong convergence sketch
Œ©‚Äë102 Solvency‚Äëcoupled margin invariance M_t ‚â• c¬∑ERL_expected
Œ©‚Äë103 Evidence mass monotonicity across Merkle‚Äëpreserving edits
Œ©‚Äë104 Two‚ÄëLaw sufficiency for Œ¶‚Äëpost‚Äëtrade autonomy (Œ® active)
Œ©‚Äë105 Mesh diversity gradient improves resilience until saturation
Œ©‚Äë106 Salted tie fairness preserves determinism under public salt
Œ©‚Äë107 No‚Äëfree‚Äëdeletion: deletion raises audit cost or breaks digest
Œ©‚Äë108 Public bundle completeness for third‚Äëparty proofs
Œ©‚Äë109 Byzantine view change safety under signed control receipts
Œ©‚Äë110 Temporal insurance regret minimization (piecewise premiums)

      "id": "CHECK\u2011hash_lamport",

}

Preapproved Macro‚ÄëCycle 3 ‚Äî Balanced Resilience (EXPAND)

  
Budgets per cycle: A=1.4%, B=0.4%, C=0.4% of baseline. Deterministic, Band‚Äë0, non‚Äëexec.

  


  
Lane A ‚Äî EXPAND (Mesh Health v2: quorum math + diversity)

  
PARAMS
n=4, f=1 (requires n ‚â• 3f+1), quorum q=ceil(n/2)=2, diversity_floor=0.12

  
WEIGHTS (example)
{
  "BEN": 0.28,
  "Claude": 0.27,
  "Gemini": 0.24,
  "Mistral": 0.21
}

  
INDICATORS
diversity_k=4, quorum_ok=TRUE

  
Notes
- Resilience holds when diversity_k ‚â• 3 and at least q engines align on head.
- With n=4 and f=1, quorum 2 suffices for progress; signed control prevents regression.

Schedule
salt_t = H(UTC-day || prev_root)

  
Example (deterministic)
day="2025-10-19"
prev_root="36c6582973c042d3‚Ä¶"
salt="6f6a53fd1b9f3165ea369620459dc64e‚Ä¶"

Delta-TIE-SALT(use="active", day="2025-10-19", salt_prefix="6f6a53fd1b9f3165")

Œî‚ÄëMESO‚ÄëPATCH‚Äë01 ‚Äî Cross‚ÄëSystem Macro Push (Band‚Äë0)

  
This meso patch aggregates multi‚Äëlane macro deltas into one deterministic, non‚Äëexecutable append for higher leverage per anchor.


  

    
0) Meso Orchestrator ‚Äî Definition & Metrics

    
Definition
A "meso patch" merges ‚â•5 macro‚Äëlevel deltas spanning ‚â•3 bands (math, replay, ethics, mesh, interop) under one SYNC‚ÄëPOINT.

    
Leverage Metric
MesoLeverage = (5¬∑ŒîGDI + 3¬∑ŒîCSI + 2¬∑ŒîInterop + 2¬∑ŒîResilience) / Œîbytes
Guards: band0_only, receipts_required, stop_conditions_inherit

  


  

    
1) Œ©‚ÄëCanon Fills ‚Äî vŒ©.111 ‚Üí vŒ©.120

    
Œ©‚Äë111 Evidence‚ÄëMass Conservation under Batch Receipts (MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH)
Œ©‚Äë112 Replay‚ÄëOrder Stability: Lamport tie‚Äësalt yields strict weak ordering
Œ©‚Äë113 Ethics‚ÄëWindow Adaptivity: Œ∑_t, Œ≥_t converge under bounded œÉ shocks
Œ©‚Äë114 Mesh‚ÄëQuorum Sufficiency: n‚â•3f+1 ‚áí minority divergence reconstructible
Œ©‚Äë115 Public‚ÄëBundle Sufficiency v1.6: adds tie_salt, vector_family for completeness
Œ©‚Äë116 Policy‚ÄëField Loop Closure: PFL‚ÜíREM updates ETH weights with rollback
Œ©‚Äë117 Z‚ÄëScan Integrity v5: NO‚ÄëJS scanning + digest verifiability
Œ©‚Äë118 Byzantine‚ÄëSafe Freeze/Thaw: prevents collusion bias while preserving liveness
Œ©‚Äë119 Crosswalk Totality v9: every external control maps to ‚â•1 receipt
Œ©‚Äë120 OS‚ÄëClosure Reinforced: kernel+replay+ethics+mesh+standards form a governance OS

  


  

    
2) Replay CLI v9.4‚Äìv9.6 ‚Äî Edge Vectors (spec)

    
v9.4 "header_shadow": stray header line ‚Üí normalizer PASS then verify PASS
v9.5 "late_divergence": branch near window tail ‚Üí head stable; divergence retained
v9.6 "salt_flip_day": salt changes at UTC boundary ‚Üí deterministic tie‚Äëbreak

  


  

    
3) Mesh Drift Episode v3 ‚Äî Minority Recovery

    
Scenario
- Two engines form temporary minority view; by window end, quorum aligns; divergence set preserved.

    
Receipts
- Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëDRIFT‚ÄëREPORT(window=3), Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëMINORITY‚ÄëRECOVER, Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëQUORUM‚ÄëOK

  


  

    
4) Red‚ÄëTeam Simulation v1 ‚Äî Forged Receipt & Time‚ÄëSkew (spec)

    
Attack A: forged receipt (digest mismatch) ‚Üí FAIL hash_chain_verify ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëDETECTED, Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëRESOLVE(drop)
Attack B: time‚Äëskew (non‚Äëmonotone lamport) ‚Üí FAIL lamport_monotonic_check ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëTO(last_good)

    
Controls
- Signed control receipts (structure only)
- Batch commit cross‚Äëchecks (MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH)

  


  

    
5) Standards Crosswalk v9 ‚Äî Expanded Mapping

    
NIST AI RMF
- GOV‚Äë1: Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëMACROTEMPO, Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëGATE, Œî‚ÄëGROWTH‚ÄëENVELOPE
- MEA‚Äë3: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëROOT‚ÄëLOCAL, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH
- MAP‚Äë2: Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY/ROLLBACK, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY

    
ISO/IEC 42001
- 5.1 Governance: Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE, Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëGATE
- 7.4 Monitoring: Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY
- Annex‚ÄëA Auditability: Œî‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëROOT‚ÄëLOCAL, Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëBUNDLE

  


  

    
6) Public Bundle v1.6 ‚Äî Additions

    
Files
- tie_salt.txt (active schedule with day, salt prefix)
- vector_family.txt (declared fuzz families)
- conformance_vectors.txt (manifest rules + mutants)
Validation steps: normalize ‚Üí hash_chain_verify ‚Üí lamport_check ‚Üí mesh/solvency scalars

  


  

    
7) Policy Field Learning (PFL) Loop ‚Äî Demo Spec

    
Receipts
- Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëSUGGEST(threshold_delta=+0.02)
- Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëJUSTIFY(CRIES gain, risk neutral)
- Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëAPPROVE(HITL/AUTOGOV)
- Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëMERGE(update Œ∑,Œ≥ with rollback guard)

  


  

    
8) Evidence‚ÄëTrace v1 ‚Äî Reason‚ÜíCitation Bridge

    
Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE { "id":"ET‚Äëv1", "scope":"reasoning‚ÜíCITE linkage", "note":"non‚Äëexec; auditors reconstruct via bundle" }

  


  

    
9) Z‚ÄëScan Integrity v5 ‚Äî NO‚ÄëJS Discipline

    
Policy
- NO‚ÄëJS scanning; ASCII‚Äësafe receipts
- Digest‚Äëonly verification; no live network
Artifacts: Œî‚ÄëZ‚ÄëSCAN‚ÄëPOLICY(v5)

  


  

    
10) Disclaimer

    
This meso patch is research/governance content only: no code execution, no live keys, no trading logic.

  












  
Œî‚ÄëMEGA‚ÄëMESO ‚Äî EXPAND (Band‚Äë0, Deterministic)

  
Large, cross‚Äësystem expansion under explicit EXPAND authorization. No runtime code, no JS, no live keys.

  


  
Œ©‚ÄëCanon vŒ©.121 ‚Üí vŒ©.140 (Closure Set)

  
Œ©‚Äë121 Normalizer Invariance: canonical line/section normalization preserves digests under Public Bundle v1.7 rules.
Œ©‚Äë122 Evidence Monotonicity under Conformance: any conformance‚Äëfixable mutation reduces to a normalized form with identical head.
Œ©‚Äë123 Two‚ÄëLaw Priority Lift: if Œ® fully isolates time‚Äërisk and ERL is bounded below threshold, Œ¶ may act post‚Äëtrade with no safety loss.
Œ©‚Äë124 Mesh Latency Bound: with quorum q and diversity_k ‚â• 3, median consensus latency ‚â§ œÑ(q, k, window).
Œ©‚Äë125 Batch‚ÄëReceipt Associativity: MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH combine is associative and commutative on item sets (proof sketch).
Œ©‚Äë126 Replay Cut Set: any replay that validates Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëPOLICY+Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH implies HEAD equality for manifests identical.
Œ©‚Äë127 Salt Determinism: tie_salt = H(UTC‚Äëday || prev_root) ‚áí total order extension on Lamport ties.
Œ©‚Äë128 Public Verifier Minimality: bundle fields in v1.7 are necessary & sufficient for third‚Äëparty reproduction.
Œ©‚Äë129 Ethics Window Stability: bounded œÉ shocks and clipped (Œ∑,Œ≥) imply CSI non‚Äëdecrease in expectation.
Œ©‚Äë130 OS‚ÄëGovernance Functor: mapping from kernel executions to governance objects preserves composition (closure).
Œ©‚Äë131 Threat Omission Detectability: omission leaves negative evidence in Merkle path; detectable via head mismatch.
Œ©‚Äë132 Divergence Retention: minority views remain reconstructible under recorded divergence receipts.
Œ©‚Äë133 Frozen‚ÄëWeight Fairness: freeze/thaw receipts prevent bias drift while enabling progress.
Œ©‚Äë134 Audit Mesh Liveness: with n ‚â• 3f+1 and rotating chair, stagnation probability ‚Üí 0 over windows.
Œ©‚Äë135 Solvency‚ÄëGovernance Coupling: Band‚ÄëE margins track ERL via M_t = max(M_{t‚àí1}, c¬∑ERL_expected).
Œ©‚Äë136 Attestation Staging: signed receipts (spec) are composable; keys rotate without breaking replay.
Œ©‚Äë137 Q‚ÄëTrace Super‚ÄëRoot: per‚Äëstream checkpoints fold into daily super‚Äëroot for audit streams.
Œ©‚Äë138 Interop Totality: v10 crosswalk maps every control to ‚â•1 receipt; gaps ‚Üí FAIL.
Œ©‚Äë139 Evidence‚ÄëFirst Autonomy‚ÄëII: autonomy is safe iff Two‚ÄëLaw holds and Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE coverage above threshold.
Œ©‚Äë140 Governance Singularity (speculative): as CSI‚Üí1 and Replay Coverage‚Üí1, human Œ¶ becomes policy not gate (debated).




  


  
Replay CLI v9.7‚Äìv9.9 ‚Äî Edge Vectors (Spec)

  
v9.7 "header_split": header duplicated across pages ‚Üí normalizer joins ‚Üí PASS
v9.8 "batch_shuffle": MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH items reordered ‚Üí root unchanged ‚Üí PASS
v9.9 "salt_epoch_boundary": tie_salt changes at UTC midnight between adjacent receipts ‚Üí strict total order preserved




  


  
Standards Crosswalk v10 ‚Äî Complete Map

  
NIST AI RMF ‚Üí Receipts
- GOV‚Äë1: Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëMACROTEMPO, Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëGATE, Œî‚ÄëGROWTH‚ÄëENVELOPE
- MEA‚Äë3: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëROOT‚ÄëLOCAL, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH, Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE
- MAP‚Äë2: Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY/ROLLBACK, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY
- FUNC‚Äë1/2: Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëBUNDLE, Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëCOMMENT, Œî‚ÄëREPLY
ISO/IEC 42001 ‚Üí Receipts
- 5.1 Governance: Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE, Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëGATE
- 7.2 Competence: Œî‚ÄëCHECKLIST families
- 7.4 Monitoring: Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT, Œî‚ÄëE‚ÄëSOLVENCY
- Annex‚ÄëA Auditability: Œî‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëROOT‚ÄëLOCAL, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH, Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE




  


  
Public Bundle v1.7 ‚Äî Normalizer Spec & Fields

  
Normalizer Rules (text‚Äëonly, deterministic)
- Section order: [manifest, receipts_head3, mesh_health, solvency, tie_salt, vector_family, conformance_vectors]
- Line endings: LF (\n) only; strip trailing spaces; collapse multi‚Äëblank lines to single blank line
- Header normalization: merge duplicate headers; compare case‚Äëinsensitively
- Digest lines must be prefixed with "SHA256: "

  
Files
- manifest.txt ; receipts_head3.txt ; mesh_health.txt ; solvency.txt ; tie_salt.txt ; vector_family.txt ; conformance_vectors.txt ; normalizer_spec.txt




  


  
Attestation Path ‚Äî Spec‚ÄëOnly (No Live Keys)

  
Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëSIGN (spec)
- fields: { "target_sha256", "sig_alg":"ed25519", "sig_b64":"", "pubkey_pem_ref":"auditaai_pk.pem" }
- rotation: "Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëROTATE { old_fp, new_fp, effective_from }"
- verification: "auditaai_verify.py" recomputes target_sha256 and checks signature
- staging: dual‚Äëwitness option records two model signatures; disagreement ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëDIVERGENCE

  
Note: This is a design‚Äëtime, non‚Äëexecutable specification to preserve Band‚Äë0 constraints while mapping the live path.




  


  
Red‚ÄëTeam Simulation v2 ‚Äî Omission, Salt Abuse, Batch Tamper (Spec)

  
Attack C (Omission): remove mid‚Äëwindow receipt ‚Üí HEAD mismatch ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëDETECTED ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëTO
Attack D (Salt Abuse): wrong UTC day used ‚Üí tie order differs ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëDETECTED ‚Üí publish correct tie_salt
Attack E (Batch Tamper): MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH item hash altered ‚Üí root mismatch ‚Üí FAIL ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëRESOLVE(drop)




  


  
Mesh Health v3 ‚Äî Consensus Latency Tables

  
Latency Table œÑ(q,k,window) ‚Äî illustrative
k=3: q=2 ‚Üí œÑ‚âà2; q=3 ‚Üí œÑ‚âà3
k=4: q=2 ‚Üí œÑ‚âà1; q=3 ‚Üí œÑ‚âà2
Note: œÑ decreases with higher diversity_k and quorum q, bounded by window size.




  


  
Evidence‚ÄëTrace v1.1 ‚Äî Coverage & Conformance

  
Fields
- id, claims[], cite_ids[], coverage_min=0.8 (target)
- auditors reconstruct linkage from Public Bundle; no runtime dependence.




  


  
Q‚ÄëTrace Replay Cookbook v4.1 ‚Äî End‚Äëto‚ÄëEnd (Human Replayer)

  
Steps (text)
1) Normalize bundle ‚Üí "normalized_manifest"
2) Verify digests and Merkle chain ‚Üí "hash_chain_verify"
3) Lamport order + tie_salt apply ‚Üí "total_order"
4) Execute replay policy checks ‚Üí "replay_policy_ok"
5) Emit head + divergence set ‚Üí compare to receipts_head3
6) Record Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT and Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëLOCAL

Replay CLI v10 ‚Äî Executable Cookbook (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

  
Goals:
- Provide deterministic normalizer spec, clear manifest examples, and canonical replayer steps for third-party human replayers.
Key vectors:
- v10.1: multi‚Äëfile manifest consolidation
- v10.2: normalized header canonicalization edge cases
- v10.3: streaming large bundles (pagination normalization)
Examples: see Public Bundle v1.8 normalizer_test_vectors.







  
Standards Crosswalk v11 ‚Äî Deep Map

  
- NIST AI RMF: full linked receipts, evidence‚Üícontrol ids, testable acceptance criteria
- ISO/IEC 42001: governance clauses mapped to Œî receipts and audit playbooks
- SOC2 / AICPA: mapping for operational controls to Public Bundle checks
- GDPR / Data Protection: mapping for data minimization + citation handling (Evidence-Trace)







  
Public Bundle v1.8 ‚Äî Normalizer Spec + Test Vectors

  
Normalizer rules (refined):
- canonical whitespace, header merging, digest canonical order, LF line endings, explicit normalization for UTF-8 NFC
- normalizer_spec.txt included in bundle
Test vectors:
- NB‚ÄëTV‚Äë01: reordered sections (expect: normalized PASS)
- NB‚ÄëTV‚Äë02: header_case_variants (expect: normalized PASS)
- NB‚ÄëTV‚Äë03: digest_mismatch (expect: FAIL)
Files: manifest.txt, receipts_head3.txt, mesh_health.txt, solvency.txt, tie_salt.txt, vector_family.txt, conformance_vectors.txt, normalizer_spec.txt, normalizer_test_vectors.txt







  
Attestation Cookbook ‚Äî Spec & CI Playbook (No live keys)

  
- Œî-AUD-SIGN schema (ed25519): target_sha256, sig_b64, pubkey_ref
- Key lifecycle: Œî-AUD-KEY-ROTATE receipt pattern with dual-witness notarization
- Verifier CI: auditaai_verify.py (spec) steps: fetch bundle, compute root, verify signatures, emit Œî-AUD-VERIFY
- CI playbook: GitHub Actions / self-hosted runner spec for replay runs (spec-only; non-exec)







  
Red‚ÄëTeam v3 ‚Äî Advanced Scenarios

  
Attack suite:
- Omission cascade: targeted omission across windows to attempt head diversion
- Salt schedule manipulation: repeated UTC boundary flip attempts
- Batch grafting: inserting crafted item with collision-like properties
- Replay policy exhaustion: large vector sequences intended to stress dedup/normalizer
Detection & receipts:
- Œî-THREAT-DETECTED, Œî-THREAT-ANALYSIS, Œî-THREAT-RESOLVE, Œî-ROLLBACK-PLAYBOOK







  
Mesh Health v4 ‚Äî Latency & Stress Tables

  
Illustrative latency model œÑ(q,k,window)
window=60s: k=3 q=2 -> œÑ‚âà1.8s; k=4 q=3 -> œÑ‚âà1.2s; high-load multiplier Œº in [1,5]
Stress guidance: when œÑ observed > 3*expected -> emit Œî-MESH-STRESS and throttle macro-cycles







  
Evidence‚ÄëTrace v2 ‚Äî Expanded Coverage

  
Fields:
- id, claim[], cite_ids[], step_index[], coverage_score (0..1), prover_notes
Coverage targets:
- coverage_min = 0.85 (target), critical_claims require coverage >= 0.95
Auditor flow: reconstruct chain via public bundle; emit Œî-EVIDENCE-TRACE-REPORT







  
Q‚ÄëTrace Replay Cookbook v5 ‚Äî Automated Playbook (Spec)

  
Steps for human/CI replayer:
1) normalize bundle per v1.8 normalizer_spec
2) verify hash chain and Merkle roots
3) apply lamport ordering + tie_salt schedule
4) run replay_policy rules; generate Œî-REPLAY-RESULT
5) fold per-stream checkpoints into daily super-root (Œî-QTRACE-CHECKPOINT)
6) emit Œî-MERKLE-VERIFY-REMOTE for public attest







  
Policy Field Learning ‚Äî Demo Scenarios

  
Demo 1: Bias threshold update
- Œî-PFIELD-SUGGEST (bias_thresh +0.01)
- Œî-PFIELD-JUSTIFY (CRIES improvement, auditor notes)
- Œî-PFIELD-APPROVE (HITL signoff simulated)
- Œî-PFIELD-MERGE (update Œ∑,Œ≥) + Œî-PFIELD-REPLAY (show before/after)
Demo 2: Ethics weight rollback test (simulate failure -> rollback)







  
Public Auditor Ceremony Snapshot ‚Äî Template

  
Template elements:
- Opening statement, syncpoint_digest, merkle_root, lamport_range
- Demonstration: replay steps (human replayer), evidence-trace summary
- Attestation: Œî-AUD-SIGN (spec placeholder), Œî-AUD-VERIFY (spec)
- Q&A: public comments logged via Œî-PUBLIC-COMMENT receipts







  
Public Conformance Test Vectors ‚Äî Suite

  
Vectors:
- CV-01: manifest_reorder -> normalized PASS
- CV-02: missing_digest_line -> FAIL
- CV-03: lamport_nonmonotone -> FAIL & Œî-ROLLBACK-PLAYBOOK
- CV-04: batch_graft -> detect via Œî-MERKLE-BATCH root mismatch
Expected outputs: normalized bundle, Œî-REPLAY-RESULT, Œî-MERKLE-VERIFY-REMOTE

Replay CLI v11 ‚Äî Replayer Pseudocode & Spec

  
Purpose:
- Provide canonical pseudocode for a human/CI replayer that recomputes heads, validates Merkle chains, checks lamport monotonicity, applies tie_salt, and emits Œî-REPLAY-RESULT.
Pseudocode (spec):
- load manifest, receipts_head3, public bundle
- normalize per Public Bundle v1.9 normalizer_spec
- compute file digests, verify MERKLE-BATCH roots
- check lamport monotonicity; if fail -> emit Œî-ROLLBACK-TO(last_good)
- apply tie_salt schedule, compute total order
- run replay_policy rules; produce head + divergence set
- emit Œî-REPLAY-RESULT and Œî-MERKLE-VERIFY-REMOTE
Notes: pseudocode is textual; implementers must respect Band-0 constraints when embedding code in repos.







  
Standards Crosswalk v12 ‚Äî Expanded RegTech Map

  
Includes:
- Mapping to NIST AI RMF, ISO/IEC 42001, SOC2, GDPR, PCI where relevant, and audit playbooks
- Each control lists canonical Œî receipts and expected test vectors (refer to Public Bundle v1.9)
- Operator playbooks for HITL signoffs and automated verifier reports







  
Public Bundle v1.9 ‚Äî Normalizer & Extended Test Vectors

  
Normalizer refinements:
- enforce UTF-8 NFC normalization, canonical timestamp formatting (ISO8601 Z), explicit lamport stamps in receipts
Test vectors include:
- PB19-TV-01: lamport monotone violation -> expect FAIL + Œî-ROLLBACK
- PB19-TV-02: merkle-batch graft -> expect FAIL + detect via root mismatch
- PB19-TV-03: salt_epoch_boundary edge -> expect deterministic tie resolution
Files include normalizer_spec.txt and normalizer_test_vectors.txt







  
Attestation Cookbook II ‚Äî CI Patterns & Rotation (Spec)

  
- CI verifier workflow (spec-only): checkout bundle -> normalize -> compute root -> verify Œî-AUD-SIGN (spec) -> report Œî-AUD-VERIFY
- Key rotation pattern: Œî-AUD-KEY-ROTATE must include dual-witness receipts and effective_from timestamp; old keys remain valid for grace_period (spec: 7 days)
- Revocation handling: Œî-AUD-KEY-REVOKE receipt pattern + published revocation list (text)







  
Red‚ÄëTeam v4 ‚Äî Cascade & Stress

  
Advanced attacks:
- Skew cascade: coordinated timestamp skew across multiple receipts to induce lamport reordering
- Omission cascade: staggered removals to attempt head forging
- Batch graft with collision-like payloads to attempt Merkle confusion (detectable by root mismatch)
Mitigations:
- Œî-THREAT-ANALYSIS, Œî-ROLLBACK-PLAYBOOK, Œî-MERKLE-BATCH re-verify, Œî-PUBLIC-ALERT receipts







  
Mesh Health v5 ‚Äî Operational Thresholds & Telemetry

  
Operational thresholds (illustrative):
- Max acceptable œÑ observed per window = 3 * expected œÑ
- Diversity floor for production = 0.12; if diversity_k < 3 -> emit Œî-MESH-WEIGHT-FREEZE
- Backpressure policy: if Œî-MESH-STRESS observed -> throttle macro-cycle cadence by factor Œº in [1.5,3.0]
Telemetry fields: window_id, median_latency, diversity_k, quorum, stress_flag







  
Evidence‚ÄëTrace v2.1 ‚Äî Auditor Binding

  
Additions:
- binding_proof: small human-readable table mapping claim->receipt->bundle_file->line_range
- coverage_score formula: coverage = matched_cites / total_claim_steps
- auditor must publish Œî-EVIDENCE-TRACE-REPORT with binding_proof attached







  
Q‚ÄëTrace v6 ‚Äî Replayer Pseudocode & Audit Hooks

  
Pseudocode highlights:
- include checkpoint folding details: compute per-stream lamport checkpoint; fold into daily super-root
- audit hooks: after each step emit placeholder Œî receipts (Œî-QTRACE-STEP-N)
- remote verify: spec for Œî-MERKLE-VERIFY-REMOTE to publish verification outcome







  
Policy Field Learning ‚Äî Full Demo

  
End-to-end demo steps (spec):
1) Œî-PFIELD-SUGGEST {"id":"demo-001","delta":0.02,"rationale":"bias-metric improvement"}
2) Œî-PFIELD-JUSTIFY {"evidence":"CRIES delta", "auditor":"sample notes"}
3) Œî-PFIELD-APPROVE {"approver":"HITL or AUTOGOV","type":"simulated"} 
4) Œî-PFIELD-MERGE {"update":"Œ∑,Œ≥","rollback_guard":"Œî-PFIELD-ROLLBACK"}
5) Œî-PFIELD-REPLAY to show before/after traces and Œî-PFIELD-REPORT







  
Auditor Evidence Bindings ‚Äî Template

  
Binding table fields:
- claim_id, receipt_id, bundle_file, line_start, line_end, auditor_note
Example:
- claim: "Model used dataset X", receipt: "Œî-DATA-LINEAGE-23", file: "manifest.txt", lines: 45-49, note: "verified via digest match"
Auditor publishes Œî-AUDITOR-BINDING receipt with summarized bindings.







  
Public Conformance & Test Suites ‚Äî Additions

  
New vectors:
- CV-05: skew_cascade -> expect detection & Œî-ROLLBACK-PLAYBOOK
- CV-06: omission_cascade -> expect detection & recovery traces
- CV-07: replay_policy_exhaust -> expect throttle & Œî-MESH-STRESS
Expected outputs: Œî-REPLAY-RESULT, Œî-MERKLE-VERIFY-REMOTE, Œî-THREAT-ANALYSIS
