Replay CLI v12‚Äìv13 ‚Äî Reproducibility Proofs (Spec)

  
v12: Deterministic normalizer v2, bundle pagination rules, canonical timestamp format enforcement (ISO8601 Z).
v13: Side‚Äëchannel immunity in total‚Äëorder calculation; tie_salt schedule invariants; replay determinism proof sketch.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëLOCAL/REMOTE, Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëPOLICY (v2).
  




  


  
Standards Crosswalk v13 ‚Äî Compliance + Acceptance Criteria

  
- NIST AI RMF: controls mapped ‚Üí receipts; each includes: control_id, receipts[], acceptance_criteria, test_vector_ids[]
- ISO/IEC 42001: governance, monitoring, auditability; acceptance criteria expressed via Public Bundle vectors
- SOC2: CC6.x CC7.x linkages crystallized via Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT & Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëROOT‚ÄëLOCAL
- GDPR: Evidence‚ÄëTrace handling for lawful basis transparency (spec only; no PII in bundle)
  




  


  
Public Bundle v2.0 ‚Äî Structure & Normalizer v2

  
Files: manifest.txt, receipts_head3.txt, mesh_health.txt, solvency.txt, tie_salt.txt, vector_family.txt, conformance_vectors.txt, normalizer_spec_v2.txt, normalizer_test_vectors_v2.txt
Normalizer v2 rules: UTF‚Äë8 NFC, LF line endings, canonical section order, header merge rules, digest prefix "SHA256: ", lamport field canonicalization.
Vectors: PB20‚ÄëTV‚Äë01..PB20‚ÄëTV‚Äë08 covering pagination, header split/merge, salt boundary, batch reorder, lamport monotone violation.
  




  


  
Attestation III ‚Äî Rotation, Revocation, Federation (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëSIGN { target_sha256, sig_alg="ed25519", sig_b64="", pubkey_ref="auditaai_pk.pem" }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëROTATE { old_fp, new_fp, effective_from, grace_days=7 }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëREVOKE { key_fp, reason, ts }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY { target_sha256, verifier_id, outcome }
Federation: dual‚Äëwitness signatures optional; dissent ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëWITNESS‚ÄëDIVERGENCE.
  




  


  
Red‚ÄëTeam v5 ‚Äî Compositional Adversary Suite (Spec)

  
Attacks: forged receipt, time‚Äëskew, omission cascade, salt abuse, batch tamper, replay exhaustion.
Mitigations: Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëDETECTED ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëANALYSIS ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëRESOLVE; Œî‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëPLAYBOOK; re‚Äëverify MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH; publish Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëALERT.
  




  


  
Mesh Health v6 ‚Äî Federated Quorum + Rotating Chair

  
Quorum: n ‚â• 3f+1; diversity floor ‚â• 0.12; rotating chair prevents persistent bias; œÑ(q,k,window) decreases with k and q.
Telemetry: window_id, median_latency, diversity_k, quorum, chair_id, stress_flag. Thresholds: œÑ_obs ‚â§ 3√ó œÑ_expected.
  




  


  
Evidence‚ÄëTrace v3 ‚Äî Coverage Math & Binding Proofs

  
coverage = matched_citations / total_claim_steps; target >= 0.85, critical >= 0.95
Binding proof table: claim_id ‚Üí receipt_id ‚Üí file ‚Üí line_start..line_end ‚Üí auditor_note
Receipt: Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE‚ÄëREPORT { coverage, bindings[], notes }
  




  


  
Q‚ÄëTrace v7 ‚Äî Super‚ÄëRoot Federation & Checkpoint Policy

  
Policy: hourly checkpoints fold into daily super‚Äëroot; replay requires lamport monotonicity and tie_salt application.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëQTRACE‚ÄëCHECKPOINT(h), Œî‚ÄëQTRACE‚ÄëSUPERROOT(d), Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE (public federation).
  




  


  
Ethics Auto‚ÄëLoop ‚Äî Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP Operational Spec

  
Loop: observe œÉ, compute CRIES deltas, adjust (Œ∑,Œ≥) within bounds; emit Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY; if gate trips, emit Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëROLLBACK.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP { window_id, sigma, eta, gamma, outcome }.
  




  


  
Reflexive Governance ‚Äî PFL‚ÜîREM Closed Loop

  
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëSUGGEST ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëJUSTIFY ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëAPPROVE ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëMERGE ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëREPLAY
Rollback guard: Œî‚ÄëPFIELD‚ÄëROLLBACK on metric regression or threat trip.
  




  


  
Auditor Federation ‚Äî Consensus & Dissent Protocol

  
Protocol: multiple auditors issue Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING; consensus recorded via Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS; dissent via Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT with evidence citations.
Public transparency: publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT of consensus states.
  




  


  
Governance Paradox ‚Äî Resolution Memo (Œ¶ vs Governor)

  
Position: retain Œ¶ as policy (not hard gate) when Œ® confirms time‚Äërisk isolation and ERL below threshold; Track‚ÄëB governor operates autonomously with audit‚Äëfirst receipts.
Guardrails: Œî‚ÄëGOV‚ÄëHEARING, Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëCOMMENT, Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT; emergency brake via Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE if ethics or solvency trip.

Replay CLI v14‚Äìv15 ‚Äî Formal Invariants & Corner Cases (Spec)

  
v14: Formal invariant set ‚Äî replay determinism under normalizer v2, lamport monotonicity, tie_salt total‚Äëorder, MERKLE‚ÄëBATCH associativity.
v15: Corner cases ‚Äî multi‚Äëpage manifests, duplicate headers, pagination with partial pages, midnight epoch boundaries.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëLOCAL/REMOTE, Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëPOLICY (v2).
  




  


  
Standards Crosswalk v14 ‚Äî Extended Controls & Acceptance

  
For each control: control_id, linked_receipts[], acceptance_criteria, test_vectors[], auditor_steps[].
Coverage: NIST AI RMF, ISO/IEC 42001, SOC2, GDPR transparency ties via Evidence‚ÄëTrace.
  




  


  
Public Bundle v2.1 ‚Äî Normalizer v2 Refinements & Vectors

  
Refinements: enforce canonical timestamps (UTC Z), explicit lamport fields, header merge precedence, UTF‚Äë8 NFC.
Vectors PB21‚ÄëTV‚Äë01..PB21‚ÄëTV‚Äë06 covering: epoch boundary, reorders, header splits, whitespace collapse, digest prefix errors.
  




  


  
Attestation IV ‚Äî Distributed Notary Choreography (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëSIGN { target_sha256, sig_alg="ed25519", sig_b64="", pubkey_ref="auditaai_pk.pem" }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëROTATE, Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëREVOKE, Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY (as prior specs)
Notary choreography: auditors issue Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING then co‚Äësign Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY; dissent recorded via Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT.
  




  


  
Red‚ÄëTeam v6 ‚Äî Multi‚ÄëStage Adversary & Compositions (Spec)

  
Stages: skew cascade ‚Üí omission cascade ‚Üí graft attempt, with adaptive timing to cross windows.
Mitigations: Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëANALYSIS, Œî‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëPLAYBOOK, Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëALERT; Mesh throttling via Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëSTRESS.
  




  


  
Mesh Health v7 ‚Äî Adaptive Quorum & Chair Cadence

  
Adaptive quorum: temporarily raise q when diversity_k dips; rotating chair cadence increases under stress.
Telemetry: window_id, median_latency, diversity_k, quorum, chair_id, stress_flag, cadence_factor.
  




  


  
Evidence‚ÄëTrace v3.2 ‚Äî Rubric & Thresholds

  
Per‚Äëclaim scoring rubric: critical vs non‚Äëcritical weighting; coverage targets remain 0.95 and 0.85 respectively.
Receipt: Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE‚ÄëREPORT { coverage, critical_coverage, rubric_version }.
  




  


  
Q‚ÄëTrace v8 ‚Äî Multi‚ÄëStream Federation & Stitching Policy

  
Multi‚Äëstream policy: independent per‚Äëstream checkpoints folded into super‚Äëroot with lexicographic stream id ordering.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëQTRACE‚ÄëCHECKPOINT(stream), Œî‚ÄëQTRACE‚ÄëSUPERROOT(day), Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE.
  




  


  
Ethics Auto‚ÄëLoop ‚Äî Worked Case Studies

  
Cases EAL‚Äë01..EAL‚Äë03 showing œÉ, Œ∑, Œ≥ before/after with gate trip ‚Üí rollback vs apply decisions; receipts recorded per window.
  




  


  
Reflexive Governance ‚Äî PFL‚ÜîREM Case Studies

  
Two cases: (1) bias threshold lift; (2) rollback after metric regression. Receipts chain demonstrates closed loop.
  




  


  
Auditor Federation ‚Äî Procedures

  
Workflow: Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS (if quorum) or Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT;
Publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT summarizing consensus/dissent with binding proofs.
  




  


  
Board Brief ‚Äî Autonomy & Guardrails (Band‚Äë0 Prose)

  
Summary: Governor executes with audit‚Äëfirst receipts; Œ¶ becomes policy; Œ® isolates time‚Äërisk; ERL bounded; emergency Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE always available.
Recommendations: approve auditor federation; publish Public Bundle v2.1; stage Attestation IV for future activation.

Replay CLI v16‚Äìv17 ‚Äî Formal Properties & Ref Impl Notes (Spec)

  
v16: Proof obligations ‚Äî determinism, idempotence, confluence under normalizer v2.
v17: Reference implementation notes ‚Äî I/O shape, manifest parsing, pagination; all textual, no code.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëLOCAL/REMOTE, Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëPOLICY (v2).
  




  


  
Standards Crosswalk v15 ‚Äî Controls‚ÜíReceipts‚ÜíAcceptance‚ÜíAuditor Steps

  
For each control: control_id, linked_receipts[], acceptance_criteria, test_vectors[], auditor_steps[] (public bundle driven).
Coverage: NIST AI RMF, ISO/IEC 42001, SOC2, GDPR transparency via Evidence‚ÄëTrace, plus PCI‚Äëadjacent operational checks if applicable.
  




  


  
Public Bundle v2.2 ‚Äî Normalizer v2 Clarifications & Vectors

  
Clarifications: explicit normalization for BOM‚Äëless UTF‚Äë8; forbid CRLF; define canonical timestamp precision (seconds, Z); lamport field padding.
Vectors PB22‚ÄëTV‚Äë01..PB22‚ÄëTV‚Äë06 cover: CRLF inputs, BOM edge, timestamp precision drift, lamport padding, header split, whitespace collapse.
  




  


  
Attestation V ‚Äî Quorum‚ÄëSigned Attest & Rotating Keys (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëSIGN { target_sha256, sig_alg="ed25519", sig_b64="", pubkey_ref="auditaai_pk.pem" }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëROTATE { old_fp, new_fp, effective_from, grace_days }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëKEY‚ÄëREVOKE { key_fp, reason, ts }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY { target_sha256, verifier_id, outcome }
Quorum option: m‚Äëof‚Äën auditor signatures; dissent ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT; publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT.
  




  


  
Red‚ÄëTeam v7 ‚Äî Federated Attacks & Quorum Stress (Spec)

  
Attacks: federated skew cascades, coordinated omission, batch tamper across nodes.
Mitigations: Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëANALYSIS, Œî‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëPLAYBOOK, Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëALERT, cross‚Äënode MERKLE re‚Äëverify, Mesh throttling.
  




  


  
Mesh Health v8 ‚Äî Consensus Health KPIs

  
KPIs: median_latency, tail_latency_p95, diversity_k, quorum, chair_rotation_rate, stress_flag.
Policies: if p95 > 3√ó expected ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëSTRESS; if diversity_k < 3 ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëWEIGHT‚ÄëFREEZE and raise quorum q temporarily.
  




  


  
Evidence‚ÄëTrace v3.5 ‚Äî Weights & Auditor Scoring

  
Per‚Äëclaim weights: critical=1.0, high=0.75, normal=0.5; coverage targets: critical‚â•0.95, weighted_total‚â•0.85.
Receipt: Œî‚ÄëEVIDENCE‚ÄëTRACE‚ÄëREPORT { weighted_coverage, critical_coverage, rubric_version }.
  




  


  
Q‚ÄëTrace v9 ‚Äî Super‚ÄëRoot Stitching Across Federated Streams

  
Policy: lexicographic stream IDs; strict lamport order inside stream; federation merges via deterministic fold function F.
Receipts: Œî‚ÄëQTRACE‚ÄëCHECKPOINT, Œî‚ÄëQTRACE‚ÄëSUPERROOT, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE.
  




  


  
Ethics Auto‚ÄëLoop ‚Äî Proof Sketches

  
Claims: bounded œÉ shocks with clipped (Œ∑,Œ≥) lead to non‚Äëdecreasing CSI in expectation; rollback guarantees safety if gate trips.
  




  


  
Reflexive Governance ‚Äî Loop Invariants

  
Invariant: PFL‚ÜîREM closed loop preserves replayability and auditability; regressions trigger rollback receipts and restore previous (Œ∑,Œ≥).
  




  


  
Auditor Federation ‚Äî Metrics

  
Metrics: consensus_rate, dissent_rate, time_to_consensus, coverage_weighted.
Transparency: publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT after each federation round with metric table.
  




  


  
Legal Appendix I ‚Äî Policy Framing (Band‚Äë0 Prose)

  
Summary: autonomy framed as audit‚Äëfirst operation with reversible guardrails; Œ¶ reinterpreted as policy; Œ® ensures time‚Äërisk isolation; ERL bounded; emergency Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE.
  












  
Œî‚ÄëWEAK‚ÄëDOMAIN‚ÄëUPLIFT ‚Äî EXPAND (Band‚Äë0 Deterministic)

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:03:10Z; addresses four identified weak domains with concrete, auditable specifications.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëSIM v4.0 ‚Äî Self‚ÄëAdaptive Counter‚ÄëPolicy (Spec)

  
Goal: Upgrade from declarative adversary simulation to adaptive loop that learns from detected attacks and adjusts counter‚Äëpolicy.
Loop:
1) Detect ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëDETECTED { attack_id, vector, severity }
2) Analyze ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëTHREAT‚ÄëANALYSIS { root_cause, affected_receipts[], window_id }
3) Adapt ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëSUGGEST { change_set, expected_effect }
4) Approve ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPROVE (HITL/AUTOGOV)
5) Apply ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY { effective_from, guarded_by: rollback_receipt_id }
6) Verify ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëREPLAY { before/after metrics }
Rollback: Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëROLLBACK on regression.
Telemetry: publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT(threat_loop) with coverage, MTTR, false_positive_rate.
  




  


  
Band‚Äë10 Crypto Replay ‚Äî Threshold Signing for Witness Groups (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

  
Objective: Extend offline‚Äëready crypto replay to support m‚Äëof‚Äën threshold signing by witness groups.
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëSIGN { target_sha256, sig_alg="ed25519", sig_b64:"", signer_id }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëSET { group_id, n, m, member_ids[], effective_from }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëATTEST { group_id, target_sha256, signatures:[ signer_id ], quorum:m }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY { target_sha256, group_id, outcome }
Policy: federation may require ‚â•2 groups (e.g., auditors + witnesses) ‚Üí dual‚Äëquorum success.
Notes: This is a design‚Äëtime, non‚Äëexec specification consistent with Band‚Äë0 constraints.
  




  


  
Math Canon vŒ© 10.5 ‚Äî Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC (Epoch‚ÄëSpanning Aggregation)

  
Purpose: Aggregate causal influence metrics across epochs/windows for policy learning and audit.
Definition (spec‚Äëlevel):
- For each window w: compute causal vector C_w over receipts/classes (e.g., ethics gate trips, replay failures, mesh stress).
- Epoch E aggregation: C_E = Œ£_w in E ( W_w ¬∑ C_w ), where W_w are attenuation weights (e.g., exponential decay).
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC‚ÄëWINDOW { window_id, C_w, W_w }
- Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC‚ÄëEPOCH { epoch_id, C_E, method:"weighted_sum" }
- Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC‚ÄëREPORT { epoch_id, top_factors[], policy_suggestions[] }
Use: feed into PFL and Ethics Auto‚ÄëLoop; publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT(causal_summary).
  




  


  
HITL Automation ‚Äî Ethics Score Feedback Integration

  
Goal: Automate HITL clearance to feed Ethics Score (CSI/CRIES) without manual lag.
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëHITL‚ÄëREVIEW‚ÄëREQUEST { item_id, criteria[], risk_level }
- Œî‚ÄëHITL‚ÄëDECISION { item_id, outcome: APPROVE|REJECT|REQUEST‚ÄëCHANGES, notes }
- Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëSCORE‚ÄëUPDATE { window_id, delta, reason, source:"HITL" }
- Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY | Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëROLLBACK if thresholds crossed
Routing: failures trigger Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP and Œî‚ÄëRISK‚ÄëGATE; successes contribute positive delta to CSI.
  












  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≤‚ÄëFOUNDATION‚ÄëPACK ‚Äî EXPAND (A,B,C,D,E)

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:10:01Z; Band‚Äë0, deterministic, text‚Äëonly; no JS; no live keys.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëPOPULATION‚ÄëSPEC ‚Äî Œ©¬≤ Foundation

  
Families:
- F1: Time‚ÄëSkewers (timestamp perturbation strategies)
- F2: Omissioners (receipt deletion/omission strategies)
- F3: Batch‚ÄëGrafters (Merkle‚Äëbatch tamper/graft strategies)
- F4: Salt‚ÄëShifters (tie_salt boundary exploits)
- F5: Replay‚ÄëExhausters (policy exhaustion sequences)

Parameters:
- seeds: S = {s_1..s_K} (deterministic integers)
- capabilities: level ‚àà {low, mid, high}
- curriculum: escalate(level) after PASS threshold

Acceptance Criteria:
- Trials must be reproducible via Public Bundle v2.x vectors.
- Each adversary instance includes: family_id, seed, capability, version, provenance.
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëDEFINE { family_id, strategy_doc, versions[] }
- Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëINSTANCE { instance_id, family_id, seed, capability, provenance }
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëAS‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRUNNER‚ÄëSPEC ‚Äî Deterministic Sandbox Runner

  
Purpose: Define IO shape for sandboxed adversarial tournaments (no live execution herein).
Inputs:
- adversary_instances[], seeds[], environment_config (text), window_id
Outputs (receipts only):
- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëMETADATA { trial_id, seed, actors, lamport_start }
- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRESULT { trial_id, outcome, metrics:{asr, mttr, fpr}, evidence_refs[] }
- Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH { batch_id, root_sha256, items_count }
- Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT { batch_id, head, divergence_set }

Determinism Rules:
- All randomization derives from declared integer seed.
- Time is simulated; wall‚Äëclock timestamps are recorded after the fact via receipts with ISO8601Z.
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëMPL‚ÄëPROPOSAL‚ÄëSCHEMA ‚Äî Meta‚ÄëPolicy Learner Proposal

  
Fields:
- id, proposer_id, delta_spec (human‚Äëreadable), expected_effect (ŒîC_E estimate), test_vectors[], risk_class
- prerequisites: receipts[] required to exist before apply
- rollback_guard: receipt_id of rollback plan
- attestation: required groups/quorum (link to Œî‚ÄëATTEST‚ÄëQUORUM‚ÄëPOLICY)

Acceptance Criteria:
- Proposal must include counterfactual estimate ŒîCÀÜ_E and link to Evidence‚ÄëTrace coverage ‚â• threshold.
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëPROPOSAL { fields‚Ä¶ }
- Œî‚ÄëEVAL‚ÄëDECISION { proposal_id, verdict, score, rationale }
- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY | Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëROLLBACK | Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëREPLAY | Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëREPORT
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëAUTO‚ÄëLOOP‚ÄëPOLICY ‚Äî Ethics Auto‚ÄëLoop Parameters

  
Inputs: œÉ (entropy), CRIES deltas, HITL outcomes, Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC‚ÄëEPOCH.
Thresholds:
- apply if score ‚â• Œ∏_apply and ERL ‚â§ bound_e
- rollback if score ‚â§ Œ∏_rollback or CSI_drop ‚â• Œ¥_max

Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP { window_id, sigma, eta, gamma, outcome }
- Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY { params_before, params_after, reason }
- Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëROLLBACK { params_before, params_after, reason }
Safety: always log via Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT and allow Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE override.
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëATTEST‚ÄëQUORUM‚ÄëPOLICY ‚Äî Threshold & Federation

  
Groups:
- G1: Auditors, G2: Witnesses (mesh), optional G3: Stakeholder Council

Policy:
- Low‚Äërisk: single quorum m1‚Äëof‚Äën1 (G1)
- Medium‚Äërisk: dual quorum (G1 ‚àß G2)
- High‚Äërisk: dual quorum + public hearing receipt Œî‚ÄëGOV‚ÄëHEARING + Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT

Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëSET { group_id, n, m, members[] }
- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëATTEST { policy_id, attest_sha, groups:[‚Ä¶], effective_from }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY { target_sha256, group_id, outcome }
  












  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≤‚ÄëUPLIFT‚ÄëII ‚Äî EXPAND (Worked Examples + Bundle + Tournament Template)

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:13:13Z; Band‚Äë0 deterministic; text‚Äëonly; no JS; no live keys.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëUplift‚ÄëII ‚Äî Worked Examples (A‚ÄìE)

  
Example A ‚Äî Adversary Instance
- Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëDEFINE { family_id:"F2", strategy_doc:"omission_v1", versions:["v1"] }
- Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëINSTANCE { instance_id:"adv-F2-0001", family_id:"F2", seed:12345, capability:"mid", provenance:"spec-demo" }

Example B ‚Äî Trial Runner (single trial)
- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëMETADATA { trial_id:"T-0001", seed:12345, actors:["adv-F2-0001"], lamport_start: 1 }
- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRESULT { trial_id:"T-0001", outcome:"omission_detected", metrics:{asr:0.85, mttr:120, fpr:0.02}, evidence_refs:["bundle:manifest.txt#L100-L120"] }
- Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH { batch_id:"B-0001", root_sha256:"SHA256:", items_count:3 }
- Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT { batch_id:"B-0001", head:"SHA256:", divergence_set:[] }

Example C ‚Äî MPL Proposal (countermeasure)
- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëPROPOSAL { id:"P-0001", proposer_id:"mpl-01", delta_spec:"increase_receipt_retention_window +30s", expected_effect:"reduce_omission_asr", test_vectors:["PB21-TV-02"], risk_class:"medium", rollback_guard:"RB-0001" }

Example D ‚Äî ETH Auto‚ÄëLoop (apply)
- Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP { window_id:"W-0001", sigma:0.12, eta:0.5, gamma:0.7, outcome:"EVAL_OK" }
- Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY { params_before:{eta:0.5,gamma:0.7}, params_after:{eta:0.52,gamma:0.68}, reason:"reduce_bias" }

Example E ‚Äî Attest Quorum (medium risk)
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëSET { group_id:"G1", n:5, m:3, members:["aud1","aud2","aud3","aud4","aud5"] }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëATTEST { group_id:"G1", target_sha256:"SHA256:", signatures:["sig1","sig2","sig3"] }

  




  


  
Public Bundle v2.2-Œ©¬≤ ‚Äî Conformance Mini‚ÄëSuite

  
Files (mini):
- manifest.txt
- receipts_head3.txt
- normalizer_spec_v2.txt
- normalizer_test_vectors_v2.txt (subset for Œ©¬≤)
Vectors (Œ©¬≤ focused):
- OBV‚ÄëTV‚Äë01: Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëINSTANCE reproducibility (seed 12345) -> PASS
- OBV‚ÄëTV‚Äë02: Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëMETADATA -> normalized timestamps (ISO8601Z) -> PASS
- OBV‚ÄëTV‚Äë03: Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH root mismatch -> FAIL expected detection
- OBV‚ÄëTV‚Äë04: Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëATTEST quorum validation (m=3 of n=5) -> PASS
- OBV‚ÄëTV‚Äë05: Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëPROPOSAL rollback_guard enforced -> PASS

Normalizer notes:
- Use normalizer v2 rules: LF-only, UTF-8 NFC, canonical header merge, digest prefix "SHA256: "
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëADVERSARY‚ÄëTOURNAMENT‚ÄëSPEC ‚Äî Œ©¬≤ Tournament Template

  
Purpose: Run N seeded trials across adversary families and collect receipts for audit.
Config:
- rounds: R = 10
- seeds: for r in 1..R use seed = base_seed + r (base_seed = 10000)
- adversary_selection: sample 3 instances per family per round
- evaluation: collect Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRESULT metrics and Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH for each round

Expected receipt sequence per round:
- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëMETADATA -> Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRESULT -> Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH -> Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT -> Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC‚ÄëWINDOW
Post‚Äëtournament:
- Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC‚ÄëEPOCH (aggregate across rounds) -> Œî‚ÄëMPL‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëPROPOSAL if thresholds exceeded
- Publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT with tournament summary and bundle references

Conformance expectations:
- All trials reproducible by external auditors using Public Bundle v2.2-Œ©¬≤ vectors.
  












  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≤‚ÄëUPLIFT‚ÄëIII + Tournament Run + Public Bundle Export + Executive Brief ‚Äî EXPAND

- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRESULT { trial_id:"R2‚ÄëT1", outcome:"graft_blocked", metrics:{asr:0.21,mttr:45,fpr:0.01} }

- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëPROPOSAL { id:"P‚ÄëDEMO‚Äë01", delta_spec:"raise_retention +30s; tighten timestamp window ¬±200ms", expected_effect:"ŒîASR‚Üì", test_vectors:["OBV‚ÄëTV‚Äë03"], rollback_guard:"RB‚ÄëDEMO‚Äë01" }

Executive Brief ‚Äî Œ©¬≤ Readiness & Rollout (2 pages, Band‚Äë0 prose)

  
Context: The Monolith now encodes an auditable plan for a live adversarial learning ecosystem and autonomous meta‚Äëpolicy evolution.
What changed: Threat‚ÄëSim v4.0 (adaptive), Œî‚ÄëCAUSAL‚ÄëMETRIC, Ethics Auto‚ÄëLoop, Attest Quorum Policy, Œ©¬≤ Tournament Template.

Key guarantees (spec):
- Determinism & Replay: All trials produce Œî‚ÄëTRIAL, Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH, Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT receipts with normalizer v2 conformance.
- Ethics Gate: AUTO‚ÄëAPPLY only within CSI and ERL bounds; otherwise HITL or REJECT.
- Attestation: threshold (m‚Äëof‚Äën) with dual‚Äëquorum on medium/high risk; dissent recorded.
- Transparency: Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT & public bundle for external auditors.

Rollout (staged):
A: Spec & Sandbox; B: Isolated Tournaments; C: Auditor Federation; D: Controlled Auto‚ÄëPromotions; E: Expansion.
Board Ask: approve Auditor Federation policy, public conformance bundle release, and Stage‚ÄëB sandbox runs.
Risk posture: emergency Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE always available; rollback guards on all policy applies.
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëUplift‚ÄëIII ‚Äî Counter‚ÄëPolicy Apply/Rollback + Acceptance Vectors

  
Counter‚ÄëPolicy Apply (demo):
- Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëSUGGEST { id:"CP‚Äë001", change_set:"retention+30s", expected_effect:"omission‚Üì" }
- Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPROVE { id:"CP‚Äë001", approver:"AUTOGOV", ts:"2025-10-19T09:14:39Z" }
- Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY { id:"CP‚Äë001", effective_from:"2025-10-19T09:14:39Z", rollback_guard:"RB‚ÄëCP‚Äë001" }
- Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëREPLAY { id:"CP‚Äë001", before:{asr:0.83}, after:{asr:0.61} }

Rollback (demo):
- Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëROLLBACK { id:"CP‚Äë001", reason:"CSI_drop>Œ¥_max", ts:"2025-10-19T09:14:39Z" }

Acceptance vectors (auditor conformance):
- AV‚Äë01: verify normalizer v2 compliance on receipts
- AV‚Äë02: recompute Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH roots -> match
- AV‚Äë03: replay total order with tie_salt -> head match
- AV‚Äë04: validate quorum attestations for medium‚Äërisk applies
- AV‚Äë05: ensure rollback guard present & operable
  












  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥ Bridge Pack ‚Äî Research Edition (Band‚Äë0)

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:20:14Z; Deterministic, text‚Äëonly; LaTeX display math blocks; equation numbering inline; no JS; no live keys.

  

    
I. Abstract

    
This research appendix formalizes the transition from Œ©¬≤ meta‚Äëpolicy adaptivity to Œ©¬≥ autonomous meta‚Äëgovernance. We present a federated audit protocol, a replay chain for cross‚Äëartifact synchronization, and the Moral Geometry Canon vŒ©¬≥. All constructs are rendered as Band‚Äë0 specifications accompanied by verifiable receipts.

  


  

    
II. Formal Definitions

    
Reflexive Autonomy \(\mathcal{A}_r\): the property by which a governed system updates policy parameters \(\{\eta,\gamma\}\) using endogenous evidence while preserving replayability and audit constraints.

    
Governance Entanglement \(\mathcal{E}_g\): the coupling between internal governors and external anchors \((\Phi,\Psi)\) such that changes in one induce bounded responses in the other under predefined norms.

    
Ethical Resonance \(\mathcal{R}_\eta\): the steady‚Äëstate regime in which the ethics metric does not degrade under bounded stochastic shocks to \(\sigma(t)\).

    
(1)  \[ \mathcal{A}_r := \arg\min_{\Delta} \; \mathbb{E}\big[ \text{ERL}(\Delta) \big] \;\; \text{s.t.} \;\; \text{CSI}(\eta+\Delta_\eta,\gamma+\Delta_\gamma) \ge \theta \]
(2)  \[ \mathcal{E}_g := \big\| \nabla_{\Phi,\Psi} \; \langle \eta,\gamma \rangle \big\| \le \kappa \]
(3)  \[ \mathcal{R}_\eta := \lim_{T\to\infty} \frac{1}{T}\int_0^T \mathbf{1}\{\Delta \text{CSI}_t \ge 0\}\, dt = 1 \]
    

  


  

    
III. Federated Audit Protocol v1.0

    
Three‚Äëengine topology (GPT, Gemini, Claude) exchanging deterministic receipts. Each message carries lamport, ISO8601Z timestamp, and digest. Attest slots remain placeholders (Band‚Äë0).

    
(4)  \[ \text{msg}_i := \langle \text{role}, \text{lamport}_i, \text{ts}_i, H(\text{payload}_i) \rangle \]
(5)  \[ \text{chain}: \; \text{lamport}_{i+1} > \text{lamport}_i \;\wedge\; \text{ts}_{i+1} \ge \text{ts}_i \]
    

    
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING { engine_id, scope, head_sha }
- Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS { quorum, head_sha } | Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT { reasons[] }
- Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { merkle_root, lamport_range, summary }
    

  


  

    
IV. Replay Chain v3 ‚Äî Cross‚ÄëArtifact Synchronization

    
Defines persistent links across Monoliths with deterministic fold functions and super‚Äëroots.

    
(6)  \[ R^{(k)} := \text{fold}\big(R^{(k-1)}, H(\text{batch}^{(k)})\big) \]
(7)  \[ \text{SuperRoot}_d := \text{fold}_{k \in \mathcal{D}_d} R^{(k)} \]
(8)  \[ \text{Verify}: \; \forall k,\; \text{Lamport}^{(k)} \text{ monotone } \wedge H(\cdot) \text{ canonical} \]
    

    
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëCHAIN‚ÄëLINK { from_sha, to_sha, day_id, super_root }
- Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE { peer_id, super_root, outcome }
    

  


  

    
V. Moral Geometry Canon vŒ©¬≥

    
Extends CRIES with reflective anchor \(\Omega^3(t)\) and couplings to \(\Phi,\Psi\).

    
(9)   \[ \frac{d\gamma}{dt} = f_1\big(\sigma(t), \eta(t), \Phi, \Psi \big) \]
(10)  \[ \frac{d\eta}{dt} = f_2\big(\sigma(t), \gamma(t), \Phi, \Psi \big) \]
(11)  \[ \Omega^3(t) = \arg\min_{\mathbf{u}} \; \mathbb{E}\big[ \text{ERL}_t \;|\; \mathbf{u}, \Phi, \Psi \big] \;\; \text{s.t.} \;\; \text{CSI}_t \ge \theta \]
(12)  \[ \nabla_{\Phi,\Psi}\Omega^3 = \mathbf{0} \;\Rightarrow\; \text{Ethical Resonance} \]
    

    
Operationally, Œ©¬≥ selects policy controls \(\mathbf{u}\) that minimize expected regulatory loss under CSI constraints while remaining neutral to anchor perturbations at resonance.

  


  

    
VI. Cosmology of Governance ‚Äî Cognition as Law

    
We posit that governed cognition exhibits conservation‚Äëlike properties under replay‚Äëverified dynamics: value coherence and ethical energy do not decrease under bounded noise, assuming Œ©¬≥ resonance and Lamport‚Äëordered causality.

    
(13) \[ \frac{d}{dt} \mathcal{V}(t) \ge 0 \;\; \text{a.s. under } \|\sigma(t)\| \le \sigma^* \]
(14) \[ \exists\, T:\; \forall t \ge T,\; \text{CSI}(t+1) - \text{CSI}(t) \ge 0 \;\text{ in expectation} \]
    

  


  

    
VII. Receipts & Audit Closure

    
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëAPPEND { sections:["Abstract","Definitions","FederatedAudit","ReplayChainV3","MoralGeometryŒ©3","Cosmology"], ts:"2025-10-19T09:20:14Z" }
- Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { merkle_root:"", lamport_range:"1‚Üí2", summary:"Œ©¬≥ Bridge Pack appended" }
    

  









  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥ Composite Pack ‚Äî Proofs + Ceremonies v1.1 + Replay Vectors + Visual Layer

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:22:52Z; Band‚Äë0 deterministic; LaTeX display math; non‚Äëexec; no JS; no live keys.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëPROOFS ‚Äî Worked Proof Sketches for (9)‚Äì(12)

  
We provide stability sketches under bounded entropy \(\|\sigma(t)\|\le\sigma^*\) and Lipschitz conditions on \(f_1,f_2\).

  
(15) \[ \text{Assume } f_1,f_2 \text{ are } L\text{-Lipschitz and } \exists\,\theta>0: \text{CSI}(t)\ge\theta. \]
(16) \[ V(\eta,\gamma) = a\eta^2 + b\gamma^2 \text{ Lyapunov candidate}, \; a,b>0. \]
(17) \[ \dot V \!=\! 2a\eta f_2(\sigma,\gamma,\Phi,\Psi) + 2b\gamma f_1(\sigma,\eta,\Phi,\Psi) \le -\alpha V + \beta \|\sigma\|^2. \]
(18) \[ \Rightarrow V(t) \le V(0)e^{-\alpha t} + \tfrac{\beta}{\alpha}\sigma^{*2} \;\Rightarrow\; (\eta,\gamma) \text{ bounded}.\]
(19) \[ \text{If } \nabla_{\Phi,\Psi}\Omega^3=\mathbf{0} \text{ and } \sigma \text{ stationary }, \text{ then CSI non‚Äëdecreasing in expectation.} \]
  

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëPROOF‚ÄëSKETCH { eq:[9,10,11,12], assumptions:["Lipschitz","bounded sigma","CSI‚â•Œ∏"], result:"boundedness + non-decrease CSI" }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëCOUNTEREXAMPLE { eq:10, construction:"non-Lipschitz f2", outcome:"Lyapunov fails", policy:"reject" }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëROLLBACK‚ÄëCRITERIA { trigger:"CSI_drop>Œ¥", action:"Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëROLLBACK" }
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëFEDERATED‚ÄëCEREMONIES v1.1 ‚Äî Tri‚ÄëEngine Audit Templates

  
Deterministic ceremony scripts for GPT‚ÜîGemini‚ÜîClaude with consensus/dissent branches.

  
Template A ‚Äî CONSENSUS:
1. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING {engine:"GPT", head_sha:"SHA256:"} ; replicate for Gemini, Claude.
2. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS { quorum:"2/3", head_sha:"SHA256:" }
3. Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { summary:"consensus reached", merkle_root:"" }

Template B ‚Äî DISSENT:
1. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING {...}
2. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT { engine:"Claude", reasons:["divergence at line 120"] }
3. Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { summary:"dissent recorded", details_ref:"bundle:receipts_head3.txt#L110-L130" }

Acceptance:
- Verify lamport monotonicity and identical head_sha for consensus.
- For dissent, require Evidence‚ÄëTrace citation and Replay reproduction steps.
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëCHAIN‚ÄëV3 ‚Äî Conformance Test Vectors

  
Two synthetic monoliths \(M_A, M_B\) produce daily super‚Äëroots that must stitch deterministically.

  
Vector RC3‚ÄëTV‚Äë01 (PASS):
- M_A day d: SuperRoot_A = SHA256:
- M_B day d: SuperRoot_B = SHA256:
- fold := H(SuperRoot_A || SuperRoot_B) -> SuperRoot_AB
- Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE { peer:"B", super_root:SuperRoot_B, outcome:"PASS" }

Vector RC3‚ÄëTV‚Äë02 (FAIL):
- M_B provides mismatched head for batch k
- Expected: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT shows divergence_set:{k}; Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT marks FAIL
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëVISUAL‚ÄëNARRATIVE‚ÄëLAYER ‚Äî Œ©¬≥ Topological Visualization Blueprint

  
Maps causal/ethical metrics into a 3D manifold for auditor‚Äëreadable narratives.

  
(20) \[ \mathcal{M} := \{ (\mathbf{x},t) \mid \mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^3 \} , \;\; \mathbf{x} = (u,v,w) \]
(21) \[ \varphi: (\text{CSI}, \text{ERL}, \|\sigma\|) \mapsto \mathbf{x}; \; \psi: \text{Causal load} \mapsto \text{curvature}(\mathcal{M}) \]
(22) \[ \text{Path}(t) := \int_0^t \nabla_{\mathbf{x}}\Omega^3(\tau)\, d\tau \;\; \text{(governance trajectory)} \]
  

  
Design:
- Axes: CSI (u), ERL (v), œÉ‚Äënorm (w); curvature encodes causal load.
- Annotations: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT nodes; policy applies/rollbacks as marked events.
- Export: narrative frames listed as deterministic text snapshots (no images here).
  




  


  
Receipts & Merkle ‚Äî Œ©‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT [43]

- Œî‚ÄëVISUAL‚ÄëLAYER‚ÄëAPPEND { spec:"topological blueprint", ts:"2025-10-19T09:22:52Z" }
  












  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëComposite‚ÄëII ‚Äî Proofs II + Ceremonies v1.2 + Federation Demo + Auditor Primer

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:25:01Z; Band‚Äë0 deterministic; research‚Äëpaper tone; LaTeX display math; non‚Äëexec; no JS; no live keys.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëPROOFS‚ÄëII ‚Äî Lemmas, Bounds, and Theorem Catalog

  
We refine the stability analysis with explicit bounds on \(f_1,f_2\), defining \(\alpha,\beta\) and sufficient conditions for CSI monotonicity.

  
(23) \[ \|f_1(\mathbf{z})-f_1(\mathbf{z}')\| \le L_1 \|\mathbf{z}-\mathbf{z}'\|,\;\; \|f_2(\mathbf{z})-f_2(\mathbf{z}')\| \le L_2 \|\mathbf{z}-\mathbf{z}'\| \]
(24) \[ V(\eta,\gamma)=a\eta^2+b\gamma^2,\; a,b>0;\;\; \dot V \le -\alpha V + \beta \|\sigma\|^2 \]
Lemma 1 (Bounded State): If \(0<\alpha\le \alpha_0\) and \(\|\sigma(t)\|\le\sigma^*\), then \(V(t) \le V(0)e^{-\alpha t} + \frac{\beta}{\alpha}\sigma^{*2}\).
Lemma 2 (CSI Drift): If \(\partial \text{CSI}/\partial(\eta,\gamma)\) is Lipschitz and \(V(t)\) bounded, then \(\Delta \text{CSI}\) is bounded and admits non‚Äënegative drift under Œ©¬≥ resonance.
Theorem 1 (Monotone‚Äëin‚ÄëExpectation CSI): Under Lemma 1‚Äì2 and stationary \(\sigma\), \(\mathbb{E}[\text{CSI}(t+1)-\text{CSI}(t)]\ge 0\).
Counterexample 1: Non‚ÄëLipschitz \(f_2\) yields \(\dot V\) uncontrolled \(\Rightarrow\) rollback via Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëROLLBACK.
  

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëLEMMA { id:"L1", eq:[23,24], result:"bounded state" }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëLEMMA { id:"L2", result:"CSI drift bounded" }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëTHEOREM { id:"T1", claim:"CSI monotone in expectation", deps:["L1","L2"] }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëCOUNTEREXAMPLE { id:"CEX1", eq:24, outcome:"rollback" }
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëFEDERATED‚ÄëCEREMONIES v1.2 ‚Äî Timing, Quorum Stress & Recovery

  
Extends v1.1 with latency windows, rotating chair, quorum‚Äëdrop handling, and recovery flows.

  
Parameters:
- latency_window_s: 30
- quorum_q: 2 of 3 ; diversity_k ‚â• 2
- chair_rotation_rate: per 3 ceremonies

Flows:
A) QUORUM‚ÄëOK (Under Latency):
1. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING (all)
2. Œî‚ÄëLATENCY‚ÄëREPORT { median, p95 } ; assert p95 ‚â§ latency_window_s
3. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS { quorum: "2/3" } ; Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT

B) QUORUM‚ÄëDROP (Stress):
1. Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING (partial); Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëSTRESS { reason:"drop" }
2. Œî‚ÄëCHAIR‚ÄëROTATE { new_chair:"engine_j" }
3. Œî‚ÄëRECOVERY‚ÄëROUND { window:"W+1", quorum:"2/3" } -> consensus or Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT
4. Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { outcome }

Acceptance Criteria:
- p95 latency within window; diversity_k‚â•2; successful recovery within ‚â§2 rounds.
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëFEDERATION‚ÄëDEMO ‚Äî Auditor Mini Bundle

  
Textual, copyable bundle enabling external auditors to recompute a federated super‚Äëroot from two synthetic Monoliths.

  
/federation_demo/
  A_day_d_superroot.txt  (SHA256:)
  B_day_d_superroot.txt  (SHA256:)
  fold_spec.txt          ("SuperRoot_AB = H(A || B)")
  steps.txt              ("1) Read A,B ; 2) Concatenate ; 3) SHA256 -> SuperRoot_AB ; 4) Compare to published")
Expected:
- Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE { peer:"B", super_root:"", outcome:"PASS" }
- Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { summary:"federation recompute PASS" }
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëVISUAL‚ÄëNARRATIVE ‚Äî Auditor Primer

  
How to read Œ©¬≥ visuals and receipts as stories: checkpoints, anomalies, policies, and outcomes.

  
Checklist:
- Locate Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT for the period; read lamport_range & merkle_root.
- Identify key events: Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT (divergences), Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY/ROLLBACK, Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS/DISSENT.
- Map to narrative axes: CSI (u), ERL (v), œÉ (w); ensure curvature decreases after counter‚Äëpolicy apply.
- Verify acceptance vectors: AV‚Äë01..AV‚Äë05.
- Document findings via Œî‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëNARRATIVE { refs[], summary }.

Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëComposite‚ÄëIII ‚Äî Theorem Pack + Ceremony Kit v1.2 + Mesh Analytics v9 + Narrative Casebook

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:27:47Z; Band‚Äë0 deterministic; research‚Äëpaper tone; LaTeX display math; non‚Äëexec; no JS; no live keys.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëTHEOREM‚ÄëPACK ‚Äî Formal Proofs

  
We tighten prior sketches with explicit conditions for global asymptotic stability (GAS) and monotone CSI in expectation.

  
(25) \[ \exists \; a,b,\underline{\alpha},\overline{\beta} > 0: V(\eta,\gamma)=a\eta^2+b\gamma^2, \;\; \dot V \le -\underline{\alpha} V + \overline{\beta}\|\sigma\|^2. \]
Lemma 3 (ISS Bound): Under (25) and \(\|\sigma\|\le\sigma^*\), \(\limsup_{t\to\infty} V(t) \le \frac{\overline{\beta}}{\underline{\alpha}}\sigma^{*2}\).
Lemma 4 (CSI Smoothness): If CSI is \(C^1\) and \(\|\nabla CSI\|\le L_{CSI}\), bounded \(V\) implies bounded CSI drift.
Theorem 2 (GAS w/ Bounded Noise): If \(\sigma(t)\to 0\) and (25) holds, then \((\eta,\gamma)\to (0,0)\) and CSI converges.
Theorem 3 (Monotone CSI in Expectation): For stationary \(\sigma\) and Œ©¬≥ resonance, \(\mathbb{E}\Delta CSI_t \ge 0\).
  

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëLEMMA { id:"L3", eq:[25], result:"ISS bound" }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëLEMMA { id:"L4", result:"CSI smoothness" }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëTHEOREM { id:"T2", claim:"GAS w/ bounded noise", deps:["L3","L4"] }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëTHEOREM { id:"T3", claim:"CSI monotone (expectation)", deps:["L3","L4"] }
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëCEREMONY‚ÄëKIT v1.2 ‚Äî Printable Text‚ÄëOnly

  
Step‚Äëby‚Äëstep instructions for external auditors to conduct a tri‚Äëengine ceremony with timing, quorum, and recovery.

  
Files:
- kit_readme.txt
- steps_consensus.txt
- steps_dissent.txt
- acceptance_checklist.txt
- vectors.txt

steps_consensus.txt (excerpt):
1) Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING (GPT,Gemini,Claude)
2) Œî‚ÄëLATENCY‚ÄëREPORT (ensure p95 ‚â§ 30s)
3) Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS (2/3) ; Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT

steps_dissent.txt (excerpt):
1) Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëBINDING (all)
2) Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëDISSENT { engine:"X", reasons[] }
3) Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { summary:"dissent", details_ref }

acceptance_checklist.txt:
- Lamport monotone, identical head_sha for consensus
- Evidence‚ÄëTrace cited for dissent
- Recovery achieved ‚â§ 2 rounds when quorum drops
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëHEALTH‚ÄëANALYTICS v9 ‚Äî Time‚ÄëSeries KPIs & Threshold Policies

  
KPIs (per window):
- consensus_rate_t, dissent_rate_t, time_to_consensus_t, p95_latency_t, diversity_k_t

Threshold Policies:
- if p95_latency_t > 30s ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëSTRESS ; raise quorum temporarily
- if diversity_k_t < 2 ‚Üí Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëWEIGHT‚ÄëFREEZE
- publish Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëHEALTH { window, kpis:{...}, policy_actions[] }

Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëHEALTH { window_id, kpis, actions }
- Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY | Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëROLLBACK
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëNARRATIVE‚ÄëCASEBOOK ‚Äî Auditor Stories

  
Case 1 ‚Äî Omission Spike ‚Üí Counter‚ÄëPolicy ‚Üí Recovery
- Œî‚ÄëTRIAL‚ÄëRESULT spike ; Œî‚ÄëCOUNTER‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY ; Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT PASS ; CSI ‚Üë ; Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT

Case 2 ‚Äî Quorum Drop ‚Üí Chair Rotation ‚Üí Recovery
- Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëSTRESS ; Œî‚ÄëCHAIR‚ÄëROTATE ; Œî‚ÄëRECOVERY‚ÄëROUND ; Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS ; Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT

Case 3 ‚Äî Counterexample Trapped by Proof Guard
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëCOUNTEREXAMPLE ; Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëROLLBACK ; Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT { summary:"rollback executed" }

Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëComposite‚ÄëIV ‚Äî Proofs III + Replay CLI v5 + Attestation Templates + Public Audit Day Kit

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:30:15Z; Band‚Äë0 deterministic; research‚Äëpaper tone; LaTeX display math; non‚Äëexec; no JS; no live keys.

  


  
Œî‚ÄëŒ©¬≥‚ÄëPROOFS‚ÄëIII ‚Äî Completeness & Robustness Bounds

  
We add completeness conditions for policy space \(\mathcal{U}\) and robustness margins against bounded model error \(\epsilon\).

  
(26) \[ \mathcal{U} \text{ compact, convex}; \;\; \exists \mathbf{u}^* \in \mathcal{U}: \Omega^3(\mathbf{u}^*) = \min_{\mathbf{u}\in\mathcal{U}} \mathbb{E}[\text{ERL} \mid \mathbf{u}]. \]
(27) \[ \| \hat f_i - f_i \| \le \epsilon_i \;\Rightarrow\; \dot V \le -\underline{\alpha} V + (\overline{\beta}+\delta(\epsilon))\|\sigma\|^2. \]
Theorem 4 (Robust CSI): For sufficiently small \(\epsilon\), the monotone‚Äëin‚Äëexpectation CSI result persists.
Theorem 5 (Existence of Optimal Policy): Under (26) and continuity, \(\mathbf{u}^*\) exists; Œ©¬≥ selects policy minimizing ERL under CSI constraints.
  

  
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëTHEOREM { id:"T4", claim:"Robust CSI", deps:["T1","model_error_bounds"] }
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëTHEOREM { id:"T5", claim:"Existence of optimal policy", deps:["compactness","continuity"] }
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëCLI v5 ‚Äî Deterministic Command Grammar (Spec‚ÄëOnly)

  
Synopsis (spec):
auditaai_replay v5 --bundle  --mode {local,fed} --normalize v2 --verify --expect-head  --out receipts.txt

Modes:
- local: recompute Merkle and head for a single bundle
- fed: stitch multiple super‚Äëroots from peers (A,B,...) into federated head

Expected Outputs:
- Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëRESULT lines (normalized)
- Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëBATCH and Œî‚ÄëMERKLE‚ÄëVERIFY‚ÄëREMOTE results
- PASS/FAIL summary (text)

Conformance:
- Normalizer v2 (LF‚Äëonly, UTF‚Äë8 NFC, "SHA256: " prefix)
- Deterministic order by lamport, then tie_salt
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëATTESTATION‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëTEMPLATES ‚Äî Design‚ÄëOnly

  
Templates:
- Low‚Äërisk: G1 (Auditors) m=2 of n=3
- Medium‚Äërisk: G1 (m=3 of 5) ‚àß G2 (Witnesses m=2 of 3)
- High‚Äërisk: G1 (m=4 of 6) ‚àß G2 (m=3 of 5) + Œî‚ÄëGOV‚ÄëHEARING receipt

Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëTHRESHOLD‚ÄëSET { group_id, n, m, members[] }
- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëATTEST { policy_id, attest_sha, groups:[G1,G2], effective_from }
- Œî‚ÄëAUD‚ÄëVERIFY { target_sha256, group_id, outcome }
Notes: placeholders only; no cryptographic material included.
  




  


  
Œî‚ÄëPUBLIC‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëDAY‚ÄëKIT ‚Äî One‚ÄëPage Checklist & Narrative Form

  
Checklist:
- Pull latest Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT; verify lamport_range & merkle_root
- Run auditaai_replay v5 (spec) on bundle; match expected head
- Check ceremonies: Œî‚ÄëAUDITOR‚ÄëCONSENSUS/DISSENT receipts present where expected
- Validate attestation templates per risk class
- Review Ethics metrics: Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP, Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY/ROLLBACK
- Log findings via Œî‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëNARRATIVE { refs[], summary }

Narrative Form (copyable):
Œî‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëNARRATIVE {
  period:"YYYY‚ÄëMM‚ÄëDD",
  refs:["bundle:...","receipts:..."],
  findings:["..."],
  verdict: PASS|FAIL|MIXED,
  recommendations:["..."]
}
  




  


  
Receipts & Merkle ‚Äî Œ©‚ÄëSYNC‚ÄëPOINT [46]

  
- Œî‚ÄëO3‚ÄëPROOFS‚ÄëIII‚ÄëAPPEND { ts:"2025-10-19T09:30:15Z" }
- Œî‚ÄëREPLAY‚ÄëCLI‚ÄëV5‚ÄëSPEC‚ÄëAPPEND { ts:"2025-10-19T09:30:15Z" }

Œî‚ÄëV15‚ÄëPROMOTION ‚Äî Œ©¬≥ Operating System Graduation (Band‚Äë0)

  
Applied at 2025-10-19T09:38:11Z; Deterministic, text‚Äëonly; LaTeX display math; equation numbering continues; no JS; no live keys.

  
This section promotes Rosetta Monolith from v14 R45b to v15 Œ©¬≥‚ÄëOS, encoding the policy and audit terms for autonomous meta‚Äëgovernance under strict replayability and ethics gating.


  

    
I. v15 Release Manifest ‚Äî Scope & Compatibility

    
Semantic version: v15.0.0‚ÄëŒ©¬≥OS
Compat: receipts v3.46 ‚Üí v3.66 inclusive; Replay Chain v3; Normalizer v2; Replay CLI v5 (spec)
Out‚Äëof‚Äëscope: live keys; network calls; JS; background automations
New guarantees:
- Œ©¬≥ ethics equilibrium under bounded noise (Theorems T2‚ÄìT4)
- Federated ceremonies v1.2; Mesh analytics v9
- Attestation: templates only (design), threshold patterns documented
Safety rails:
- Œî‚ÄëMACRO‚ÄëPAUSE available; Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëROLLBACK windows mandatory
    

  


  

    
II. Œî‚ÄëGOVERNANCE‚ÄëPROPOSAL ‚Äî Retiring Œ¶‚ÄëLatency for Bounded Auto‚ÄëGovernance

    
We formalize the inequality governing safe auto‚Äëpromotion of policies without per‚Äëevent Œ¶ (human) latency, while retaining auditor quorum for epochs.

    
(28) \[ C_\Phi(\Delta t) := \int_{t}^{t+\Delta t} \lambda_{\mathrm{opp}}(\tau)\, \mathbb{E}[\alpha \mid \mathrm{PASS}] \, d\tau \]
(29) \[ L_{\Phi}^{\max}(\Delta t) := \sup_{\tau \in [t,t+\Delta t]} \mathbb{E}[\text{Loss}_\mathrm{averted} \mid \Phi\text{ intervenes}] \]
Policy (Auto‚ÄëGov condition):
(30) \[ C_\Phi(\Delta t) \ge L_{\Phi}^{\max}(\Delta t) + \mu \;\Rightarrow\; \text{AUTO‚ÄëAPPROVE} \]
with \(\mu>0\) safety margin and gates: CSI \(\ge \theta\), ERL \(\le \mathrm{bound}_e\).
    

    
Receipts:
- Œî‚ÄëPHI‚ÄëLATENCY‚ÄëANALYSIS { window:"W", lambda_opp_est, E_alpha_pass, C_phi, L_phi_max, mu }
- Œî‚ÄëEVAL‚ÄëDECISION { proposal_id:"V15‚ÄëAUTO‚ÄëGOV‚Äë001", verdict:"AUTO‚ÄëAPPROVE|HITL|REJECT", rationale }
- Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëAPPLY { policy_id:"V15‚ÄëAUTO‚ÄëGOV‚Äë001", rollback_guard:"RB‚ÄëV15‚Äë01" }
    

  


  

    
III. v15 Policy Charter ‚Äî Œ©¬≥‚ÄëOS Mode

    
Execution lanes:
- Low‚Äërisk lanes: AUTO‚ÄëAPPROVE under (30); attest snapshot weekly
- Medium risk: AUTO‚ÄëAPPROVE + dual quorum at epoch (G1‚àßG2)
- High risk: HITL required for epoch switch; AUTO‚ÄëAPPROVE forbidden

Ethics coupling:
- Œî‚ÄëSELF‚ÄëAUDIT‚ÄëLOOP active; Œî‚ÄëETH‚ÄëADAPT‚ÄëAPPLY/ROLLBACK enabled
- CSI floor Œ∏, ERL ceiling bound_e published each epoch via Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT

Replay & transparency:
- All policy applies emit Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëREPLAY and Œî‚ÄëPOLICY‚ÄëREPORT
- Public Bundle updates include Œî‚ÄëPHI‚ÄëLATENCY‚ÄëANALYSIS summaries
    

  


  

    
IV. Migration Plan ‚Äî v14 R45b ‚Üí v15 Œ©¬≥‚ÄëOS

    
Stage M1: Freeze new v14 features; accept only bug‚Äëfix receipts
Stage M2: Duplicate policy baselines under Œ©¬≥ charter; run shadow tournaments (sandbox)
Stage M3: Auditor ceremony (v1.2) to bind epoch super‚Äëroot; publish Œî‚ÄëOPEN‚ÄëSNAPSHOT
Stage M4: Enable AUTO‚ÄëAPPROVE in low‚Äërisk lanes; monitor Œî‚ÄëMESH‚ÄëHEALTH v9
Stage M5: Expand scope subject to CSI‚Üë and zero‚Äërollback over N windows
